name: The Garden Cafe
address: Assumption Rd, Blackpool, Cork, T23 FDT4, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Dana Fülles", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Such a wonderful Café, the staff is lovely and the food is too. With all the trees and flowers it's just beautiful to sit outside and enjoy the sunshine with a coffee.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Zarko Roncevic", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "This little coffee shop is a total hidden gem in the city, surrounded by greenery and super relaxing. The staff are really friendly, and it's perfect whether you’re soaking up the sun outside or staying cozy indoors on a rainy day. My fiancé and I had an amazing breakfast here on a sunny morning, and the whole vibe was just perfect. Plus, it’s nonprofit and all about horticulture, which makes it even more special. Definitely worth checking out!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Moriah Hilden", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Okay, wow. The exact place I needed. Well, I think it’s the exact place a lot of people could use. The sun was out and I needed to soak it in, but needed to write, and was hungry. So with the full natural lighting, the airy inspiring space, the yummy menu, the warm service - I was happy the whole time and left wishing I could come back again and again. Thank you!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "alexios danatsidis", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "This gentleman can easily make a difference in this world .Gentle polite and charming . Well done I am involved in hospitality industry the last 21 years and I can say easily that this Gentleman can be teaching the young generation how to treat and respect people .", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "F Whizzer", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Been here twice. Lovely Victorian greenhouse set up as cafe. Very good value for money. Greenery around you and fab view of northside.Had a soup and sandwich. Very nice and decent amount. Sandwich wasn't your skinny stuff you get in lots of places. Proper sandwich.\nNot much parking at all. Better on foot if possible. But worth it.\nThey even give you blankets in winter. It is a greenhouse but heaters also. Definitely return.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rich Dietz", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Amazing location and atmosphere.  Food was great and felt like you were away from the city.  Highly recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jerry Larkin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely green setting, very friendly staff and gorgeous,fresh,healthy food from the allotment. Totally echo other comments that it's an oasis in Blackpool!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Patricia Crean", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "Love this lol cafe isolated out of sight off Blackpool, gorgeous spot for lunch when the sun is shining. But I enjoy the cafe in all weathers, defo worth checking out. Great gardens of all sorts flowers, fruits, veg & herbs. A beautiful variety and staff are very pleasant", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Linda Moynihan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Staff were friendly. You can sit inside the greenhouse or outside. Went for breakfast €16 for two teas, two servings of toast for kids, toasted sandwich with salad & a bacon sandwich it was lovely. There was little play area for kids. A small bit up we saw chickens & rabbits kids were delighted.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Pat Jones", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 days ago", "review_text": "Met for a cuppa, lovely place", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Oval
address: 25 S Main St, Centre, Cork, T12 Y15D, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Swati Verma", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Yet another gem in Cork. The pub has a very bohemian feel to it. We found a cosy corner here and enjoyed spending lovely pints for beamish here. If you're in Cork city for a day or two, this one's a must visit!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Éimear Barrett", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 days ago", "review_text": "Nice pub. Good music. Not the best beer selection. Used to have real candles on each table with wax spilling over the bottle they were in, now changed for fake candles. It's a pity, it was part of what made it a cosy pub.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eilidh Fraser", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "I walked in slightly nervously, because it was so dark initially, but once my eyes adjusted I loved it. A real traditional pub, full of character and nooks.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Katherine D", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Great spot for a Beamish on the historical pub list. Cozy and friendly vibe.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "A J (Lexi)", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Maybe we came too late on a Saturday. It was so busy and the entryway is a pinch-point. This place will give you all types of anxiety. We were recommended by a local...and I adore Beamish, so I had really hoped to try this location but our timing was off apparently. Also, a guy had a pee-pee outside around the corner by the construction fence. Kinda funny, far from the worst to happen in a city.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Matt Barton", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "We rocked into Cork for a day, wandering around we spotted The Oval off the plain main shopping strip. Oh what a relief to find this grungy indy gem. 😊
With a great relaxed vibe (each spot candlelit), plenty of beers on tap, including an alternative to Guinness (Beamish Irish stout) this is a great place to come and chat.
A great place to start your Cork Heritage Pub Tour.
Final tip: when going to the bathrooms upstairs later at night, be mindful of the spooks in their attic.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tom Miles", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Really nice Ambiente, really cool bartenders. Comforting and good music. Not too loud to talk with your friends/date but loud enough to talk smooth about spicy things. Im probably a lil drunk cause they serve Local beer, And its really tasty.

Definitely a great Pub you have to check out in Cork!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Manish Kamble", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Good place to hangout and have few pints! Good crowd, lively place, vintage vibe, Cool wall arts!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Thomas Thornton", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "The Oval is another one of Cork's iconic pubs and its one of the cozy ones!
Located on the corner of S Main St and Tucky St., its a pub with a unique Oval shaped ceiling in Cork City center!
The pub has a wonderful ambienceve and the crowd that frequents the bar also gives it a certain charm!

The Staff:
The staff are friendly and welcoming as soon as you walk in the door!
They are very attentive and will serve you quickly!

Drink Selection:
They have a great selection of beer on tap and they serve all three major stouts!
Of which I chose a pint of their delicious Guinness draft!
A lot of people were ordering the Murphy's and Beamish aswell so I can only imagine that they are also good aswell!

Layout:
The layout of the bar is kind of split into two rooms. The first room has the feature for which it owes its namesake, the Oval shaped ceiling.
The second room has more seating and is to the rear of the premises. The bar is located in this room along with some seats.
The second room is smaller and is located towards the back. The main seating area is in this room and the stairs to the toilet is also here.
The bar has access to the seating area on Tucky St. which offers access to people who use wheelchairs.

Decor:
The pub is decorated with a lot of wood and with little quirky details and morabilia as well as little plaques with historic details, etc.

Overall Ipinion:
The Oval is an old bar in the City Center where time moves a little slower. They have a great selection of beers to choose from and I highly recommend stopping by for a beautiful pint of Guinness or drink of your choosing and have a chat with friends!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Damien Mc Sweeney", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Old Rustic bar in South Main Street, the City Center of Cork. Across from the old Beamish and Crawford Brewary, there's a lot of history in the area. There's a younger crowd frequenting it now, and they have some seating outside. The staff are nice as is the atmosphere.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Badger & Dodo Roastery Outlet
address: 11 Barrack St, Cork, T12 T8YV, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Zoe Serodio", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 days ago", "review_text": "We did a Barista course with Aaron, and it was definitely worth the value! The small group classes allowed us to actually learn and practice as much as we wanted, which we truly appreciated. We’ll definitely recommend it to someone interested in the coffee industry and looking to get started somewhere :)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kalinda Link", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "We were getting our laundry done at the Laundry Basket across the street. Popped in here for a coffee and was the espresso ever fabulous! The next day when we came back to pick up our laundry the barista took the time to warm up my ceramic mug since we were staying in. Absolutely wonderful! Highly recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin Byrne", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Very few places in Cork where you can genuinely purchase quality coffee. There are a handful of good producers and roasters in Cork.  This is definitely one of the best if you don't want the acrid tastes all too common amongst Cork cafes.  This cafe forces the others to up their game.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "kieran Kenneally", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Nice small coffee shop with a small but cosy sitting area. Good music playing in the background, toilets are clean and the service and Coffee are excellent.
Coffee such a dark creamy colour before I put in some milk. You just know it's good before you even taste it.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Apriry Ly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Badger & Dodo Coffee Roasters, Cork: Absolutely Amazing Coffee!

If you're serious about your coffee, then Badger & Dodo Coffee Roasters in Cork is the one to get your fix with these folks who are passionate about their craft, and it truly shines through in every cup.

The coffee here is simply **amazing**. Whether you're after a perfectly pulled espresso, a silky-smooth flat white, or a beautifully balanced filter coffee, they consistently deliver. The beans are expertly roasted, resulting in rich, complex flavors that are a real treat for the palate. It's clear they source high-quality beans and treat them with the respect they deserve.

Beyond the fantastic coffee, we tried them when they popped up at the Midleton farmers market. Highly, highly recommended for anyone seeking a truly exceptional coffee experience in Cork!", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "tomas allen", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Just went in for coffee. The staff member was friendly and courteous. Nice coffee. Sat outside to drink it. Price of  a latte  @ €3.90 but not a bad size cup . Nice place to call again. Didn't get any food there.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "CillianmfingHannon", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Really nice coffee here, some of the best in the city!
2.80 for an americano as well with a keep cup!
Alexa has such great customer service as well she makes everyone feel welcome and at home.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eileen Dineen-Marples", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Rebecca made me the most delicious, thick, creamy and flavoursome coconut mocha which I had with a vegan “ kind” chocolate nut bar. Best mocha for a long time! I will be back soon ✔️thanks 🙏 …", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michela Lagorio", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "I always stop here for my morning coffee when I have time as it's delicious. The staff is always super friendly as well. Thank you !", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Saoirs A", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "I really love their coffee. Always delicious, always a friendly service. And I love to support a local business, however I’m dropping a star because today it cost me €4.40 for an oat milk cappuccino, that’s €1 more than a lot of other places in Cork. I just can’t afford to spend that much on a coffee. I will go here again as a treat but in general I can get delicious coffee elsewhere for cheaper. Other than that I couldn’t fault the place.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Floury Apron
address: 3 Chapel Lane Row, Ballincollig, Cork, P31 Y324, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Michael Outlaw", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "I have been trying for years to find a bakery in Cork that could prepare a southern-style caramel cake, a flavour of cake my wife loves because it reminds her of her childhood in the US. Most bakeries I contacted turned me down immediately because it would mean trying an unfamiliar recipe. At The Floury Apron, they not only took on my custom order, but stayed in contact with me for the couple weeks leading up to my wife's birthday while they tried out the first-time recipe and then asking what finishing touches I wanted in terms of decoration. The cake was exactly what we wanted, gorgeously decorated and tasted amazing! We were just blown away by the personal effort made by The Floury Apron to make this happen for us. Will 100% be coming back to them for any future cake orders!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tony Mc Keon", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "We recently ordered a sandwich platter for 15 people from the Floury Apron. They were absolutely top quality and we had a great mix of fillings in ciabatta , foccacia, wraps and slice pan.

Caroline was very attentive via email and followed up afterwards to make sure we were happy with our order. Food, service and value were all 10/10. Would highly recommended.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "J Cronin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Is there a better café anywhere? I doubted very much. Firstly, the prices are very fair and the quality of the cappuccino/food was superb........so not overpriced with a half a cup of foam. The owner is clearly customer focused. The staff were natural, friendly and professional to a standard which is severly lacking in business nowadays. It's impossible not to feel welcome here. The seating was comfortable and catered for every possible customer. Finally, the place was impeccably clean with very charming and quaint decor while apexed with an atmosphere of sophistication. Absolutely loved it!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Stephane Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Initially, I had left a review expressing my dissatisfaction with the staff's courtesy at this coffee shop. However, Caroline reached out to me promptly and invited me to give them another chance. I visited again yesterday, and I must say, I'm incredibly impressed with the level of customer service I received. The staff was attentive, friendly, and accommodating. Moreover, the atmosphere was delightful, and the food was delicious. I appreciate the owner's proactive approach in addressing my concerns and ensuring that my experience was enjoyable. I'm more than satisfied with the treatment I received and would highly recommend this coffee shop to others. Thank you for turning my experience around!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ronan Griffin", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Decent breakfast at good prices, service not the quickest but they were busy and are kept busy with constant take aways", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "mark fullen", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Went here for breakfast, I had the omelette and a coffee. Both were great and I thought a lot more reasonably priced than other places nearby", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "chris dennehy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Best breakfast always.  Everything is freshly cooked and nicely presented.  Service is always excellent and friendly. Outside sunny seating when weather permits.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aidan Motherway", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Have ordered cakes, hot food & sandwiches from the Floury Apron for a number of events now and it is always so delicious. Caroline is really professional, very quick to respond and the food is always a big hit. Will definitely be back!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jennifer Fitton", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "We ordered finger food and a cake for my daughters birthday from the Floury Apron. The food was so fresh and delicious and it was devoured. The cake looked beautiful and it tasted great.
They also had a lovely gluten free selection.
It was also so convenient and came on trays so I just had to put them out for people. It was great. I will definitely be ordering again from there.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "M. Barry", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Fantastic food with quality ingredients. Nearest thing to home cooking I've had at a restaurant. Had a lunch of coronation chicken wrap and a side salad and coffee. Also excellent value for money.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Café Velo
address: 3 George's Quay, Ballintemple, Cork, T12 KD37, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Fallon Hasana", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "We had a group of 4 and everyone LOVED what they ordered yesterday. I had the Smashed Avocado and I’d order it over and over again. Avocado was fresh and the eggs cooked to perfection. The salad’s sweet vinaigrette tasted amazing. I also ordered a vanilla latte and it was divine. Our group is heading there again this morning before we head out of the city.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Dan Gogerly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Had breakfast here a few days ago and it was super tasty and the staff were great! Definately worth visiting if you're nearby!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Joanna Renata Mikolajczyk", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 days ago", "review_text": "Today I went to Velo Café, totally exhausted and struggling with the weather. I had a big buggy and wanted to sit outside. But the lovely lady invited me to take a seat. I just got green tea, nothing else, but the treated us like a VIP client. I was able to feed the toddler and just got a break from my day. I'll be coming back here because the staff is absolutely lovely. Reny&Jude", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "James McConville", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Great atmosphere, clean and tidy. Staff friendly and helpful.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Liamy Mackey", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Food way overpriced and eggs almost a little undercooked. For the price of a veg breakfast you'd expect to be full to the gills leaving the place. Instead was served tiny jars of Beans and avocado to fill up the plate. It should be way cheaper if there is no actual fake meat on the plate. In comparison to the reg (fry) there's a world of difference.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Elk Hunter", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Very nice breakfast had here. Poached eggs and sourdough toast was a good value and perfectly cooked. Enough butter was provided for two people. Americano coffee and a cappuccino were both nice, hot, strong and decent portion. Servers were friendly helpful and professional. Breakfast served all day apparently. Cool vibe about the place and good views of the river area.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "J Mueller", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Wonderful little breakfast spot! Many of the cafés are closed on Sunday, so we stumbled in here due to the fact that it was open, but it was the best surprise ever! Delicious food, wonderful service, and an overall good experience.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Dr. J. Nali", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "The staff were very respectful and nice in the morning for breakfast.\nI didn’t like the fact that breakfast menu shows dishes but no drink included on the 11€ dish price, I had to take coffee apart.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Thomas", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Not dazzling, but not offensive, affordable breakfast in the city center. Nice environment and fast and friendly staff", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "PH", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "Edited 9 months ago", "review_text": "Very tasty and ok portion sizes! Not really worth 13.50 but I guess these are Irish prices. I got the eggs benedict which was ok! I would eat here again.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Laurel Bar
address: 39 Mary St, Cork, T12 A252, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "James Muir", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely little boozer for sports and pool. Inclusive landlord and  locals give the place a really great atmosphere.

I consider it the place in Cork to go.

Thanks Joseph, i will be back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jackie Ocallaghan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "What a spot ,great craic with unreal characters in there ,very serious game of Don going on ,but hilarious in between rounds", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Padraig Conaty", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Visiting the city and popped in for a pint and game of pool, good players in the their and friendly reception.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Anton Lindgren", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Fantastic place! Great service and atmosphere ❤️🎉 …", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Cian O' Flynn", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Really really disappointing place in general. The interior was quite dingy and stuffy. The place looks quite careless thrown together with random stuff on the walls and a pool table that it is not in use.
A group and I tried to watch an Irish soccer game there one night. The commentary was 5 seconds behind the visuals and one of the screens was glitching. The women insisted everyone at our table bought something when actually 4 out of 5 of us bought something. She was quite rude, blunt and ill mannered. It really made us feel uncomfortable, unwanted and unappreciated. Out of the 100s of great pubs in Cork, this is definitely one of the to avoid.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Pat O'Sullivan", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Though I've never been a customer of this bar.  The auld one who runs the bar needs to realise that the bar does not own the parking space outside the bar and by placing kegs outside the premises, does not mean that the general public cannot park there.  The woman who works there shouting abuse at me last week which was totally uncalled for.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Stephen Kulik", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 3 years ago", "review_text": "Best bar in cork!family run business and the staff and owners are literally the nicest people you could actually meet,Joe and Regina are just the best and they will literally treat you like your thier actual family, such lovely people and proper cork people supporting the community, A must visit if your in Cork City  Centre", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "denis o'leary", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "My first time in there on Friday, and it won't be my last. Lovely little bar, with great staff and costumers that engage in conversation. A great pint of larger !", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "MICHAEL O BRIEN", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Excellent bar for a quiet pint and watch a match or have a game of pool 🎱 or darts and great customers for a chat …", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Andrea Malone", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Very good pub recommend coming here for a pint and a good game of pool.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Hyde Out
address: 12 Douglas St, Ballintemple, Cork, T12 EY43, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Kathleen Healy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Went here for a match place was full was just about to leave when the owner saw us he moved things around and got us a table and seats, one of the best service ever!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Hannah Looney", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "10/10!\nI love the Hyde Out… I would reccomemd trying the Spritz menu!\nStaff are so lovely! Vibes are perfect!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "BeBe G", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Grand bar TBF, pure chill...i was in a tracksuit watching the cork Match and they had no issue's with that. Richard saoirse and Liam went out of their way to make sure we had a great time. Thanks a million guys. Great cocktails. Prosecco and pizza .  Really lovely cosy pub and the music was rocking !!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "john sheehan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "This is a lively bright and clean bar with a fantastic staff and great atmosphere 👏", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Tara's Tea Rooms
address: 45 MacCurtain Street, Centre, Cork, T23 DVY3, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Jean-Francois LeBlanc", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Awesome afternoon tea experience! Welcomed by awesome and friendly staff members. Lots of options in the menu, including all day breakfast.\n\nFood was fresh, hot and tasted great! Highly recommended!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "I Ta", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "I'm dying of jealousy writing this comment because this cafe has become my favorite place. The food, the tea, the coffee, the beer, the service are 10/10000. Everything here is inexplicable, it's out of this world. Everything here is good, everything here is wonderful. I went here every day in a row in Cork. The Apple Spice tea is wonderful. Please try it. Everything is made here from the heart. I love this place. My friend and I call it Grandma's house because it evokes warmth and good things! I love it here!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Hugo Oliveira", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The coffee is delicious, the food is also delicious. The service is great and the place is very beautiful, such a cute place that you want to stay for hours because it is very pleasant to sit and have a great breakfast. I loved it.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Elizabeth Pearce", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "10/10 I had the quiche, salad and chips. It was all very good. My family and I enjoyed it. The staff are very friendly. Absolutely recommend stopping by!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jenn A", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "So cute! I was actually a bit ill the morning we went so I was relieved they had just toast as an option for this menu - my friend had eggs with spinach and we both enjoyed the food and atmosphere. It was petty busy that morning so service was on the slower side. If we were in Cork for longer we'd definitely come back!", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "John Quinn", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Has a really great breakfast here this morning. I cannot remember the last time I had proper tea like this. Highly recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Faye Francis", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "stumbled on this tea room after a long day meandering Cork and it was truly a 12/10 experience. everyone’s so lovely and kind and it had the best vibes. you absolutely get bang for your buck. couldn’t recommend more", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kristin Derr", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The most adorable place I have ever had breakfast!  I had the Full Irish Breakfast and couldn’t finish it all - but I really wanted to.  Service was fast and friendly.  I also got a scone to go for later and it was delicious.  I cannot recommend this place highly enough!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Riccardo Cuccu", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Had a lovely brunch here! The service was warm and welcoming, and everything we ordered was truly delicious. The pancakes with maple syrup and mixed berries were great, but the real standout was the mocha cheesecake — absolutely amazing. We really enjoyed our time and would definitely come back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Silvia Canevelli", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely place, nice decoration inside, love tea and a special irish breakfast!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Comix Café
address: Kinsale Road Commercial Centre, Unit 30, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "David Consonni", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Love to pop in for lunch every time I’m around the area, easy parking in front of the place. Portions are massive, had about 4 times the pork schnitzel and another few times the Carbonara, which really fills you up. Great spot for a quick lunch while working.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ella Radzylevych", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "This place has it all: tasty food, great service, big portions, and,my personal favourite, kompot, which I rarely find served in other establishments (to my great sadness). Definitely worth visiting.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Miroslaw Mrzyglod", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "The tastiest Polish dishes in Ireland!

The only thing I would suggest is to mark the menu for vegetarian dishes... It would also be good if there was a vegetarian option in the dinner sets!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jennifer Gulane", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Food was delicious!! Its a small and busy cafe thus you will find it crowded especially in the weekends. We waited for a bit for a table, good thing some people are sensitive that they leave immediately after finishing their meal. The staff were great. Come if u miss Eastern European food. Recommend the goulash soup! Will be back to try more.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Benjamin Bourret", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Stopped randomly after shopping in the area,best idea we had!
Food was amazing, huge portions, we will definitely come back to try the rest of the menu!
Highly recommend!
💎", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jeff Nagle", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Hidden Gem!! Dropped into this place for a quick lunch with my wife and 2yr old was we were in the area. They do a lot of authentic polish food and Irish staples including an all day full Irish breakfast. My wife got the potato pancakes, I got the burger and we got the kids bowl for our son. All of the food was delicious and huge portions. The staff are super friendly too. Glad I finally stopped in here as it's a hidden gem! Definitely recommend! Prices were very reasonable too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sarp Daltaban", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 days ago", "review_text": "Perfect taste, lovely crew, you need to try traditional Rosół (Polish chicken soup) that will change your life 😉", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ching Wen Ning", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Love their goulash, potato pancakes and zurek soup.
Delicious Polish food, huge portions always.
I definitely stop by everytime I do some shopping in the area.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Norbert Narbut", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Comix is hands down the best Polish food in Cork. The dishes are authentic, full of flavour, and always fresh. Great atmosphere too, a real hidden gem in the city.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aisling Ní Mhurchu", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Really nice place for a coffee or a meal. Cake portions are very large. The staff are lovely - so friendly and accommodating.  Highly recommend. 👍", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Rearden's Bar
address: 26 Washington St, Centre, Cork, T12 WNP8, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Clare D", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely bar. Atmosphere is great. Got very very busy after 10pm so if your not a big fan of crowds that's a heads up for you. Cocktails were divine plus they had a really good offer on them before 10pm", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Marina Bournel Bosson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "This pub is nice watch sport during middle of the day, dance at night and drink good fresh Guinness. The decoration is pretty and brings you directly to a nice atmosphere.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Penny King", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "Started out with nacho. Wow GET the nachos!! The picture shows them half eaten. Four of ya shared them. For dinner I had the steak sandwich and a side salad. The steak was done perfectly.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alexey Tretyakov", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Good price for traditional Irish breakfast 10,95€ (18€ in Dublin for example), and expensive tea (like everywhere) for 4,50 but you have 3 cups of tea in fact, totally worth it. Friendly staff (double salary for Christophe! 😎), in morning nice seats with opened window. Soup of the the day is just amazing if you are not very hungry. …", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "G Ryan", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Went when there was a jukebox band on, was a good vibe but drinks were a joke. Paid 24€ for a jack and coke and a vodka cran, got the same thing in another bar plus 2 shots for 19€, been a few times but would definitely have pre - drinks before going in, the people inside are a mix of mams and creeps, luck of the draw. Bartender ignored us 4 times before serving us. Also very little crowd control in there, it's like a tin of sardines", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Wunmi Fasanya", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "The Reardan’s in Cork was greattt! I absolutely loved it there ,  from the atmosphere to the staff to the people there 10/10! I was there for a Guinness live and rising event and it was superb! The staff were super accommodating and the bar itself is so cute 🥰\nI’d never been out in Cork before but after being to Rearden’s, highly recommend 👍🏾", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Yashpal Khapre", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Good place to rock your night, You have a lovely dance environment later in the nights, good staff, good vibe, good people, Entry is Free.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Keven Kottenhahn", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Great pub- cool cocktails", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Yalcin Kuzoren", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "A great Irish Bar in Cork. Amazing bands come up for great concerts here... I do recommend. The staff are good. The music system is very satisfying. The prices are reasonable.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Erin Cooper", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "Casual spot with a small but tasty menu. Staffed by friendly locals, which made for good conversation. Business picks up late at night, but we didn't have a problem getting a seat before 8. Free WiFi!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Priory Coffee Co.
address: 1 N Main St, Centre, Cork, T12 HX58, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Lucía Tacaliti", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "The girl that served us was amazing!\nWe tried the vegan sausage and it was great.  Good coffee, a lot of veggie milk options 🌱", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "P. B.", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 4 years ago", "review_text": "When you see a long queue  outside a small coffee house you you know it will be worth the wait.. Coffee brewed to perfection. Lady behind the counter only to happy the share the\" ins and outs\" of the treats on display", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nate ON8 Productions", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 7 years ago", "review_text": "Hey Priory its me.😆😆😆 anyone who knows me knows that i treasure the yellow chairs and the atmosphere of the Priory. My first encounter with the Priory was in Youghal. When I learned tat they were opening up shop 8minutes away from where i live, I was very excited. We have gotten to know one another on Instagram and with my regular caffine refueling afternoons. I have attended their coffee cupping as well. Out of all the things that they do; i admire how they do their utmost to support the local community.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rens De Groot", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "The staff is always super nice, always up for a chat. Coffee always used to be great, we used to go here a lot. Lately we noticed that the quality of the coffee has been going down. I feel like there's a lot of new staff, and the quality of the cappuccinos has been going down. Foam is lacking, and cappuccinos are too hot, which makes us choose different coffee places over Priory lately.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Soundy Sound", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Only takeaway cups despite having seating inside and outside.\nThat's enough to put me off but the quality of the coffee has declined too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Izzy L", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Some of the best food I’ve ever had it’s amazing and staff are lovely", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ryan Gregory", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "What a place to get a coffee in cork! Good coffee and nice staff. I missed the cakes.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Starbucks Princes Street
address: 39 Princes St, Centre, Cork, T12 EFK8, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "m malinas5", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Great ambiance of this little Starbucks cafe. No wait when I entered. Disappointed in food selection as they were out of a lot of the fresh items, but did have plenty of ready made sandwiches. The lemon muffin I got was fresh and delicious along with my Carmel macchiato. If looking for mech. The selection was small but did have a few cups/mugs I haven’t seen at other locations.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Oren_LG", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited a month ago", "review_text": "Very nice quality of drinks. And tiramisu frappuchino the best. Highly recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michelle Robbins", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "There was just one girl managing the orders & serving as well. She was very courteous & friendly. The ambiance itself is cozy & warm.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Linda O Connell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I like getting the gluten free lemon chicken sandwich here. Out of three Starbucks near work this is the one that usually still has this gf dairy and soya free sandwich still in stock in the afternoon. Staff are lovely and helpful. The place is lovely, nice unique art work with words about coffee. Comfy chairs to sit on. Never too crowded, nice atmosphere. Good coffee.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Bill Gleeson", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Wait times are stupidly long.\nNice quiet atmosphere all the same.\nExpect to pay a premium price for the brand.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Ramit Bhalla", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Average coffee, the cake pops are terrible and fall apart. The WiFi doesn’t work. Service is below average.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Phillip O'Brien", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "A lovely Starbucks. Quite small inside but has character. Staff are friendly. Prices are what you expect from Starbucks. I had Americano and the Victoria Sponge cake.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Abi Makovsky", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely and friendly staff. Coffee is always good and specialty drinks are always made exactly to par. I brought in my kind of awkward reusable cup and the staff was very accommodating and helpful. Look how delicious! The bathroom and seating area is always clean as well.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Adrian Cronin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "Great location in a lovely old building. Of you like Starbucks  you'll love this one.  Easy fiat access for strollers is a bonus. Free fast Wi-Fi helps you catch up digitally or grab a book and chill or catch up with some friends.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Gábor Majer", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Kind service🙌🏼Very small Starbucks but now crowded. The tables are small not the best for digital nomad work…", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Roundy
address: 1 Castle St, Centre, Cork, T12 RX09, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Teresa", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "We had a lovely time here at The Roundy over the bank holiday weekend. Great drinks, relaxing atmosphere, and the staff were nice and welcoming.

We will certainly make a habit of returning here when in Cork city.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aimee J M", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "What a lovely spot to stop in at on a day floating around cork city. Stopped in for few pints, great spot outside to watch the world go by, relaxed atmosphere. Inside was beautiful. Pints so fresh and ladies serving drinks were friendly.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "John Mee", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Very nice bar and the staff were very friendly, as you'd expect from Cork people.
Sit outside - it's great for people watching. There's a good mix of ages and nationalities there too.
Bring a jacket with you because it can get a little chilly if there's a breeze - or maybe that's just the age I'm at!
But let's not talk about my age here - just know that it's a sensitive subject. :-)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Grant Oakes", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Really nice pub, could spend a few hours there and have a nice time.

Didn't have food and was there for a comedy show.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sean o donovan", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "The absolutely undeserved level of disrespect and belittlement I was shown today in the “ Roundy bar” in cork city is an absolute disgrace. My girlfriend and I were in town today around lunch time and we decided to go to the “Roundy bar” to sit down and watch the world go by. As neither me or my girlfriend  wanted to drink alcohol she got us two waters and sat outside. At this time we were not made aware by any staff or signs that you need to spend money in order to sit in the bars seats outside. While we were chatting and minding our own business, a lady who seemed to be somewhat in charge but not a manager came out to us and asked us, had we purchased anything from the bar. We informed her we got two waters but she re-asked had we bought anything and we said no. She didn’t even bother to inform/ ask us could we buy something and spend money in order to sit down ( which we would have no problem with). Instead she began to belittle us and treat us as if we were dirt on her shoe while laughing that we can’t sit here as we spent no money. This lady then returned inside and we decided to continue drinking the two glasses of water which we were served inside the same bar without a problem. The lady came back out  and asked us “are we moving on yet “to which I replied “what did we do wrong” . He also informed her that we only occupied 1 table and there were only 3 other occupied tables outside and the bar which was quiet AND EMPTY.All we wanted was to sit down and watch the world go but we were wrong for only getting water ? The lady had little to no response and then snatched what was remaining of my girlfriends glass of water and went inside, also after asking for her name she laughed into my girlfriends face saying “I don’t need to tell you that girl”. In shock and embarrassment of how we were treated, we left immediately. I am absolutely disgusted by how we were made feel and how this could have been easily avoided by simply informing us rather than being condescending. I’m posting this to raise awareness of their level of customer service and we will be making a formal complaint to the manager.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Thomas O' Neill", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Guinness was awful. The staff seemed friendly but when questioned about the quality they became very defensive. Worst Guinness I have had in Cork. I will not go back in the door of the Roundy based on unfriendly staff reaction. They really need to focus on the quality of the drink they are serving and sort it out.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Stephen Crowley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Great place to unwind and relax with a refreshing drink and watch the world pass by", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "d watch", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Nice bar. I was in during the afternoon. Friendly staff. I'll go there again when I have more time.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "aaron cowming", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "One of the best pubs in cork, sometimes great music upstairs. Cool, hippy crowns. Great vibe and right in the city close to all amenities.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Elk Hunter", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "Had a couple nice Irish coffees here. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Vibe was laid back and cool. Good place to people watch.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Liberty Grill
address: 32 Washington St, Centre, Cork, T12 T880, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Apriry Ly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "My experience at Liberty Grill was absolutely wonderful. The service was excellent—the staff was incredibly attentive, professional, and made the entire meal feel special.

The food was also top-notch. Everything we ordered was prepared to perfection and tasted absolutely delicious. It's clear that they use high-quality ingredients and take great pride in their cooking.

I can't recommend Liberty Grill enough. It's a fantastic spot for a meal in the heart of Cork, and I'll definitely be returning.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Stella Wong", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "We had a lovely dinner at this place on Saturday, the food was delicious, and also the staff were friendly as well! Love they gave us some surprise for our anniversary dinner! Highly recommended!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Autymn Gelette", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Food was delicious and fresh. They had so many great options so it was very hard to choose!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Leandro Romero", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "It was a good experience. This is a great brunch in town. Our dishes, the open chicken sandwich, the Irish Benedict, and the chocolate and cranberry French toast were delicious. I highly recommend this place if you want to be sure of a really good option for lunch or brunch in Cork. The value for money was suitable.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Audrey P", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "We had an amazing night at The Liberty Grill. Thank you so much Carol and Jason and all the rest of the staff. Food was excellent, the room had a great vibe. So wonderful to be in a restaurant where the staff are smiling and having fun at work.  Highly recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kathy O Donnell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Excellent vegan options, they even have proper desserts! Lovely staff always very kind and accommodating. It’s a small venue so book in advance if possible as it’s so popular. Breakfast is great here too, I love the Jonny cakes. Reliably delicious every time & a varied menu that caters for all. One of my fave restaurants in Cork .", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Frank Cawley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great locally sourced food.  Friendly professional staff who take pride in their excellent work.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Grant Oakes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "We came on Friday 28th of Feb for my wife's 30th birthday. The food was excellent and the service was incredible.

The staff really make this place. Would 100% recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Francis", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Favourite breakfast place in Ireland. Was there a week or two ago and had the johnnycakes and boxty. Miss it dearly and always look forward to going back", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Gemma Sanderson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great place for breakfast/brunch, but we were lucky to get a table, as very busy.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Sober Lane
address: 5 Sullivan's Quay, Cork, T12 H771, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Heather Mayes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "We stumbled across this place and are delighted! They have both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beers, ciders, and cocktails. They serve pub fare, including vegetarian and vegan options. We enjoyed the atmosphere very much.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Gabs G.", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Nothing but the best. We had a post christening event at Sober lane and everything was just perfect. We had a party of 25 people and were able to reserve a private area where it just felt like an intimate celebration. All the food came out on time and was all delicious.  The staff kept checking upon us and making sure everything was running smooth, thank you so much everyone for making such an event so memorable and easy.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Honest", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Such a lovely place, stunning pub with delicious food!  The roast dinners are the best I’ve ever tasted!  I’ve tried nearly everything on the menu and it’s so hard to decide what to eat as it’s all banging!
The staff are fantastic also, the food is freshly made and absolutely delicious! I highly recommend the roast dinners! Great family pub! My kids love it there also. Beautiful conservatory to sit in and have celebration gatherings 👍 I absolutely recommend this place! It has something for everyone and board games too!
Thanks again for another lovely meal and cocktail 👏 oh and  kids get free ice cream also 👏", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Julia", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "A wonderful place with delicious food, a pleasant atmosphere, and excellent service! We stumbled upon it by chance, but it turned out to be an amazing experience — and now we’re regulars. The wings are simply divine! As is the toffee pudding.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Colin O'Brien", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "We waited over 40 minutes for a burger and some chicken wings, and the place wasn’t busy at all. No idea what took so long but would not recommend. Staff were nice but it was pretty annoying to look at them all just standing around when you’re left three quarters of an hour waiting on what you thought would be a quick bite.

The service rating isn’t a reflection on the floor staff, it’s just for the slow kitchen. Such a shame because it ruined what would otherwise have been an enjoyable experience.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Anthony Kerr", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Called in on Thursday evening for food and had the best sandwiches we've ever had. We both had the special (think it was called the Sopranos) and chips/fries as well. The picture don't do it justice,", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Autymn Gelette", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The Bang Bang Cauliflower was pretty good (wish it had less of the mayo based sauce and more of the red sauce) but the Sticky Toffee Pudding was PERFECT.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sam Hoyle", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Grainne was an absolute star and made mine and my husband’s dinner date a smashing hit! We will be back for the great food and lovely lovely atmosphere ❤️", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "A J (Lexi)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Beamish!!! Neat place midday, probably bustling in the evening. Very cool wall art!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Drasti Brown", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Recently they got rid of few vegan options and I only got chips. The manager noticed and was very kind enough to replace it with nachos which was much filling. The manager at sober lane was very kind enough and very friendly. I highly recommend sober lane ❤️", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Old Oak
address: 113 Oliver Plunkett St, Centre, Cork, T12 PY8A, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "stu stuart", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "My favourite bar in cork. Good music. Gorgeous pub. Great staff.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Vincent Wells", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "First pub we visited in Cork and loved the olde worldy feel of the pub with all the up to date stuff. Lovely staff and a good selection of beers 🍻. Very large pub with plenty of seating all over the place.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Gerry Callahan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Bartender was helpful on the drinks. Beautiful decor, especially the stained-glass skylight. Regular customers were welcoming and super friendly, easy to have a conversation with.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jackie Smith", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Authentic experience with Irish music and dancing. The musicians were amazing and really got the crowd going and the dancer was fantastic! Felt like I already knew everyone there! Highly recommend, especially on Wednesdays from 8-10when this band and dancer are there!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "George Triantafyllopoulos (inucha)", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Literally been waiting for 17 min. No server has looked at us let alone come to get our order they just keep avoiding eye contact. Prob gonna leave.. a couple next to us said they been here for 45 min and no food has been brought out sad\n\nEdit: after 22 min we left.. yes I counted haha was taking medicine..", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Andy", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Love the staff and service but the guy with karaoke choosing the song unfortunately made this a one star. Doesn't go by order of the songs requested, randomizes it and also if you line up for an age he wont play it. Sad, good atmosphere.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Ama-Now", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "I ordered Chicken Parisienne. Rice cold, chicken very hard to cut, asparagus to salty. Not recommended at all.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "William Cove", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "I popped by The Old Oak after landing at Cork Airport and before catching a bus onwards and was very glad I did. It was a wonderfully warm and welcoming spot full of friendly and chatty locals. The light lunch was dandy and the couple of pints to wash it down were even better. The star of the show, though, was the exceptional service, energy and attitude of Laura behind the bar! Hope to pop by again when back in town. 😊", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Oren_LG", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Very good Irish pub, good quality food, good atmosphere and professional staff. Very satisfied and recommen.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ryan Inofinada", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Very spacious. Love the vibe! Not so loud too", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Idle Hour
address: Albert Quay, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Paddy O'Connell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Decent locals bar in the docks area know as 'Jewtown'.
Friendly and first bar you encounter if you come along Kennedy Quay from the Marina Market.
You can see how all the new office blocks are built around this holdout.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "War Pig", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Great find walking back towards town after eating at marina markets.

Felt very much like a locals place but was still very welcoming. The barman was friendly and even provided free pizza for everyone in the bar! What a gentleman!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Cormac Brennan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Idle Hour very kindly hosted the afterparty for the Frontrunners & Briskwalkers Cork Pride 5K 2025 in conjunction with Cork Pride. With almost 100 people attending the event the service and atmosphere provided was top notch and we are very grateful for the same.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Greg Daly", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Great pub for a smashing pint of stout and reasonable on the edge of cork city.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Soundy Sound", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "What should be a gorgeous old school pub is ruined by screens. There are 2 huge TVs behind the bar showing 2 different sports that no one was watching while I was there. Added to this were 2 bright advertising screens running Guinness adds.
Their poor choice of strobing Christmas lights combine with the screens to create a very flashy amusement arcade like atmosphere.
Service was friendly and efficient.
This could be a beautiful pub.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Joce Coughlan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Post concert drinks,friendly staff nice atmosphere and cold drinks.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Kouros Zanbouri", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "During my stroll through the charming Port of Cork, I stumbled upon a quaint Irish pub that beckoned me inside. Eager to experience a taste of the local culture, I decided to stop in for a refreshing drink. From the moment I entered, the barmaid (server) greeted me with genuine warmth, kindness, and a helpful attitude.

Taking note of my curiosity, she attentively listened to my preferences and offered a wonderful suggestion: Irish apple cider. It happened to be my first time trying cider, and I'm delighted to say it was a delightful choice. The cider was perfectly crafted, striking a harmonious balance between sweetness and crispness that left me longing for another sip.

The pub itself exuded a friendly and inviting atmosphere. Although the bustling bar area was occupied, the cozy coaches offered a serene spot for me to unwind and savor my drink. Immersed in the authentic Irish ambiance, I couldn't help but appreciate the genuine sense of camaraderie and enjoyment that permeated the air.

This impromptu visit to the Irish pub left a lasting impression on me. The attentive and amiable service provided by the barmaid, along with the exceptional Irish apple cider, contributed to a truly memorable experience. I relished every moment, immersing myself in the rich tapestry of Irish tradition and hospitality.

If you find yourself exploring the Port of Cork, I wholeheartedly recommend paying a visit to this charming pub. Whether you're a cider aficionado or simply seeking a genuine taste of Ireland, you'll be treated to a warm welcome, an inviting atmosphere, and a drink that will transport you to good places.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin Byrne", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "The atmosphere was quite non existent.  If it wasn't for our group, there'd have been a handful of elderly patrons in the bar. The best thing about the bar was in my opinion the service. We were served by a really nice girl who was polite and helpful to our group. The clientele was 100% male on the Saturday night we were there which I found rather unusual. Fine for a pint in the afternoon.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Cillian", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Slow service but otherwise a lovely pub with so much character.

A great place to watch games, it has a load of tellies and there are always some people there watching so there is a bit of atmosphere.

Maybe a bit rough around the edges and a little out of the way but it has a charm about it and is worth the trip.

Service is shockingly slow though.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Mick Bedford", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "The idle Hour. Is a real Irish pub, no flashing lights to grab your attention, no gimmicks, a real friendly Irish pub.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Thompsons Cork
address: Unit D, Thompson House, MacCurtain Street, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 RR0C, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Chloé Morineau", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "The meal was delicious. We took the wagyu burger which was very tasty and surprising with the creamy sauce and the chicken one for the same reason, very tasty. The seafood linguine was very tasty though not enough in the plate and the chicken Supreme was good. The desserts were also amazing. The only thing I'd have to say is that we asked for tap water and got a bottled water instead, we informed one of the waitress mid dinner, and though the waitress told us she'd take it off our bill we still paid for it", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Victoria Buckley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "I couldn’t have loved my night more! It was absolutely amazing and so wonderful. From the cocktails to the food and the service ! I especially want to say a huge thank you to Hazel our waitress, she was incredible and so polite and attentive throughout our night and she is an asset to the restaurant. Will def be back and highly recommend this place ! Can’t recommend it enough ! ❤️❤️", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rob S", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "The staff at the Residence Inn recommended Thompsons to us and we could not hav been happier.  Hands down the most luxurious meal we had in Ireland.

First things first - this is not and inexpensive restaurant.  You are paying top shelf prices for top shelf food.  Having said that, if you are an American make sure you account for the fact that you are not going to be expected to add 30% as a tip.  We live in the DC area and the prices were comparable for us.  IF you know DC, think Old Ebbits Grill for price and overall feel.

This is a steak place.  I recommend getting the steak.  That said, SO got the salmon and it was excellent.  You can see from the pictures my steak was perfectly cooked.  Deserts were just as perfect.  I got the pear with sorbet and added the Pear Shaped cocktail.  I have a dairy allergy and I was over the moon that they had a dairy free desert.

Staff was excellent and so was the atmosphere.

Despite being a truly upscale dining experience we did not feel out of place in travel clothing.  I think the stress on dress codes has relaxed all over but I was slightly concerned we would be under dressed for such a nice place.  No concerns at all.

Just a great dining experience in a great location an easy walk from our hotel.  Doesnt get much better.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Shelley R", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Quaint old style decor. Central location in Cork, up from the railway station and near enough to the bus station, recommend to anyone on a short visit. Recommend for locals too 😉.
This review is from our June 2025 visit, and we will definitely return to enjoy another evening.

A busy restaurant with 2 evening sitting times, bookings recommended for evening times.

Supports local and environmentally friendly, with food and alcohol from local suppliers (farm to fork steaks).

Varied menu. Tasty food.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rosana Pinheiro-Machado", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "I wanted to treat myself with a dry age special cut, which was very expensive but the description was promising. A 30 day dry aged meat has a very peculiar taste but it come covered with garlic. I was very clear that I wanted a plain steak, with no garnish, only with salt and paper. As it happens with all things cooked with garlic, the garlic was so prominent that could only taste it!!!. if I had chosen any cheaper beef the taste would have been the same! While this primary mistake could be okay (it happens after all), the problem came when I told the manager that the chef should avoid that. The manager said that it was impossible, that there was no garlic in the kitchen, insisting I was wrong (and therefore crazy!). This was so disappointing. Instead of accepting what I said, the manager decided to gaslight me. I also ordered a very rare meat and they brought it medium-medium rare. I spent lots of money in a very amateur meal. On a positive note, the atmosphere was super nice and the guy who served me was very friendly too. The steak was not bad, but it is not worth the price for the special cut.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Court Richards Photography", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Thompsons Cork
This was an unexpected gem and a superb meal. We came here to celebrate my son’s 18th birthday, and it couldn’t have been better. From the outside, the street-front façade is quite unassuming, but once inside, the interior is stunning and full of atmosphere.

We were warmly welcomed by the staff, who were not only friendly and attentive but also went the extra mile by singing happy birthday for my son — a really thoughtful touch.

Most of us went for the steak, and I had the 8oz fillet with chunky chips, baby potatoes, and French beans — everything was cooked to perfection. The restaurant is also very accessible, with great facilities and a prime location on MacCurtain Street.

Whether you’re planning a date night, a family dinner, or a group gathering, I highly recommend Thompsons. We visited on a weekday, and it was still quite busy, so I’d suggest booking ahead.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Chris Devlin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "We went for a sharing steak platter and it was great value and top quality €65 for 2 people for a 24oz steak , cooked to perfection with 2 sides and 2 sauces ,great staff and very friendly atmosphere, would highly recommend . Added a bottle of wine to the meal for €25-€30,  it was very nice", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Becky Li", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "The food was ok. The fish and chips were good but their steak was dry and hard to chew and swallow. We waited for a while to be seated and the service was not good. Ordered tap water to drink and didn’t get that until the food came and I had to ask them for it again. It’s super dark in here and just didn’t have any great vibes… would not have been my choice to go here but most other places were closed when we went looking for lunch.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rodney Logan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Excellent and knowledgeable staff. Very attentive.  Good quality food. Just a pity that the chips are actually skinny fries. Would. Go again without hesitation.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Cormac Reynolds", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "The quality of the meal just didn't match the price. The steak was under-seasoned and a little chewy, cooked less than the medium rare I ordered and with minimal sear. I think the chips were re-heated  (inexpertly), so lacked crunch. Burger was fine but nothing special. Meals took a long time to come out even on a quiet night, though the wait staff were all friendly and attentive.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Courthouse Tavern
address: 3 Cross St, Centre, Cork, T12 XH42, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Bryan Downey", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Probably the best bar in Cork city! Great atmosphere and the staff are sooo sound! We came for the dart board but stayed for the friendly staff, unreal service and bang on customers!! Pleasure to have a few there!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ronan Cantillon", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Nice bar & a good pint of Beamish", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mary O Brien", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 8 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely bar men staff..great pints also..lovely girls also behind the bar..its a great place for to watch a match..and has good music also..", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "a", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Really nice Pub", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tesca Osman", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "Tired ankles drove us in to this dark little traditional pub, with Bob Dylan quietly in the background. So far so good. Surly service followed by the football being suddenly cranked up to full blast drove us to the outdoor tables. Drank up and left.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Alan O'Brien", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Fun little bar, but not all that nicely laid out.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Niall Brennan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Great pub and great staff. Lovely Murphy’s.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Damien Hanrahan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "One of the best pints of stout in Cork City day or night", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Thomas Thornton", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 3 years ago", "review_text": "The Courthouse Tavern is a great city bar just off of Washington Street.
There is a great atmosphere and there is a working fire! It really adds to bar!
The staff are friendly and attentive!
Great point of stout!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "John OConnell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 11 months ago", "review_text": "What a great bar, beautiful pints of Guinness open fire, playing lovely music for all ages, the crac 90 and the staff really friendly and courteous to all a real gem of a bar👍🍺🍻", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: An Bodhrán
address: 42 Oliver Plunkett St, Centre, Cork, T12 X021, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Darren Gumley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Met some amazing people,  staff were very nice 👍", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "david keyes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Perfect almost in every way except on 1 type of vodka ,smirnoff had to leave because my missus prefers a better choice", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Amine Mecifi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Good place for a pint. Nice atmosphere and friendly barman.

When I went there, it was 9 PM, a Wednesday and the bar was really empty. Maybe 3 or 4 clients. Got served immediately.

Recommended.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin M.", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "It's just sad what's happened to this bar.

It used to be a great drinking spot.

It's just died.

Miserable atmosphere in the place compared to even 6 months ago.

Best avoided.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Bryan Watney", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Atmospheric little bar with brilliant rock music juke box and interesting rock related decor on walls.  Brilliant atmosphere at weekends.  Super friendly bar staff.  Best pub we've been in for years.  Excellent pint of Guiness!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Amy Grimsley", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Lively Irish pub. Good drinks & atmosphere. Great location for a stop off during the day or night out", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Emre Akcol", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Super cozy, traditional irish pub with all originality. So sincere and people are very nice as well. You can also watch football matches or enjoy listening music while drinking your lovely beer and having a good craic!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Luke Ratterman", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Super cozy pub that makes you feel like you are in the 1800s. Fireplace surrounded by cushy benches and a man in the corner singing ancient Irish songs. The bar staff is also attentive and friendly. Love this place!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Carol Harkins", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Fun place to stop for a drink before dinner. Delightful decor, decorated for Christmas but we could see stained glass above the snowflakes that looked exquisite. Just a homey, warm location. perfect to hang out with friends.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Leif Wicksell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely place, perfect for a couple of pints.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Corner House
address: Coburg Lane, 7 Coburg St, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 FW10, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Karen Pertoldi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Really happy to discover this fab pub on a recent trip to Cork.
We visited twice, and found every one very friendly and helpful and the pub had a great energy and atmosphere.  Great live music on our return in the evening after a quieter day time drink. A true find for music lovers", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michael Grabovskyi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Not sure if they serve food, but the beer was great! The service was amazing and very friendly. The atmosphere was fantastic! with live music! exactly what you’d expect from an Irish pub in Ireland.

It’s now officially my go-to pub every time I visit Cork.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lucy B.", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Really good atmosphere. Free traditional music on Thursday night. Clean restroom. Friendly staff.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Adrian Zahara", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "I visited many different pubs in my short visit to Cork, but this was far and away my favourite.  Felt at home there.  Great live local music as well!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Martin Clarke", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "4 weeks ago", "review_text": "Went along for the trad session this evening supposedly from 6pm, hoping to play, but unfortunately it had been cancelled so no tunes fix for me. Not quite sure why- one or two other bemused musicians floating around. Nice enough pub otherwise though.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Kath KMS", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 days ago", "review_text": "Went for a few hours for a session.
