name: Upstairs
address: 7 Pembroke St, Centre, Cork, T12 VR62, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "David Meropol", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "What a find. Walk up the stairs to a bar back in time. The OG wooden floors and tables and bar make the vibe on point. And the drinks are top notch. We ordered off menu and was no problem.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Anzhelika", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Аwwww, my favorite place for the soul.
You bring the right person, order a cocktail, and dive into deep, meaningful conversations — that’s what this place means to me! The music and lighting inside are just perfect. All the cocktails are delicious, and I like ordering something random — try it if you're unsure what to choose, you won’t be disappointed.
This place is unique and incredibly cozy, it definitely leaves a lasting impression. I only share it with special people :)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ivan Merc", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Excellent place for evening cocktails. Small speakeasy but the product is delicious. Cocktails are excellent made with passion and knowledge. Did enjoy Fine Pear and some other concoctions from the menu. Will be back. Thank you.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Daniel Munder", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Upstairs will craft you an incredibly well-balanced cocktail. They put pride and passion into every drink they make; many of which include house-made infusions. Open late. This is the perfect bar and atmosphere for the beginning, middle, or end to your night.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "George Kyritsis", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "This place has a unique and ultimately cozy atmosphere !  Like the ones you see in some of the Hollywood classics!  But this is not the only feature that will make you come back.  It is open late and if you can’t get served anywhere else after 11:30, it is the place to go to!  The staff is friendly and inviting and are experts in mixology!  I had one of the best espresso martinis ever!  The presentation was immaculate!  I was impressed by the bartenders David and Naiomb!  If bartending was an Olympic sport, they would win gold!  Just watching them work and prepare the drinks was like watching an artist create a masterpiece!  They obviously take great pride in their work!  I just hope their boss appreciates their work and talent!  Overall, an excellent and safe venue for a late cocktail!  A hidden gem in Cork City Centre just down the street from the post office!  You won’t find any other place like it! Perfect for a gathering of friends or a romantic rendezvous with your significant other with an atmosphere that will make your meeting a most delightful memory!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "David Markley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "You rarely go wrong with a local recommendation and this was no exception. We directed here with the instructions to “Walk to the post office. Turn Left. Go upstairs to the bar with no storefront.”

The bar is called Upstairs, according to the menu, and it was a joy to find.

The woman at the bar made her own homemade limoncello that was divine! We caught her making the next batch and she gave us a sample. It was wonderful on its own and a great addition to “Down with this sort of Thing.”

We will be back, when we visit Cork again!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Puntie P", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Great little find. Snug cocktail bar. Nice staff. Well recommended.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "David Hanna", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "We did not have food, only cocktails, but they were very good with a great selection to pick from, and staff were helpful / welcoming", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "My name Jeff", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Alex was very informative about the places  around town and gave us a brief rundown on local brews/whiskeys", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Brian Ahern", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Lovely spot for cocktails. Really intimate old world vibe and really good cocktails. Get there early as it can get busy!!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Dukes Coffee Company
address: 4 Carey's Ln, Centre, Cork, T12 YY89, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Dan Rock", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Very good coffee and breakfast. I had the DUKES breakfast. Lovely staff too. Definetly recommend this place.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aoibhin Fitzpatrick", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "Nice location down a small street. We sat outside and it was nice to see people walking past. We got the fry and the French toast. Fry was nice, French toast wasn't really French toast more of a cake with fruit and mascapone but it was nice.
Coffee was good.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Katarina Milan-Stude", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Lovely place for a breakfast. I go here very often and it never disappoints. Food is great and portions are very good. Staff is always nice and polite, they serve food very fast even when they are busy. I would highly recommend trying it out since they have a little of something for everyones taste.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jiaan Cui", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I really like the cups in this cafe. The color of the tables is wood yellow, which looks great in photos! My friend and I chatted all afternoon on the second floor again. Since I have a lot of free time during the holidays, I learned tarot cards and tried it for her. I hope we can graduate smoothly in the new year.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Abigail O'Shea", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Wonderful place that I often visit becuase of its warm atmosphere and good food. A little pricy, but the food is worth it. 4.95 for iced strawberry matcha, not bad. Has phone charger ports available upstairs", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "kieran Kenneally", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Breakfast was quite big and the black pudding was really nice because I usually don't like it. First time in here.
€16.50 for breakfast is a lot, it's just too much. €4 for a large Americano?
I didn't ask for large and I wasn't offered an alternative and also it just wasn't very large and mostly gone before breakfast was finished.
Look, there was plenty of food and I wasn't going to be hungry for a while after this but its just too much money! Could have got cheaper elsewhere (lots of places nearby) but I like to try new places.
I wouldn't pay that again.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Victoria Y", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Food was well presented but tasted pretty average and unseasoned. I got up to ask for salt and the staff were just chatting amongst themselves ignoring me despite clearly seeing me waiting as there were no other customers at the till area. Found better breakfast/brunch elsewhere in Cork. Not bad but certainly not great.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Jennifer Reitano", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Stopped in for brunch. Delicious and balanced nutritious options. Highly recommend the Duke breakfast plate. The blue colors were calming and the booth was comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Liam murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Nice cafe good breakfast and good coffee . Friendly staff .", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Megan Cremins", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Nice place for lunch or breakfast. Good gluten free and vegan options.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Liberty Bar X Resistance
address: 92/93 S Main St, Centre, Cork, T12 Y2CC, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Mick Foley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 6 months ago", "review_text": "Bit quiet when I was in early in the afternoon but was warm.
But the recommendation of Beamish? was lovely! The ideological and quick witted conversationalist young lad serving playing plenty of classic Irish rebel songs on the playlist? Class!
It made an Aussie tourist to Cork very happy to attend.
Can't wait to go back", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Zymon Cooper", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Nice place to have some beer. Atmosphere was chilled and the staff friendly. Would come here more often, but I only was in Cork for one night.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Seán Tynan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "Very lush bar in the city centre. Check out the cocktail room upstairs! Lovely staff and clientele. More relaxing and quieter than the nearby places, and with a great selection of craft beers. A hidden gem.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Carolina Chavez", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The atmosphere and music is excellent but the bartender not so good, he turned the beer on me and my partner and just said "oh sorry, here is the bill" and we were all wet.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aaron Scott", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Cool bar, mixed crowd, good music but a very strange bouncer", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Adam Alcock", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Great quality beers, atmosphere and service.

We came for the Open Mic night, being an open mic the acts are trying new material so the quality is variable but overall they were very funny and definitely worth going. We got some free sweets in the interval and nachos at the end, very kind.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Diarmuid Barry", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Amazing cocktails! Good, central location. But when the DJ started he set the music so loud you had difficulty hearing the person talking next to you. Won't be going there again if a DJ is playing.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Harini Reviews", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Bartender was really good at making cocktails and customer service. Highly recommend the cocktail Painkiller and if you like sweet cocktails, French Martini!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "David Griffin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": ""Stylish decor, very comfortable seating with a modern feel" Great selection of cocktails & draft"Great location in the city centre.We will return "", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Emma Devereux", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "My friend and I popped in for a drink and when we got to our table we cheered eachother for our birthdays which were that day, really just quiet and to ourselves, and the barwoman came over a few mins later with nachos and sweets for our birthday as she overheard us- how nice is that! The interior is really nice, scandi, we werent upstairs only downstairs.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: De Calf Cafe
address: Unit 4, The Cornmarket Centre, Cornmarket St, Centre, Cork, T12 W6EP, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Rucha Ambilpure", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "We tried Marinated Avacado and Vegan Avacado Toast. Both the dishes were good. The beans in Vegan Avacado Toast were nicely made with some Onion and Pepper in it. Avacado was also very fresh. Ambiance of place is good. They have good amount of sitting. The staff was also very friends and helpful.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mr Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "A great fry up breakfast not to be mistaken for a traditional full Irish breakfast as it has no beans. De Calf Cafe does their own tasty twist with a relish sauce and a very large mushroom. Served very quickly and nice and warm. The breakfast is €14.50 just enough left from €15 to leave a tip if you decide to. The price is expensive but that is expected as these are average prices nowadays. With restaurants and pubs closing every day due to rising costs and vat rates etc. The staff at Del Calf Cafe are very hard working and constantly busy keeping the place looking fantastic and clean. It is a great restaurant with plenty of space seating that offers privacy alongside intimacy. It has a great interior and is very cosy in a historic part of the city. Highly recommend as they have a great menu and selection of foods and drinks.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "NeptuneNebula", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "The food was awesome, and honestly, they had the best mocha that I've had during my friend and I's trip throughout Ireland. Their french toast was also very good and a nice start to the day.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Taylor Sexton", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Visited on a busy Saturday for Lunch and only had to wait a moment for a seat. Got the Toastie and soup of the day and everything was delicious - very filling and quick service!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Geetha Shree N", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "Edited 5 years ago", "review_text": "Giving one star for the very rude... I’m assuming the manager!! The lady.. doesn’t know how to give proper customer service! No hospitality! Just straight up yelled at us that they don’t have any bread when we asked for sandwich as if she didn’t want us there ! And was not patient enough to answer my doubts about the filling for the wrap .... gave us stale relish ! The carrot cake was bad ... Very dirty spoons ! Very unwelcoming! Never stepping here again !\nAs a food safety manager I wouldn’t recommend to eat here because the food tasted like it was plastic !\nBut the coffee was very served by the lovely barista ... who I hope is treated well by the management....", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "BCL ADRIAN", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "De Calf is a very nice restaurant to eat lunch or breakfast or even just have a coffee and cake. It is hidden inside TK Max shopping just off Corn Market in Cork City. They have options for vegitarians, vegans and non vegan. Their prices are quite good in comparison to other restaurants in Cork City. This is the perfect restaurant for a budget breakfast or lunch and/or tea and coffee. They provide good quality food also and the portions are generous. You don't leave there hungry at a very good price. The staff there are very nice. There are managers there both with blond hair but are so so nice they are extremely friendly and always welcoming. They provide top quality service and always have your requests at the heart of their service. Thank you guys. Still highly recommend here for lunch or breakfast.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mariosa Bryceland", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Honestly my favourite brunch spot in cork the veggie options are just absolutely delicious and the ingredients are so fresh. Highly recommend", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Noor Baizura Adnan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "I lived in Cork for 3 years. This cafe was one of my weekend highlights. On Saturdays I would wake up early in the morning just so I can get my fave cappucino and scone (with clotted cream!) at this cafe. Another to-go dish is the eggs with marinated avocado dish, I can’t remember the name. Amazing place, great service, and topnotch food!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rania", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I recently visited this cafe and tried their lemon twist cake and flat white. I was pleasantly surprised by the amazing flavor of the lemon cake. However, the flat white wasn't the best. The atmosphere is calm and peaceful, and I enjoyed my time there.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Olena Harty", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Came here on Thursday for a quick cuppa and scone. Lovely smell in the cafe, everything homemade. When we walked into the cafe it was quite busy which was a good sign. Latte nice and scone fine too. I would of preferred if the scone was warm when served and there was a bit of a baking powder taste to it but I enjoyed the scone though. Staff were jolly. All in all I did have a nice experience in De Calf Cafe and will be coming back :) .", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Cornstore Cork
address: 41-43, Cornmarket St, Centre, Cork, T12 R886, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "A J (Lexi)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Saturday for lunch. Great outdoor seating, cute inside. The Birds and the Bees cocktail was fantastic, even the bees loved it [literally]! The Duck was phenomenal, hubs even tried the appetizer which surprised me! The steak was well cooked also. Decently priced $126.26 on my credit card which should include tip but seems cheaper than I remember...", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Teresa", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "I dined here on a Friday night and had a lovely experience. The food was amazing, high quality ingredients cooked to perfection. Nice laid back atmosphere here, and the staff are great, very professional.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mark Mirigian", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Great place for a date night, with areas for semi-private booths away from the open seating areas. The French onion soup was flavorful but a little sweet. Steaks were cooked perfectly, tender and juicy. Some bolder red wines (like a Primitivo) would pair better with good steaks. The cookie and ice cream is worth another visit.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Elizabeth Sayers-Birdee", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "We chose the set menu. Chicken liver parfait to start and then the ribeye steak, it's served with spinach and chips or mash. All delicious, my friend said it was the best steak he'd had in a long time. Service is also good, all in all definitely worth a visit whilst in Cork", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jemima Daisy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Gorgeous steak - we shared the Tomahawk special (1kg). Dauphinaise potatos were a stand out - very cheesy! The blue cheese accompanying sauce was really lovely but the bone marrow butter was a little disappointing - tasted weirdly like shop bought garlic sauce?!
Tuna ceviche was missing a bit of the lime / citrus flavour I expected but was still enjoyable.

Baked Alaska and creme brulee were very tasty puddings. Wine list was decent.

Old fashioned cocktail was perfect!

Service was excellent and very attentive.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Jake Higgins", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Decided to try on a busy Saturday night so atmosphere inside was good, service was quick and attentive.

Food was distinctly okay. Went for the steak but could not say it particularly stood out against other offerings elsewhere. Would give another try as rest of the menu has some good options.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "savannah flood", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "We went here for our anniversary dinner, it was delicious we had a great experience. The cocktails were next level exquisite, i was driving and they accommodated my no alcohol request perfectly. All the cocktails are made to request as I was able to order any of the cocktails as mocktails. I ordered the pornstar martini and they even served me a shot of lemonade! My partner enjoyed normal cocktails and reported they were amazing. For dinner I ordered the sundries tomato cannelloni which wasn’t my favourite but still nice. My partner ordered the salmon which was cooked perfectly. We ordered a side of mashed potatoes which were creamy and delicious. Desert was equally delicious and the staff surprised us with a candle for our anniversary. Overall it was well worth the price.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Estere B", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Absolutely fabulous! The food was very delicious and the portion sizes much bigger than I expected for reasonable prices.
Would definetly recommend if you are visiting Cork city. The vibe was also very nice and our server amazing!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ann Murray", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "One of our favourite places to eat, scrumptious food and lovely staff. My husband had the ribeye steak with a side of beef dripping chips and I had the risotto and a side of Café de Paris wedges, absolutely delicious.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Richard Lavery", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Great meal here recently. Party of 4. Got mussels, French onion soup and prawn pil pil to start. All delicious.
Steaks for main - cooked perfectly.
Cookie in a pan desert was quality. Enough for 3 ppl.
The drinks were also top class. Unreal spicy margarita", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Tory's Cafe
address: 74 Tory Top Rd, Ballyphehane, Cork, T12 AH2Y, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Derya Seril", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "We had a wonderful breakfast with my family. Everything was delicious, and the staff were incredibly friendly and attentive. We felt very comfortable and can’t wait to come back😊", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Hamdi Çankaya", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 weeks ago", "review_text": "The café was great! I had the eggs with halloumi and they were super tasty. Friendly staff and nice vibe.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Zeynep Ayse Sengor", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "You can find famous Turkish pastries in here, everything is amazing. Strongly recommend 😍", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sercem DOĞAN", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Such a cozy place with amazing coffee and super friendly staff. I felt at home the moment I walked in. Can’t wait to come back", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "İrem Akyüz", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Lovely atmosphere, amazing flavors, and everything feels so fresh. Highly recommended!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aslı Korkut", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "I tried coffee and dessert today. They were deliciousss 😍 Also, the location and the staff were very lovely ☺️", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ruth M", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Small bustling cafe. Can't comment on food as I only had a (good) Latte. My dining companion had 2 soft fried eggs with bacon, sausage, toast and tea which he demolished in no time. Very busy at 11am but turnaround seemed fast with tables emptying and filling very quickly coming up to lunch time. Menu looks good. Looking forward to trying it another time. Parking might be an issue as there are other businesses in the area. I was lucky enough to get one just across the road. Best trying off peak times I'd say.  There are a few outside tables also.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "İbrahim Şengör", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great café with friendly staff! They serve fresh Turkish pastries like börek and simit, as well as Turkish coffee, alongside a traditional Irish breakfast.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Büşran Betül Kaya", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "🌸 We drank delicious Turkish coffee and ate the best spinach roll. friendly people ever💛best luck guys.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Joanne Cronin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely, friendly neighbourhood cafe. Stopped for a quick breakfast, and really enjoyed my avocado toast with hummus & chili jam. Coffee is from Maher’s in Cork. Dogs welcome outside.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Coffee Corner Cafe
address: Eastgate Ave, Castleview, Little Island, Co. Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Abdul Jabbar Younus", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Visited the place. They have renovated the place recently. Easy place walk in as my workplace is nearby. Have been visiting the place regularly for the past 1 year now. Food is lovely. Anything you can try lots if variety in the Foods. And Tastes lovely Veg Sausage was lovely today. Highly Recommended place to visit. Very popular around the Area. Staff is very friendly and Always greets you with a Smile and Welcome and Serve you very well. Coffee is also Decent and Fresh. Food is always Fresh and they have Lots of Cakes and Pastries too. Do go and Visit. I am a Regular visitor there", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Bart", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Coffee Corner in Little Island is a quiet spot where you can enjoy a sandwich as well as a cup of coffee.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Clar G", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "The food is lovely but the prices are outrageous. I just got a tiny roll (ciabatta) with lettuce, couscous and a single slice of cheddar for €7.50. Its the same price as a full meat and salad roll - absolutely crazy. I wouldn't have ordered if they told me the cost beforehand.
(Photo with my hand next to it for context of how tiny the roll is).", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "jacinta cullen", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "had a refreshments here after a few hours in The Range - hit the spot - lovely atm - Victoria was great - gorgeous brown bread and cake - tea and coffee... relaxing and comfortable - felt revived afterwards and wasn't expensive unlike another place near by.. products are home made too - either on site or from local sources -  a great find..", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Geane Fernanda S. Farias", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Unfortunately we didn't have a good experience, we ordered lasagne and quiche and after 30 minutes of waiting our food hadn't been prepared, the café was quiet and the two girls who were serving us didn't tell us anything about what was happening with our order so we gave up.
It was sad because we spent a long time waiting for our food, time wasted waiting and frustrating because we had hoped to have a good experience, especially with the service.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Denise Busby", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "I was standing at the counter for 8 minutes and no one assisted me with an order. So I moved to the cash register and one lady in front of me and yet out of the 5 people behind the counter, only the cashier asked if the bottled drink was all I wanted. I just paid and left. So disappointed as I work in the industrial estate and would have become a regular.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Yvonne C", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "Was there recently. Slow service but maybe they were short staffed. Got a chicken tikka wrap and a cappuccino. Expensive for what it was. It would have been nice to get a bit of salad or a few crisps on the side. Won't be rushing back.
Edit. I got a chicken tikka wrap with salad and a few crisps and a coffee with a meal deal in Dunnes cafe, Bishopstown for half the price.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Praveeni Kaluarachchi", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I liked this place until I understood that I paid €5.50 for a small piece of cake. As I feel it is ridiculously expensive. Thereafter I decided I wouldn't buy anything without asking the price. The staff and the place is nice though.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Joyce Buttimer", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "Best lemon meringue and coffee.   Plenty of free parking.  Beside the Range", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jerome B. Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "I enjoyed a beautiful heated, chilli chicken wrap with a little salad on the side. Food 5 star.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Joshua Tree
address: 70 Blarney St, Sunday's Well, Cork, T23 NN12, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Gone Mad", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great pub great people who goes in there friendly place staff lovely owner William they calls him bill lovely great to go out for the day or night", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Assunta D", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "Walked here after work by chance. It is the perfect place to enjoy some irish drinks and relax!
The atmosphere is great, the setting is cosy and the staff very friendly.
Very impressed with the beer garden too.
We really enjoyed it and definetly we’ll go back!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Meara Hurtig", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Gavin is an absolute legend!!! We’re from Canada and he showed us the true meaning of Irish hospitality. If we’re ever back, we will 100% be visiting! Thanks so much for this wonderful experience :)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Siobhan keohane", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 3 years ago", "review_text": "Great bar . Friendly atmosphere,  the staff are friendly. . Really enjoy my nights out there . The regulars are friendly and a good laugh . The ladies dart team are brilliant and the darts are good too 🎯🎯🎯 . From live music, Dj , and cater for party's and all occasions.  Very wide selection of drinks , You really couldn't ask for more on a night out . Blarney Streets finest.  🎶🎉🍾🍻🎯🇮🇪", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "jeff sheehy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Great bar, fantastic staff! The best bar in the North side by far.. never ever had a bad night there 👍🏼 …", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Gina Cahalane", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Thank to all the staff at the josh we had a party there Friday night it was fantasic the staff where amazing .atmosphere was great thanks to you all .highly recommended", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lisa Gearhart", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "Enjoyed my time at The Joshua Tree. Went on bingo night (Wednesday) and had a blast! The walls are lined with books and there was plenty of seating when I went. It was definitely a cool place to visit and the beer selection was decent.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Elena Butterworth", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Cozy and unique! This a lovely pub that looks quiet on the outside and is so cool in the inside. Cozy fire, great prices and the owner, Bill, is charming", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Declan O'Driscoll", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Sound system  not great  toilet  doors don't lock to dj how work there check your pay at end of night", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Cara O'Connor", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "Pub is lovely and the pints were fresh. New to the neighborhood myself and it feels very much like a locals only place. Otherwise fantastic", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Canty's Bar
address: 6 Pembroke St, Centre, Cork, T12 A378, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Mick Crosse", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Best pint of Murphy's I've ever had. When the bar closed, the staff kindly escorted us out the back to the pub next door with our pints.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paul Glass", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Popped in for a drink on a Thursday night in September and found this gem. Great service, perfect pints and the live band were excellent.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alwyn Howard", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "Just strolling around the city and popped in. We sat out side watching the world hussle around us. Had 2 lovely pints of Birra Moretti and had a bit of banter with the welcoming and friendly staff. Def worth a try", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Do No Evil", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "I've been here a few times, and now that they've improved the sound system, I'll be coming more often. The location is great. Solid security personnel. Great staff. Great live music.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Luevada Posey", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Wonderful pub!!!  Bartender was fabulous!  Very quaint pub for an quiet afternoon drink!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "J 19", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Everything a pub should be.  Comfy seats, cozy atmosphere; attentive, pleasant staff.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "D", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Great pub great staff great pints. Bar man was a gent he is a Big Liverpool fan next time in cork this where I’ll go.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Brian Holmes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Great bar for live music, top bands on while we were there. No problems getting served even when busy", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nina G", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Tried Irish coffee and hot whiskey for the first time and it was nice. You can enjoy the sun there if you sit in front of the place. The waiter was friendly", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Gary Hare", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Great no fuss genuine  city bar.  Staff are friendly, and the beer is spot on.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Coffee Scape
address: 31 Pope's Quay, Shandon, Cork, T23 X30E, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Silvia Canevelli", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "This place is very popular. We really enjoy having our Vanilla Iced latte ( with honey) and the pink  one with coconut milk.
I also like a lot the cherry sponge cake!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lucas Raiol", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "One the best cafés in Cork without a doubt!

Their lattes are extremely well-made and they have many options of different flavors. Also, they’re experts at making delicious sweets and desserts. I’d definitely recommend their pistachio tiramisu!

If you’re looking for something savory as well, they sandwiches are very tasty. Crunchy bread with high quality ingredients!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Róisín Harrington", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "This place is the best Café in Cork. Owned by such a friendly family, the best customer service you'll get. Coffeescape has a rich atmosphere and an even richer heart. Incredible vegan dishes and pastries, and vegan hot and cold drinks. Beautiful interior and always clean and cosy. The food is great quality, and absolutely delicious. Huge range of pastries and sweet treats, and so many drink options, many of which I have never heard of and sound delicious. The staff are always so friendly and accommodative. Love this place, 5 stars 🩷", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Micheál-Desmond Nugent", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Beautiful spot. Cozy and welcoming. Lovely staff. She explained the traditional Croatian food to me and it tastes amazing. Safe to say I'll be coming back 👍👍👍", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tania Giannecchini", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Coffee Scape is my favourite spot in Cork!
The team has completely changed the way I experience coffee, turning it into a moment of joy, whether I’m alone or with others. They’ve brought to Cork a warm, Mediterranean-style appreciation for the little things in life, reminding me of the sweet slow-life of southern Europe.
Thank you for creating such a happy space and for always being the friendliest!", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Maria Isabel Restrepo Velez", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The coffee here is great, and the sweets and cakes are just as lovely, but what really makes this place special is the people. Their warmth and kindness are nicer than anything you could buy.

It’s the kind of spot where you can sit back, relax, and truly enjoy your evening. I love coming here, it’s my favorite place in town to sit and chat with friends.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Caroline Paiva", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Definitely my favorite café in town!

Delicious food, coffee, and desserts, friendly and kind staff, and a wonderful atmosphere—cozy indoors and vibrant outdoors with a beautiful view.

I highly recommend visiting and trying the pistachio hot chocolate!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Liudmyla Petrenko", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I recently visited this delightful Croatian cafe and was thoroughly impressed. The coffee is exceptional, rich, and perfectly brewed. The homemade pastries and snacks, prepared fresh right in front of you, are simply delicious. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making you feel like you've stepped into a friend's home. The friendly staff and cozy decor add to the charm. Additionally, you can enjoy a trendy outdoor seating area by the river. If you appreciate great coffee, tasty treats, and a welcoming environment, this cafe is a must-visit!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Amaia Medina Pérez", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "I've been coming to this cafe a lot lately since it's close to my house and I couldn't be happier. They make the best mocha I've ever tasted and on top of that they are super nice. Both the guy and the girls who attend you are always pending and are super nice. I recommend 💯 this place apart from the fact that it is at the river and having a coffee in the sun overlooking the river is worth it, and more adding the good experience that is to be there.
Another important fact is that you can be with the computer working and studying, as there are many cafes that do not allow you to work and study.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Carol Moura", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "This is the best coffee i have been to in Cork. Great variety of drinks and incredible cake! The staff is very friendly, especially Jacob, who was so nice to me and my friend! Will definitely come back!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Paper Boys
address: Tobin St, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "María", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "This place was AMAZING. The food was sooo good, we got the fried buttermilk chicken with fries and the French toast. It was savory, crunchy and was seasoned perfectly. I ate in the little garden there is behind, it was a lovely place with a great atmosphere. The service was really nice, the food took a little long to come out, but it’s understandable since they were packed. I will be definitely coming back!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Helen L", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Five stars across the board for food, value and service at this gorgeous spot. Thank to our host Zelen for his warmth and friendliness. I highly recommend the French toast with fried chicken - you can tell everything is prepared with love in here! Service was quick and great value for money. A must visit when in the city. 🥰", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Richard Capes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Brilliant.

Staff friendly and attentive without being pushy.

We sat in the garden which is an odd but nice spot to sit out in.

We both ate “The Morning Issue” and they were both delicious.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Stephen O", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Really high quality food with a distinctive menu. I had the Benny Boru which was excellent. Lovely ham hock along with eggs and boxty. I’d also say the coffee is the best I’ve had in Ireland. Australian level of quality", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Naneh Hovhannisyan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "The food we ordered was really nice. We liked ham hock. Couldn’t stay for tea and coffee after our breakfast because we felt cold. It wasn’t warm comfortable temperature inside for us.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "keithlee spangler", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Truly the best breakfast I’ve had in Ireland - honestly maybe ever? At first I was bummed because I wanted the chicken & waffle I saw on the menu pictured here (it was dated, though). I thought about skipping to eat somewhere else but one of the staff said they instead do fried chicken & French toast so I had to try it.

It’s absolutely INCREDIBLE. The French toast is almost like a kouign-amann or croissant bun and the fried chicken is the absolute best I’ve ever had. Wild that that’s true of Ireland :)

The chicken was perfectly spicy, perfectly cooked, and stayed crunchy but juicy the entire meal. Blown away. I also got an iced dirty chia and it was really good. I find the seating a bit uncomfortable but manageable (even as a large person).

Highly recommend - must try.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Kayla Kelly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Believe the reviews, seriously the best food I’ve had so far in Ireland, which I’m sure could be controversial. Amazing food, describing wouldn’t do justice. Drinks were also perfect!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kat M", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Great place for a brunch! Didn't know what to expect since the inside looked smaller and more quaint, but then a back outside area was just around the other side of the cashier space. Great food, good portions, friendly staff, reasonably priced and good atmosphere / music. Well deserved 5 stars rating.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Orla", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "A good choice of items on the menu and really friendly and accommodating staff. The space is small and cosy. This Turkish eggs dish is incredible, I loved every single mouthful; a great serving of bread with it to mop up that flavourful yoghurt. So good, will be back to eat it again!!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "So Fi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Great spot for brunch! We ordered The Day Tripper and Benny Boru.  Both really good", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Café Atrium
address: Mardyke Arena, Mardyke Walk, Mardyke, Cork, T12 N1FK, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Sheetal Palle", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "This place has very healthy food. I got a cajun chicken and cheese melt with sourdough bread. The chicken was freshly made, I was afraid it was pre-made, store bought chicken but it wasn’t! Previously, I got a loaded potato with chicken, I don’t recommend that combination tho. Also, the first time I came here, the kitchen was closed, but the workers were so nice they made me a falafel salad bowl. This was a very filling, post-workout meal (5 stars)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alicia Manahan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 3 months ago", "review_text": "Actually it's a hidden gem, thought great selection of food and plenty of seating.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Dave Brooks", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "Jackie and Simon gave a group of 20 of us fantastic food and very attentive service for a great price. name: JJ Walsh's
address: 64 Oliver Plunkett St, Centre, Cork, T12 K5FH, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "A Ze", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "4 days ago", "review_text": "Mixed opinion on this place. The staff was nice and you could feel they get along well, which is always a good sign in hospitality. We had to wait a bit but it was okay regarding the number of people. Prices are ok.
The live music was lovely and the vibe felt really Irish.
But, the bathrooms (men and women) could easily be improved.  2 of our glasses weren't perfectly clean, we like to hope it's stains from the dishwasher!
The ashtrays could be emptied more often especially during busy nights.
We had a good time there, but would visit other pubs before coming back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Shannon Miller", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 weeks ago", "review_text": "10/10 experience Roy who was our bar tender was so kind. We weren’t sure what to drink and he gave up amazing options and we got unbelievable drinks all night. His service was immaculate could not commend him more for his service!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Liam Bambridge", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Had a fantastic time in this bar last night! Not many places offer live music on a Monday night, but this was one of them and the singer (Ricky Kelleher) was brilliant! Great atmosphere and a very friendly barman. Definitely worth checking out, especially if Ricky is playing!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Stuart Thirlwell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "We came in for some drinks whilst visiting Cork, we found the pub very friendly and welcoming.  The main bar area was full of history and pictures which was very interesting. The bar staff were very friendly and quick to serve and very happy to chat about the place.  I wish we could have spent more time here but it gives us a reason to come back in the future.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Helena Handbasket", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Disappointing. No craic on Sunday night. Told us that the gay bar upstairs was opening at nine. It wasn't. Horrible smell of puke downstairs.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Wayne Phair", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "This place felt like a proper Irish bar! There was live Irish music, people dancing, plenty of stumbling drunks, and even a few drinks being knocked over haha. We fully enjoyed the lively atmosphere. The only downside was how busy it was to get served, but to be fair, the staff never stopped and we eventually got our drinks.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Trevor Kirimi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Alma is an amazing bartender and mixologist she definitely knew her stuff and recommended drinks I never even knew existed. 11/10 would definitely recommend this pub and am definitely going back for another drink!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Simone Cotter", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 weeks ago", "review_text": "I must say the bartender Roy  made the experience he gave ous all a full description of the taste of all cocktails definitely knew his stuff and really did make our experience unique and worth coming back
Thanks Roy you were amazing definitely will be back", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "ian holden", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Visited here on a stag do - Cork won the hurling, atmosphere was electric! Band spotted us Scots so played 3 Scottish songs for us - brilliant! :-)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Liam Griffin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Trevor gave me and my girlfriend brilliant service absolute 10/10 experience had a fabulous night with brilliant music and he made our experience so memorable", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Bierhaus
address: 28 Pope's Quay, Shandon, Cork, T23 AE79, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "ZhenJin Liang", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "I'm a beer lover .I have been to here numerous times . Without a doubt, it's the best craft beer bar in Cork!!  They offer 30 different tap beer and friendly service with cozy atmosphere !!  I fully recommend this place !!  Adding this place for tourist  just visit in Cork .You will never disappointed!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Pat omahony", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Visited this pub recently and really enjoyed my visit. Brilliant selection of range of beers and alcohol available also selection of IPA beers available. Atmosphere was great and barman was very friendly. Call in and check this pub", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ryan Stoker", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Fun pub quiz on Mondays. Be sure to call for a reservation. My wife and I try to do a quiz in every country we visit and this was one of the best so far.

Also a great beer selection. Over 30 taps!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin McCabe", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "One of the best beer selections in Cork city, if not the entire county. Eclectic atmosphere with good views out onto the river and road. The beer list really is quite impressive. A rare spot that (from what I could tell) does not even serve Irish stout. They also have a healthy selection of (mostly Irish) whiskey. They do serve a few wines and also have other spirits at the bar for anyone not interested in a beer or whiskey. Looked like they also serve or allow you to order pizza, as there was a small menu there. Highly recommend for global beer travelers/lovers.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Oren_LG", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Very nice, cosy bub. Good beer, good atmosphere in there. Nice staff,  very recommended.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Bruna Soares", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "My favorite pub in Cork!
I love sitting outside and enjoying the view.
The inside is really nice too, I love the decoration.
They have so many different beers, I tried some but my favorite one is the number 4 (I always order the number, cause I don’t remember the name hahaha).
Nice staff too ;)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Matija Grcic", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "Always good to visit. They have 30 beers on tap and about 220 all together.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Claire Maddock", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Amazing selection of beers and IPAs. It's great that you can also bring your dog into the pub with you. Interesting quiz night every Monday.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sibeesh Venu", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "A small bar with a very limited space to sit as we were 9 people we found it hard to find a table for us to sit. It is often crowded. There is also some sitting area on the back side. The staffs were very nice. There was no music, maybe it is because the bar is near the apartment complex.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "J. Abranches", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Good pub to drink some nice beer. They have kind of different options, like German, Czech and Polish beer. I really enjoyed my experience there. Definitely will be back.
Note: they have Erdinger draught beer available. (Weissbier and Larger) 👍🏻", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Eco
address: 1/2 Eastville, Douglas East, Cork, T12 R288, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Fionnuala Costello", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The best food we've had in Douglas. I had half a roast chicken. The stir-fry vegetables were particularly delicious. It was busy and buzzing but we were in a booth and could hear each other talk. Such a good atmosphere we stayed on for desserts, which were large and indulgent with the best chocolate sauce.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Merve Gönül", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "It was a nice experience. Can't fault it.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paul Looney", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 5 months ago", "review_text": "Always a great experience here, wonderful food, fantastic service and brilliant staff. Highly recommended.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rostellan Abu", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "put salt on my chips when I asked for for no salt

I ordered and paid for a portion of peas but never got them.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Charina Jones", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 5 years ago", "review_text": "Highly reccomened!! My 2nd favourite restaurant to enjoy a nice steak in Cork.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Laxmikant Deshpande (Lax)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Gone for dinner with family, great food, food service, huge quantity compared to other restaurants, will certainly visit again.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eirinn Bredin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Pleasant staff and great food & venue. A smaller kitcen makes for a more cosy and lively experience while dining with the hustle and bustle. Would recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Hannah Foley", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Okay so i ordered the chicken wings and chocolate cake yesterday and it was amazing, i hyped it up to my dad and he said to order it again today for dinner, so i ordered him the chicken wings and me 2 pieces of chocolate cake (im just a girl like dont judge xx) and i had the first one earlier and it was fine, im in my selfcare routine now letting my hair dye settle amd opened the second one, opened the tub of chocolate sauce and theres this mould on it🥴🥴🥴 now no judgement it could just be a honest mistake but like still!! Ew!! Id just say to the staff please please just dont let this happen again because.. again. Ew! Ive put the photo of proof of my order and the pic of the tub in the pictures so yeah just be cautious!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "James Herlihy", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Great food ans service. Big menu but really we'll worth the visit", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Cork Coffee Roasters
address: 16 Anglesea St, Ballintemple, Cork, T12 XY00, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "kieran Kenneally", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Coffee is excellent and a nice layout inside with a upstairs area that looks pretty cool. Didn't try any food.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "M", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "THE BEST coffee; I go out of my way to get it.
The almond croissants are also delicious.
On top of all that, the staff are so friendly, kind & welcoming.
Credit to everyone concerned,
Thank you,
From a very happy customer😊", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Robert Schuppert-McDonald", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "The coffee was good and the inside atmosphere fine. The outside deck upstairs looked like a good place hangout. Except when I went up there other customers were sitting with their feet on the chairs. Hopefully on a return visit this won't be the case.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jonathan Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely cafe and coffee roasters. Great coffee, friendly and efficient staff, cosy and welcoming ambience, what's not to like!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sarah Kelleher", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Absolutely love this coffee it is all I drink with years and this morning I found a stone in my whole beans. My sage machine nearly broke over this. A terrible noise coming from the grinder and I took it all  apart to find a stone that looked just like a bean must have been put through the roast also as it has that coating to it. Not a great way to start the morning. Could have cost me a fortune also if I kept trying to grind the beans.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Dori H", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Went out of our way to stop here for a mocha and latte based on others reviews. The cafe is super cute and the barista was friendly. But the drinks had a very weird aftertaste like the machine wasn't clean or the espresso beans were bad. My husband and I have a rule that if it's not good, we throw it out. We won't waste the calories. These were so bad that they went in the trash.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "grace mcl", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "A lovely coffee shop with very nice staff
The staff are friendly and helpful

Wheelchair and buggy accessible
Nice indoor and outdoor seating available
Also has a lovely outdoor seating available in the back

Nice coffee options and you also buy your beans here
They offer alternative milk options like oat and almond
Also have fresh treats available
Street parking available in front and I’m the surrounding areas", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Noreire Dalton", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Got a coffe & gluten free lemon slice, it was delicious, the best tasting coffee I've had in Cork city, the staff are so friendly & helpful.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "David O' Leary", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 days ago", "review_text": "Very tasty coffee and they have a lovely little rooftop garden as well", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jaime Lettich", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "One of the best coffees I've ever tried in my life. Their cappucino also is amazing and very tasteful. They have great options for food too and I do reccomend the carrot cake, it's great!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: O'Flynns Gourmet Sausage Co.
address: 14 Winthrop St, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Sarah O’Reilly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "We had some O’Flynns sausages in the English market - very tasty. I had the original one - pictured. I’d highly recommend getting one, you can them in a few places around the city.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mike Devlin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Great sausage sandwich and sausage box. Great flavor. Side baked potato wedges were the best I've ever had.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Avrom Wolf", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Stumbled upon this place after arriving in Cork and wanting a late lunch. The two young women working were so friendly and helpful. They served me up a delicious meal and gave me a few tips on places to checkout while in town. Couldn't beat service like that, very good!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Wayne Crawford", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Called in this evening ( Sunday 6th ) was greated by a gentleman and a lovly lady who couldn't of been nicer

Since this was my first time here I was unsure on what to order as I had seen videos of here on social media

Myself and friend went for the Dinner box with normal sausage and spuds with cheese and mayo and ohhh my God I was not disappointed

Would Highly recommend and staff are 5 STAR

Thanks again", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "C Yager", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Flaky crust on all of the rolls, some of the sausage flavours are pretty mild and could use more flavour.  The potato side dish was fresh and hot. Fast service and reasonable prices. Indoor and outdoor  seating.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Samuel Gavin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Awesome value especially for the location in the heart of Cork. Great tasting well portioned food. Super friendly staff. Great menu choice. Great music choice. I enjoyed the Dawg monthly special which is great for something new and unique. I'll grab a quick good value bite here anytime I'm in Cork again.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Gearóid", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "These guys came to my work place. Staff running the place are good craic and so nice. To say that the hot dog was savage is an understatement. By far the best one I have ever have. If you are ever in the English Market in Cork, please do not miss these guys. Top notch stuff", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mr Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "Fantastic food and what a great selection. Starting at €7 euros. Call it what you want O' Flynns gourmet Sausage cafe is such a busy little hot dog sausage roll restaurant, how the staff get this food to you in such a fast way without losing the quality of the food served is what keeps people satisfied. Great to see how they work, with obvious pride to the core of the business. The end result is top quality food served to top quality standards. Fast service fresh tasty and filling. Check out the set menu or select your own ingredients. With dine in and take away options this is definitely worth a visit. Great Value.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Maximilian F", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Extremely kind service this morning, and the sausage box with house fried potatoes is phenomenal. Lovely spot to grab a quick bite.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mike Kimball", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "We arrived as a group of 5, 4 of us from Canada. It was our first time here, the service was way above excellent! They explained the menu, and gave us suggestions on what was best to order. The 2 behind the grill/counter made this experience over the top!  Can not recommend enough!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Alibi Bar + Kitchen
address: 31 Washington Street West, Centre, Cork, T12 VW67, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "James Rigby", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "What a perfect bar in Cork City on Washington St. the downstairs has a classic old school feel with real bartenders and cocktails and the upstairs is like a boutique sports lounge.  The two ladies who were the bartenders were so professional and helpful, helping us to watch NFL American Football
The food was as good as the service, including burgers and sandwiches.
I really can’t say enough about the staff here, truly 5 star!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "H (H)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "I contacted them to book and let them know I’m vegan. They got in vegan cheese for me, the Nachos were GORGEOUS and loved the French Martini cocktail 🍸
Would recommend, hopefully they will keep doing vegan nachos 🤩 …", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Will Rigby", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Some of the best service I have ever received in my life. Visiting from the states, accommodated our family in every way possible. Food is top tier as well! Thank you!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Saeed", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "This is my first trip after 18 months of pandemic, and it happened to be in Cork, Ireland for two weeks. I loved every bit of it and there is so much to talk about. Among different places that I visited, The Alibi is one of my favorites. It's a cozy, warm, friendly place, for just a drink, or for a group night out. I highly recommend this place and if I come back to Cork, I will definitely visit this place again. The manager, Shane was amazing, so was everyone else who served us. Greatly recommended.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Pauline Cooke", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "Ordered food at 7pm Monday 2nd Dec at the Alibi bar Cork to be shown a NOTE at 7.45pm by the bar staff from the kitchen that our order won’t be started from at least another 45 mins to maybe an hour as the kitchen was busy! It was like a sketch from Fawlty Towers sitcom. Absolute disgrace no other people in the bar to be served, so I guess filling online orders & the customers sitting weren’t important at all. Took a refund & left, what a joke of an establishment, no respect for customers, at least have the manners to tell us this as soon as the order went in, there was just two of us how hard could it be to cook a few burgers, it’s not rocket science. I had spoken to the bar staff before we ordered about booking for a group next week which I now wouldn’t dream of doing. Would never recommend ye to anyone for food. Very nice bar staff who were left to deal with it too which is also unfair all I could say to the lad was no problem it’s not your fault.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Shalvi Raj", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "My partner loves the burger they are serving there. The vibe at that place is nice! It's always been a nice experience for us. It's usually cosy and warm. The staff is friendly.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Dean Rigby", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Great food + drinks, excellent service and friendly staff.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Marie O'Donnell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Staff are very friendly, welcoming, and helpful.
Burgers are amazing!!! So tasty.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alexander Gebhard", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Simply excellent!
Lots of vegan food that tastes excellent. Also a super atmosphere.
Would totally recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Seán Tynan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Very cozy bar with friendly staff and clientele. You can easily chat to people here. So relaxing. Food menu available, and good selection of beers.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Black Market
address: Dornan's Yard, The Black Market, Monahan Rd, Ballintemple, Cork, T12 NXN1, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Amanda O' Sullivan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "The Black Market is a super trendy spot with a great mix of food vendors — everything from pizza and burgers to coffee and sweet treats. There’s both indoor and outdoor seating, giving it a relaxed, social vibe.

We treated ourselves to a delicious pizza from Burnt Pizza, followed by a juicy burger and crispy chips from Smash Burger. For drinks, we had a creamy white chocolate mocha from Soma Coffee, and wrapped it all up with a beautifully smooth vanilla milkshake.

Parking was fine since it wasn’t too busy when we went. Overall, we really enjoyed our visit and will definitely be back!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jack Smiles", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Really cool place with great food and coffee.
We installed our stretch tent here for an event a few years ago.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ciaran Chestnutt", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "A nice different market to experience in cork other than the marina market which I'm sure takes all the attention. I really liked the vibe in here and how it felt more permanent of a place. It would be great if it was bigger but I can see clearly why it isn't. Only issue I have is that it is hard to find parking. That's nit really an issue with the place at all though.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sue Sue", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "First time here and my only regret is that I haven’t been before.
We had the Chicken and Bacon Souvlaki (skewers) meal deal from Taste of Home unit.. absolutely delicious, so fresh and filling. Staff were lovely as well and all for just €15 with a drink.
In addition we also had a spicy Neapolitan pizza from Burnt, it wins hands down for one of the best pizzas I have tasted in years!
Could not  recommend The Black Market any more highly.  We parked in the overflow car park with no issues whatsoever… just be aware of the speed bumps there which are hard to see.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Giacomo Corti", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Really cool food court in a warehouse, loved the post modern vibe and the restaurants built in containers.
We had dinner with pies, served with mash and pickled veggies. They were amazing and flavourful, unfortunately one of us got sick after the vegetarian one. Still, recommended if you look for a quiet place out of the city centre.
We did not find no alcoholic beverages so don't expect them here", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Jorge García", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "It's a amaaazing place that is quiet and not noisy. The owner has always been very nice and attentive to us and our furry friends whenever we've visited. Nice coffee too. I recommend it wholeheartedly.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Allen Odonoghue", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great spot for good food, and all the options look good. We got pizza from Di Tuccio which the kids loved, and the staff here at Di Tuccios were so nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend them. We also tried DIPS Asian cuisine, where the noodles were fantastic. Looking forward to returning to try some of the other foods.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin McCabe", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Really liked this little spot and can imagine it being a very busy place for lunch time, given the surrounding commerce in the area. I was a bit early, at around noon, and there were only a few patrons. There were only 3 spots open when I was there…Dips Asian, Brendan’s Burritos, and Soma Coffee (which also serves breakfast I believe). There is LOTS of bench seating and it seemed to be dog friendly with bowls of water available. It’s a fairly small car park (I imagine most walk from the surrounding area), and there are bathrooms available on the exterior of the building. Not open Monday or Tuesday.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Fiona", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Variety of food stalls. Parking can be a little tight but has overflow parking. Prices are higher but the food is good. Ambience is relaxed, clean and I would return", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Christopher Halpin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Came here on Fathers Day, was very busy as you would expect but didn’t have to wait long for my food. Really good atmosphere and had entertainment for the children which my girls loved. Will be back again!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Dunnes Café
address: Bishopstown Rd, Bishopstown, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Romeu Hayashi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Great food, excellent atmosphere and best of all, great price.

Dunnes Café is a place that myself and my family always go at least once every two weeks. I got even better after the remodeling!

Great breakfast buffet, we paid €5.25 for a 5 items buffet including tea or coffee.

They also have a pretty decent salad and sandwich buffet.

Absolutely worth trying", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Conor O'Donoghue", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Great place for a full lunch at a reasonable price when you don’t want to hassle with a restaurant or just a supermarket deli. Plenty of parking also.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "J. Alexander Kussad", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "A nice place to sit and grab a quick and affordable bite.  They’ve got decent porridge with berries at breakfast.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jaee Sakhalkar", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Great place to have breakfast or lunch at a reasonable price", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rosarie O'Mahony", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Ran in there yesterday for quick breakfast,  sausages, black pudding so overcooked they were hard, toast was cold and by the time I'd paid, queue at till, my breakfast was stone cold. Very disappointed I know it's cheap but that's no excuse.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Ad Fitz", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Best value I've seen for a Sunday dinner. €9.95 main course plus Dunnes points.  This is a no trainer!! Dunnes has really upped their game in all areas", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "LOUIE H", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Delicious beef bagel plus a drink nine euro only", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Anne Conroy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Love choices..good food & fresh produce..", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Vivienne Twomey", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Fantastic meal at great prices.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Zoe Fleming", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Used to love this place after getting amazing mocha frapes for super cheap however after my encounter with staff today I will not be returning. I ordered my usual mocha frappe however the staff member making it seemed to not be paying attention and made the drink in a weird way (I’m no barista so I’ll look past that) but after receiving the drinks they were 90% frothy milk. Unable to drink thru a straw and when I got the slightest taste it was nothing like it usually is. It had way too much coffee in it.
After going back and asking if it was possible to have it remade I was met with the staff smirking at each other and not giving me an answer.
As someone with extreme anxiety I’m trying to get better about speaking up for myself but this has set me back majorly. I was given a shrug and asked what I wanted so I just grabbed a lemonade.
Really disappointed", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Myo Cafe
address: 34 Pope's Quay, Shandon, Cork, T23 F590, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Heather Mayes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Cozy, local place for sitting or taking to go. Huge tea selection and a variety of sandwiches (including vegetarian ones 🙌🎉), and baked goods.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lucas Raiol", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Best café in Cork, BY FAR! Be it for a mid-winter gingerbread latte to have in their cozy indoor space or an iced latte by the River Lee during summer.

Myo has the best coffee, staff and principles in the city!

Simply 11/10", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ciarán Meers", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Really nice cozy cafe! Maximalist in the best possible way. Could benefit from a no laptop policy, given it is really small. Having two or three people on laptops takes up a lot of the space, and it isn’t really a ‘sit down and work for three hours’ type vibe anyway. Great coffee and appeltaart !", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Anne Cathrine B", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 days ago", "review_text": "Such a nice place!! Very good service and a lovely ambiance. We spent a very good time there. Even got some gaelic lessons from one of the guests we ended up talking too. We loved Cork and we lived this place!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Silvia Canevelli", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Very nice sitting near the river!
Beautiful place.
The latte is good!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Catherine Nikolajeva", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "My go-to lunch spot —staff are always super friendly, the food and coffee is great. Community notice board with local events adds a really nice touch! All in all a gorgie spot", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Una Gogarty", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "We enjoyed a most pleasant hour today at this intriguing little spot.
Went there for personal local history reasons, and found the place to be really hip and welcoming, with great coffee , tasty sausage rolls (sweet chilli) and nice staff. Great location on the quay with outdoor seating at the bridge opposite. Interesting notices and posters and a lucky encounter with a very engaging customer.
Would definitely go back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kaitlin Petersen", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Delicious pastries and really friendly folks that work there.
Plenty of outdoor seating too!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin McCabe", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Great cup of coffee. Got it to go and it tasted amazing while sitting in Cork rush hour. Black Americano. What I liked is that they asked do you want a small or large, it’s the same amount of coffee just more water. Happy they clarified that for me. Very friendly staff. The pastries and food offerings looked very good, but didn’t partake this time. Liked the atmosphere and it looked like everyone was enjoying themselves in a coffeehouse kind of way. Also lots of seating outside along the river and road. It seems to be communal and shared amongst the many shops there? Maybe not.
