I sat down to wait for my food as I didn’t want it to ruin my evening, however the atmosphere was noticeably bad and I was made to feel very unwelcome for the duration of my meal. I would say this is the strange behaviour- not mine.

I can confirm I will not be back and will be telling others to avoid.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}]

name: Crème French Tacos
address: 42B MacCurtain Street, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 H583, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Gitta Dévai", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Ordered for take away, and it was soooo goood.✨ The place is nice and tidy, crew is very friendly and nice, preparation was quick. You can also order at a kiosk in the restaurant which makes things easier. The price is very fair, you get a really filling taco for around €12, they have a great variety of menu items too. The taco was very delicious and filling and had a lot of meat and not so much fries 🍟 which is great. The taco is saucy and perfectly balanced, there is not too much of anything in there. All in all great place and can only recommend them ✨☘️", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Normen Baazaoui", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "I absolutely love French Tacos! Their tacos are always incredibly delicious — full of flavor and perfectly made every time. Every time I go, I always order from them because the food never disappoints. The atmosphere is very calm and relaxing, making it a great place to enjoy a meal. Plus, everything is super clean, which makes the experience even better. Highly recommended if you’re looking for tasty food and a comfortable spot to eat!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Brian Kessler", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Dear Owners,

I’ll start with the positive: The food is as good as ever!!!

But, and this a huge BUT:ä for me:

I was most disappointed to deal with a machine to place my order. Not only that, and most likely the fault is with me, I could not customize the order as I used to when I dealt with a person (how does one order your delicious crispy onions on a bowl???)

I understand that this is probably the way of the future, and yes, you may call me a Luddite, but as someone who wants to support a local business in their community I’d rather support people than a machine.

I know, these things are about margins and what not. I am sure a machine is a lot cheaper to run and most likely more efficient than a person.

I would argue that you lost your human touch. You are hiding behind a machine.

Again, the food (cooked by people) was as great as ever. The experience was McDonald’s…", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "abdulmazid2188", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Best food in cork so far . The taco is absolutely amazing literally tantalising. The burgers are even better genuinely beautiful. Definitely recommend to anyone and they have amazing deals too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mr Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "The very tasty Lyon Taco for the very filling price of €12.50 the fries chips cost €3.95 and you get a free mineral. The French Taco is the tidiest taco I have eaten so far compared to other tacos. Everything in the filling with the fromagere sauce keeps it all together. So none of it is wasted and that messiness that usually comes with tacos and kebabs doesn't happen. Great value a very small dinning in area but great for a takeaway as it is prepared quickly and served by nice and friendly staff that explained the ingredients. Lots of other options on the menu. As for the atmosphere the music is nice and low. The area is busy and clean enough. A very filling and delicious meal.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Alicja Tomaszewska", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Been there a month ago. Tasty food and a lot of meat. Nice people 😊. I asked for a french taco without tomato sauce and it wasn't a problem for them. It's a good choice when you want to eat something good in Cork 🫶🏻.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tim Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Food is top notch! Taco was huge and absolutely delicious. Staff were helpful and suggested a sauce to go with the contents of my taco. I would recommend a trip to creme French, I will be back!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "M7MD Kojo", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Food is truly delightful, and while the preparation process can often be time-consuming, the overall experience of enjoying a meal is incredibly rewarding. The anticipation that builds while waiting for a dish to cook only heightens the pleasure when it's finally served. Each bite can transport you to different cultures and memories, making the wait worthwhile. Ultimately, the joy of sharing a meal with friends or family enhances the experience even further, turning it into a cherished moment rather than just a necessity.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kathleen Santos", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Creme French is a hidden gem!
The food is absolutely delicious—full of flavor and beautifully prepared. Everything we ordered was super tasty and satisfying. The service was top-notch; the staff were kind, respectful, and really attentive to every detail. You can tell they care about the customers. I’ll definitely be coming back!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tamiris Santos", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Absolutely amazing experience at Creme French!
The food is sensational—delicious, flavorful, and truly mouthwatering. Every bite was a delight! The service was impeccable as well. The staff were incredibly polite, friendly, and attentive, making us feel welcome from the moment we walked in. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and excellent service!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Coriander Nepalese & Indian Restaurant
address: Tramway Terrace, E Douglas St, Douglas, Cork, T12 AW88, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Nikitha Nair", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited a month ago", "review_text": "The thali at Coriander Restaurant was really good, packed with great flavors. The mango lassi was absolutely class! Make sure to book ahead as it gets busy on weekends. The service was attentive and friendly. Especially loved the paneer labadar, saag, and aloo — all excellent dishes!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Bishnu Kumari chhetri", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Authentic Nepalese restaurant in cork. Full of Flavours and friendly atmosphere. Can't wait to visit again.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nancy Moore", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 4 months ago", "review_text": "Coriander is the best Indian restaurant I’ve found in Cork—maybe even in all of Ireland. The food is excellent, with plenty of vegetarian and vegan choices: the Chana Puri and Okra mains, along with the house-special aloo potatoes and cauliflower sides, are all vegan and bursting with flavour. The staff are lovely, offering poppadoms and chutney while you wait and checking in throughout the meal. There’s a good wine list, a warm atmosphere, and practical perks too—a taxi rank right outside in the evenings and a bus stop directly across the street.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Brigita Jankovskyte", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Went for my birthday dinner and we all loved it, amazing food and polite staff. Would recommend and will be coming back😁", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mayuri Umrikar", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "They serve beer and wine , there were only 2 beer options and plenty of them for wine & champagne.

We booked it 30 mins before hence had to wait for a table.

People - 7
Dishes ordered - 6
Taste - 3 according to Indian people as it’s not that spicy, 5 according to other country people.
Location - 5 as you can reach there via bus it’s right in front of the bus station.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Rabin Bhandari", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Me and my wife had our dinner today at Coriander in Douglas! The butter chicken was rich and creamy, perfectly paired with soft butter naan and flavorful garlic naan. The samosas were crispy and packed with tasty filling. Washed it all down with a sweet, refreshing mango lassi. Everything was full of flavor – highly recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aakriti Goel", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "We recently visited Coriander, Douglas and here’s the what we ordered.

Starters:
1. Paneer Tikka: Good seasoning, but very hard paneer. Chutney was okay, but not the best.
2. Samosa chaat: It was good.

Main course:
1. Dal makhani: A lot of people loke Coriander’s dal makhani and it has been my favourite too. But this time, it wasn’t the best in taste, the spices were less, I am not sure what was missing but something was.
2. Paneer lababdar: It wasn’t paneer lababdar for sure. There were grilled paneer cubes, which lababdar always uses normal paneer. As was the case of the starter, the paneer was too hard to eat.
There were big chunks of onion and capsicum, which are generally put in Kadhai paneer. My mood dipped after eating this paneer gravy dish.
Butter naan: Not good as per expectations. It was thick, not cooked properly.

I have been to Coriander previously as well and the food was amazing (few months back). But this time it was totally different and dissatisfying.

Service was normal as usual, could always be better.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ahmer Ansari", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "It’s was a family visit we order few staters and few main all was top on they served papadums and chatni before the starter place was cleaned and everything was spot on highly recommended we will definitely beck when ever we are in cork", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Romeu Hayashi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Coriander is the best Indian restaurant in Cork. Although I’m not from India, several of my friends had recommended me to come.

I then came with an Indian friend of mine and I asked him to order everything he would recommend for us to try, as we would always order the same thing (Chicken Masala and Butter Chicken 🤔)

Take a look at the pictures, I’m sharing the starters and the mains we ordered, they were all amazing! Must go place if you want to taste Indian food", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "sathish babu", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "A nice place to have Indian food, the taste and flavors were nice. Service was quick and attentive. Decent number of vegetarian options as well on the menu.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Soma 2
address: Well Rd, Ballinlough, Cork, T12 K702, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Kerry Butcher", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely pastries, nice coffee, with outdoor and inside seating.

The outdoor patio was strangely sloped so it did feel that the coffee might spill at any moment.

It is situated by a roundabout, an there is a limited car park behind the cafe. This road can be busy during rush hour.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin Byrne", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great spot to drop on for a coffee. The coffee is of a high standard,  and there are several tasty bites both savoury and sweet. The staff always seem pleasant,  and chatty, and the outside seating area is great in any weather because its covered! There is ample parking at the rear. Much prefer this soma to any in town.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Liam O'Sullivan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "One of my favourite cafés in Cork for a coffee & a snack. Quick service with delicious coffee & snacks.

Nice chilled lighting vibes inside, and a lovely small balcony out the front to sit outside & enjoy. ☕

Good parking outside the back too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Onur B", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Stopped by Soma 2 after dropping off clients in Cork, a real gem of a spot! As a professional chauffeur with Titanium Life Chauffeurs, I’m always on the lookout for places that are quick, comfortable, and serve quality food — this one checks all the boxes.

Had their ham & cheese toastie and a cappuccino, both were excellent. The toastie was perfectly crisp and the coffee had that rich, smooth finish with great latte art. Also tried a slice of red velvet cake — soft, fresh, and delicious.

The place is bright, clean, and welcoming, with plenty of parking in the back, which is a big bonus when you’re in a hurry. Staff were super friendly and service was fast — ideal for a quick lunch stop while on the road.

Highly recommend it to fellow drivers, locals, and anyone passing through Cork!

📸 (Photo attached – says it all.)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Leah", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Always have a good experience at Soma! Really good coffee it’s unlike anywhere else in cork one of a kind. I’ll be back soon", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "John Sreenan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Great little coffee shop and a great variety of coffee. My favourite coffee and cafe in the city. I've spent countless hours here studying and have always felt very comfortable. I would definitely recommend to anyone who is tired of studying or working from home, or just looking for a place to have lunch.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

Completely overwhelms the taste of the ingredients", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "H (H)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely gluten free vegan options.
The vegan spice box is a must try! Love how there’s tofu in it 🤗
Love their sweet n sour, not too heavy …", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "uday kalyani", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "We're fancy trying Asian street food and this place was suggested. Ordered Pad Thai and Veg Curry. Pad Thai was absolutely a delight and definitely recommend this to anyone looking for veg options. They added Tofu instead of chicken which was brilliant. Veg curry was a bit blunt and not what we expected it to taste based on our previous experience with same curry in Thailand. Rice needs a special attention as it wasnt cooked properly. Not the best ambience, but perhaps is sufficient as the dine in space is really tight. 10/10 to the staff!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "H. Sipahi", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "The worst asian food I've ever had. I ordered veggie wok + chicken. It was like a soup but full of soy sauce. Also, chicken was absolutely dehydrated and the rice!!!! Microwave rice with terrible taste. Absolutely, don't go here. Also had to wait for takeout for 25 min for this food really ridiculous.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Shridhyey Gupta", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "I ordered Singapore noodles with Tofu as a takeaway. The menu says it's vegan however there were eggs in it.
Disappointed with this. Would never recommend as I had requested while placing the order to avoid it.

Edit - I had requested a Vegan option mentioning while adding Tofu with it and specifically requested to avoid any contamination and was assured the same.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Ciara S", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "This place was quite empty when I went and filled up a bit by the time I left. The service was good, someone took my order quickly and the food was delivered to my table in about 3 or 4 minutes. I also like that you pay when you order.
The food itself was not nice at all. The portion size was big but the dish tasted kind of sweet and was unbelievably oily. The tofu was very nice.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Aditeya", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "There is a lot that goes into the dining experience at Ramen. The staff here is friendly and warm, and are extremely pleasant to talk to. The food here is amazing, the best Asian food I've had in Ireland so far. And the quantity is great too, which is quite rare for most restaurants. Other than that, we get complimentary fortune cookies and ice creams with our meal. Absolutely love this place!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Stefanny Torres", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 10 months ago", "review_text": "The food is amazing, fair price. Lovely atmosphere, music background very relaxing. The staffs are friendly and polite.
As a plus the you can get juice free and ice cream. So, nothing to complain and for sure I would recommend this place.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Marko Rogulja", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "This is first time to try them out, i had beef sweet and saure wok. It was nice. I will come over again for sure to have asian meal once a week. There is only street parking so its hit or miss situation. Free icecream cone for the end is nice touch. It felt nice cooling down in warm sunny day.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Rosie Maddison
address: 141 Bandon Rd, The Lough, Cork, T12 C971, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Rocio Elortegui Pascual", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely pub. The inside is cute and welcoming, the staff is super nice.
Outside they have a bigger area that is really nice and on Wednesdays they have the quizz, a blast.
Definitely recommend coming over.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Christopher Halpin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Came here for our football team drinks, the staff looked after us throughout, we had a couple of tables at the back, it's set out really well. Great atmosphere, Beamish was a lovely pint!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lu W", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Lovely pub, bit of a tardis as the front doesn’t suggest how far back the place goes. Cosy fire lighting in the main bar and massive smoking area in the back, really thoughtfully decorated throughout.
We went in for a couple of drinks but ended up having way more than a couple, due to the great atmosphere and friendly staff. The barman, Alan, is a cocktail genius; if you don’t see something on the menu just ask and he was great to explain the different ones on the menu (his margarita and old fashions are things of beauty) . Will defo be back!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michael O'Sullivan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Any stag or hen party coming to Cork should book here for a sauna and a coffee, especially the day after the night before!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Martin Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Beautiful bar on Barrack street Cork. Was a cold December night when I Visited here but the fire was on and the place was warm and cosy. Large covered smoking area to the rear of the premises", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Geraldine Kelly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Very attentive staff. Excellent cocktails. Stylish interior. Will be back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "grace mcl", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Reserved a table for 10 last night
Had a great time in the pub.
Over 21s bar
It’s a lovely atmosphere for an intimate pub. Everyone had a great time
The cocktails were lovely, great selection and very tasty.

We were allowed bring in chips from Lennox chipper next door and that was brilliant, it meant we could stay longer and keep our table together.

Would highly recommend and would visit again.

Have to say that the Alan the bar man on last night (Fri 16th) was an absolute delight. Alan was so helpful and pleasant, nothing was an issue, he provided brilliant service to everyone and really added to the evening. He is a total asset to the business.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin O'Neill", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "Nice enough pub. Not a great selection of draught beer. I asked for a hot toddy and the girl behind the counter didn't have any idea what it was! I then said "hot whiskey" at which she said ah ok. She then served up a whiskey with hot water and a slice of orange!!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kasey Danaher", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Did a cocktail class for my friends birthday. Lovely experience. Allan was so friendly and made the experience even better. Overall atmosphere was so chill and cozy. Highly recommend!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Conor McManagan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Great place, great food, great craic, great music and great pints 👍🏻👍🏻", "sentiment": "Good"}]

reviews_data:

The staff are friendly and welcoming. The large windows are a huge plus as well. The windows really brighten the place up on those rainy Irish days.

Stop in have a coffee or a drink.
#accessible", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Isaac Wolfe", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Love it. Brilliant altogether. Door staff are gentlemen. Savage crisps", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Hideout Cafe And Art Gallery
address: Verde House, 2 Wellington Rd, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 E9HF, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Jaedyn Shock", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "This place is absolutely adorable! The food and coffee were amazing and so was the service! The owner was also so nice and very personable! They have a little terrace area that was perfect on a beautiful day! Definitely going again!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Natalia Rengel", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "This is such a gorgeous little spot! The coffee is lovely, food is fresh and reasonably priced, the girls at the counter are always very nice, and the view is stunning! I personally love the artsy vibe, there's so much to look at.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ciaran McPhillips", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Superb coffee and sweet treats by Magdelena. I love when a coffee shop sells their own home-made cakes and Magdelena has such a fantastic selection. There were 2 cakes just out of the oven when I arrived - mixed berry and apple. I went for the mixed berry and it was delicious. I'll be returning to try the apple cake for sure. Magdelena is so passionate about her cakes and it shows in the quality of what she's making. 10/10", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mariola Kwapińska", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great coffee and cookies.\nGluten free options available which is important for me. Great view", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Hailey Green", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Stopped in while waiting for our bus and had a lovely time! Incredibly welcoming and kind, she gave us information about some of the different places we planned to travel to in the area. Beautiful views. I had the wrap which was grilled and super tasty. My husband got a panini which was on really nice baguette bread and looked amazing.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jennifer Maye Twomey", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "I absolutely love going here ❤️ Magda is a breath of fresh air and her service is spectacular. I don't even consider going anywhere else.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ornait Od", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The place is absolutely. I’d recommend this place to anyone the coffee is exquisite. thank you!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Anna Machura", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great coffee, wonderful view and friendly people... Truly one of the most beautiful places in the city", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "rachael howard", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "The smoothies and cakes\n(especially the oreo cheese cake) were delicious and all homemade. Magda was so lovely and welcoming, really nice atmosphere", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Martin Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Nice place to hideout and enjoy a coffee ☕️ and some lovely Cork City views.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The SpitJack Cork
address: 34 Washington St, Centre, Cork, T12 RY96, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Rachel C", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Came here for the brunch menu and wasn’t disappointed. The French toast with bacon and maple syrup was absolutely delicious 🤤 one of the nicest I’ve had in the city, the bacon was cooked perfectly and cut into easily.

The decor of the place was really nice too, with really friendly servers and overall clean.

Will definitely be back!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sara Disarò", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "I went here for brunch with my partner while visiting Cork for a couple of days in July. The food was great but we had to wait for a good while to be noticed by the servers who seemed to be mostly teenagers. Maybe we were unlucky. I would come back and hope that the service level improves.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Geoffrey Lavell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Intimate space with lots of natural light and the lovely sounds of an open kitchen and pass with coffee bar and espresso machine whiring and moving about.
The food is fresh and we'll thought out. The flavors and textures are clearly forward-thinking without being pretentious or "trying too hard." We had the Huevos Rancheros, Berry French Toast, Bacon French Toast, and the Smokey Royale. All were delicious. The smoked salmon with its delicious oils, paired nicely with the slightly acid avocado base on the toast and the lemon in the hollandaise.
The Rancheros had a wonderful "western" flavor with very tender, not fatty, pork.
The French Toast was pefect. Light and crisp with bright flavors.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Clare D", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Phenomenal food. Staff were so lovely. Highly recommend this place and the chicken croquettes. One of the nicest starters Ive ever had.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "A J (Lexi)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Food was wonderful! The drink was decent. Would eat here again, after tip ~$122. Not bad! Reservation needed for dinner.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Maria Jennifer", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Delicious brunch! We had an issue with one of our meals, but the waitress and the manager dealt with it very professionally. I could highly recommend the brunch/breakfast menu – so much to choose from!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jamie O'Herlihy", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Place was busy and have been there before and the food is decent but went last Saturday and got the fish cake for starter and the steak for mains. Fish cake was tasty nothing special. The steak is the issue. Literally could have used a chainsaw to cut it. Our table was shaking and our drinks were spilling because we were trying to cut the steak. It lacked flavour and just wasn’t worth the price. Won’t be ordering that again. Staff seemed new and weren’t the most attentive. I got a pornstar martini and it wasn’t great. I drank half of it and then ordered an espresso martini which was much better.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Cormac Wyatt", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Incredible value for money.
The service is friendly and detailed. The vibe and atmosphere is really nice, striking a balance of chill but also high quality. And the food! OMG! So delicious. Gf has duck legs & I had the pork pancetta for mains as well sharing the seafood plate for starters sharing. We were STUFFED! Excellent quality, full of flavor and goodness. Easy to eat & easier to enjoy! Just can't recommend the place enough tbh. Go there!!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Oleksandr Rivkind", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great food, friendly service. Definitely recommended. Tried their porchetta - it did not disappoint. Booking in advance is recommended.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "John Daubenschmidt", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Strongly recommend reservations.  Menu good variety, not too busy.  Nice Name origin story.  Multi level seating, can accommodate larger groups.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

The chef, Tomaz, is an artist", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eoghan McCormack", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Had this nosh bout 17 month ago, proper decent scran, even better people. name: An Bróg Bar + Kitchen
address: 74 Oliver Plunkett St, Centre, Cork, T12 FP28, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Mr Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "Delicious and great value for money for the food in An Bróg. I went with the Classic burger that comes with nice chunky chips. The Classic burger it's self was a 6oz monster it felt moe like a very tasty double quarter pounder. One of the most messiest and tastiest burgers I had in long time. Glad I could just about finish it.
Be prepared, this is a delicious juicy messy burger! Fast service great chef, great bar staff. The inside of the pub the decor and vibe is decorated very interestingly and very cozy. Grabs your attention where ever you look.  The DJ box made of a little camper van is a great centre piece. It also has  a football table machine for a bit of fun.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Marty Butler", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "Very good burgers , chips are 10/10 (super crispy and beautifully seasoned, paprika amongst other spices). They have 2 for 1 on most days and €5 Nacho Fridays. Music is very mainstream not my scene but also a great pub for a good night.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "nick v", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "As an "out-of-towner", I was looking for a place for my family and I to have a nice, affordable dinner. So I went into a pub!

The place is dimly lit with an awesome retro vibe. And the food? It was incredible! Delicious salad, delicious wings, and a very handy kids meal. They even have a song bingo game on Thursdays. I wouldn't change a thing
100% recommend for any occasion.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Julian C", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Atmosphere is unreal, but the only issue is the staff, left with my friend for two minutes and couldn't get back in, the bouncer said he "didn't see us leave" after making direct eye contact while leaving. Our phones and coates were still inside, and we only got them back after my friends sister brought them out. Great Atmosphere, but genuinely hostile and unreasonable bouncers.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "David Philpott", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Never met a more hostile and disrespectful man in my life than the bouncer of An Bróg, included a picture so ye can avoid this aggressive man-child.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Danilo Matias", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "The place is amazing, with great music and fun weekly activities. However, there’s something more important than everything else to me: the staff! I visited on a public holiday, and one of the staff members was incredibly aggressive and unhappy. An alternative lady, who was supposed to be helpful, had an inadequate posture with me and my friend because we didn’t want to participate in the Quiz. It was unnecessary and some people really don’t know how to work in a hospitality service. Unfortunately, it seems like the company is lost in this situation because there are 100 others pubs in Cork where this kind of behavior is not tolerated.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Andy", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "I usually like this place but the crowd or getting squeezed against the bar and fighting for your life to get there and out isnt ideal.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Deniece Anthoney", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Went here on a day visit to Cork and glad we found this gem of a place. Friendly staff ans good service. Great decor and cocktails were fab.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paddy O'Connell", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Decent bar in city centre - more a night time venue for younger folk.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Travis Brink", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Went there because they're open later than the other bars that close at 11:30. Younger, boisterous late night crowd which is ideal for partiers and boisterous youths, which clearly didn't deter me from staying til closing. I was surprised to find out the next day that the alleyway was an entrance to the English Market near the fishmongers. I was also surprised to learn they also serve food, which I didn't know about until just now when I began to write this review so I can't really speak to that. Decent beers, healthy shot pours, and late night hours.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Jacques Restaurant
address: 23 Oliver Plunkett St, Centre, Cork, T12 A5D7, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Paul Richard Bungay", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "We went on a team night out and the place and atmosphere of this place is class. It might look very small at the outside but very big on the inside.Their servers was very approachable and accommodating as well. Food was ok for me. I would say my expectations were a little bit not met. For a 30-40 euro steak, I would have expected that the steak is at least seasoned which was not. The sharing platter as well was a little bit  small for me. I expected at least a couple of meats and more cheese on a meat and cheese board but as you can see on the picture that’s their sharing board and you can see on the menu how much that is. My teammates enjoyed their veggie board and they were delighted with the taste. Their desert was great as well. Overall still a good experience. Just get your wallets ready as food can be pricey.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mark Mirigian", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Wonderful dining experience and friendly staff. The tomahawk is seasoned well and big enough to share. Extensive drink menu including low/no alcohol drinks and wines on tap. The affogato comes with a brownie and add-on liquor. Note that the online sample menu doesn't match the live menu so a few things were not on offer that we were hoping to try.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Luke Ratterman", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Amazing top shelf experience! We had 4 of the small plates. All were perfection.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Gavin Lynam", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Very high quality food at a good price from great staff!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nguyet Bui", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 7 months ago", "review_text": "Needless to say, I licked the plate. Just come here, you’ll be a happy silly goose like me.

✔️Mussels escabeche
✔️Roast quail

Delightful dinner affair with impeccable ambiance, in my humble opinion. After a futile search through four restaurants, stumbling upon this gem was a stroke of luck. I had noticed it during a leisurely evening stroll and was instantly captivated.

The warm welcome upon entry sealed the deal for me; the charming lady and the attentive staff were absolute darlings, truly enhancing my evening.

Starting with the mussels was a light and flawless choice. When I spotted quail on the menu, I knew it was meant for me. The creamy polenta resembled a heavenly bed, complemented by a delicate touch of pesto oil that harmonized all the flavors beautifully. The quail itself was cooked to perfection, just as I prefer.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Holly Sykes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "SO GOOD! We had a lovely and delicious dinner here during our stay in Cork. Absolutely fantastic, I wanted to go back the next night again!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Julia Dixon", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "The food was delicious! The restaurant goes back quite a long way so it more spacious than it appears from the front. Our fish and scallops were delicious and the wine was reasonably priced too. Nice causal dining for all the family.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "BANANA BADGER", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I have been here twice now and the restaurant is one of the best in Cork. The food is fresh and well prepared. The staff are attentive. It is always busy so make sure to book a table.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mikey", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Loved this place! We just walked in off the street and were warmly greeted. Food was amazing. Service was perfect. And wine was nice. name: Cafe Spresso
address: 26 MacCurtain Street, Montenotte, Cork, T23 YF57, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Tim KL", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 weeks ago", "review_text": "The best cafe in the country. Delicious Irish cafe menu, alongside a full Polish menu as well! Open late for a cafe. I make sure to go every time I end up in Cork. Top notch!!! And run by lovely people as well.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mark Kelleher", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "I had a full Irish breakfast earlier. Such great value for 12 euro, it is absolutely huge. The food is fresh, tasty and so filling. The owners seem like lovely people too. There is a very nice vibe in this cafe. I am already looking forward to my next visit.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Brian Rohan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "The breakfast in here is superb. Excellent value also. Nowhere else in Cork City beats this place.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Viktor Danielian", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "One of the best breakfast places I’ve tried in Ireland. Came to Ireland to run a Dublin marathon and been dining in lots of places. This place stands out with large menu, affordable prices and excellent service. Tomasz is cooking everything himself in the back and everything tastes delicious. Would highly recommend this place!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Melanie Tam", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Our first breakfast in Ireland had to be a full Irish breakfast, of course. I found Cafe Spresso, which was a short walk from our hotel, and it had pretty good reviews. It was a Monday at around 11 AM, and there was probably only one other table dining. The menu looked like it was a mix of Irish and Hungarian cuisine. We ordered the large Full Irish Breakfast (2 bacon, 2 sausages, 2 eggs, black and white pudding, mushrooms, beans, tomato, toast, tea or coffee) and one of the Hungarian specials, a meat croquette, which comes with a cup of beetroot soup. The Irish Breakfast was good - oily, like you’d expect. It did the trick. It’s enough to share between two people, just because it’s so greasy. I would skip the croquette. It was definitely left over from the night (or maybe more) before. It was soggy and salty. I did enjoy the beetroot soup, but I didn’t want to mix too much of it with the coffee I was already drinking.\n\nCafe Spresso is a good option for a full Irish brekkie, which is only €12! But I would just stick to that.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Roberto", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "This place actually saved my morning. Large irish breakfast. Delicious. Very, very kind attention.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin Jordan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Nice Irish/Polish cafe serving a good variety of breakfast and lunch options. Friendly staff. I had small Irish and other half had porridge with bananas, both very nice.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jack Verkerk", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Absolute bargain of a breakfast for 12€. Also run by a Polish family which is nice to support.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Schaefer Fernandes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "Cafe Spresso in Cork City is a cozy, welcoming spot with a great atmosphere and friendly staff. Highly recommended!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jenn A", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "We went for breakfast! Great spot. There was just one gentleman working so it wouldn't be the best for a quick meal, but it was very tasty. If we stayed longer we would've loved to check out some other menu options!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Orchids Restaurant
address: Hayfield Manor Hotel, Perrott Ave, College Rd, Centre, Cork, T12 HT97, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Rob Hale", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Overall this establishment offered a solid dining experience with high quality food and friendly professional service. Evening service seemed a bit short staffed which did not allow our server to present herself as frequently as we would have preferred. I do not fault the server as this seemed to be more of a staffing issue.  Obvious regulars two tables down were fawned upon while hotel guests, such as ourselves, did not get the same service level. For the price of both the hotel and the restaurant this was disappointing. Breakfast service was a bit spotty.  The first morning it was exceptional. The second morning it was a bit off. The food quality for all meals was excellent and the plate presentations were well done. The dining room itself was classy contemporary.  Noise volumes allowed conversations to be heard. A good 4 star experience.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Google User", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "From the moment we walked in we felt a special level of service and attention. The prix fixe menu of three courses delighted everyone at our table. The wine pairings were a perfect accompaniment. The lamb starter melted in your mouth. The salmon, lamb tenderloin and Irish Beef were cooked perfectly. We will always dine at Orchids when we are in Cork. Ambience was tranquil with the lovely piano singer in the lobby just outside the restaurant. Highly recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Vitali Babi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Great place for a relaxed evening!

A fantastic spot to unwind and enjoy live music in a top-notch atmosphere. Everything is well thought out – from the interior to the excellent service. The food is absolutely exquisite and delicious. Yes, it’s a bit on the pricey side, but worth every euro. If you’re looking for a cozy place with high-quality cuisine and a great vibe, this is definitely the spot! 🔥🎶🍷", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alex Karakatsanis", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "I visited the Orchid restaurant with my family and partner to celebrate my graduation. I had been wanting to visit this restaurant for the past 4 years living in Cork. Overall, I am slightly disappointed in all areas. Especially, considering its prestige and price. Starting with the food: although enjoyable; there is a lot of room for improvement. I personally tried the scallops, the duck, and the apple parfait. The scallops lacked depth of flavor, and were in my opinion overcooked. The acai sorbet, although a nice and refreshing idea, lacked any memorable qualities or garnish. The duck, although juicy and cooked right in the middle, had a very soggy skin. The orange flavor that was meant to complement it was also very mild. The desert was my favorite dish, and it was unique and tasty but my partners desert, the berry mousse, had (literally) half a strawberry served with it, then the menu said "served with fresh berries". The wine selection was impressive and I enjoyed our drinks, although our first pinot grigio was noticeably cheap.

The service was a mixed bag. All the servers and staff were very friendly and I have no complaints in that regard. That said, we all came with heavy coats, and no one offered to pick them up for us. Additionally, we were all asked to order desert off the bat, which is unusual and delayed our order. Finally, when we left, we had to pick up our coats our selves.

Finally on the atmosphere. This historic building should receive the utmost of respect and attention in decor. The flooring, armchairs, curtains, chandeliers and room layout did not honor its history. The small details, such as lighting, and set up (uninviting spotlights, grey plastic laminate flooring, one candle per table that weren't turned on etc..) do not reflect the class the restaurant should hold.

On a positive note, the live piano was lovely, and added to the experience, especially because the player himself was not only lovely, but also also highly skilled. That said, the repertoire should be adjusted, as we were confused when they started playing the game of throne TV show intro music, instead of perhaps soft jazz, or classical pieces.

Overall, I did have a great time, and i don't have anything negative to say about any particular staff, or their friendliness, but considering this restaurant is within a 5 star hotel, with a very high price range, i did not feel this was reflected in the areas stated above. Worth a visit, but I'd be more inclined to attend the afternoon tea, or the lovely bar.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jessica Walsh (Jessy walshy baby)", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Always ate here but its gone absolutely shocking both food and prices. Won't be ordering again", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Paul F", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "What would've been a nice evening sadly was utterly ruined by three amazingly loud groups of american tourists and the incompetent staff that didn't even attempt to bring the noise down to "european" levels of fine dining. You're essentially paying 100$ to eat good food in a rather loud pub. On request one waiter told us to "go to a different restaurant". Can't recommend unless you're an annoying american.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Declan Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "Amazing food and the staff couldn't be better..", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Vanesa Núñez", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "It was a wonderful experience.
They served us with great care, were attentive at all times, and very polite.
It's a 10-star restaurant.
They make you feel comfortable from the first second.
The food was delicious.
They have live music (a wonderful pianist).
It's very clean.
It's wheelchair accessible.
Congratulations to the entire restaurant team and the reception staff as well; it was wonderful.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Rising Sons Brewery
address: Cornmarket St, Centre, Cork, T12 WK27, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Henry G", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Great laid-back vibe with a cool industrial feel.  It's a perfect place to relax with friends, catch a match, or just enjoy a fresh pint in a fun, easygoing atmosphere.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michael Stanley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Came here after a long day of exploring cork, the staff was extremely friendly, the beer is fantastic in my opinion, and the food was delicious. Couldn't recommend a spot more", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Wayne Phair", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Stopped in for a quick drink to rest my feet and was pleasantly surprised. The bar has a welcoming atmosphere with a large screen that’s perfect for watching sports. The staff were very friendly and made me feel at home. A great spot for a casual break.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mr Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "The food here is delicious filling and affordable. You can get a fresh pizza that would fill two and a pint for €17 euros. All made fresh by the chef in the open kitchen. This restaurant pub is for all age groups. With a good mixture of people.
I ordered the beef Nachos and the were the best I tasted in a long time.

The portion was definitely made for two. I finished them with some difficulty very fufiling. The seating area is fantastic where you can see the hard work of the chef that goes into making the food from the open kitchen plan.

What a fantastic affordable place to eat excellent pub and restaurant with its own brewery and large selection of own brand pints. Along with all the other well known brands. The decor is fantastic there is also a large screen and plenty of televisions placed around.

The bar staff was patient with my order and had some helpful suggestions. Thanks for that. They also have one of them new card reader tipping station that are becoming popular but also accept cash. If your visiting or a local I highly recommend visiting even just for the experience. A great place for a meal.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Darius", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "A Surprising Experience at Rising Sons Brewery

I’ve always enjoyed visiting Rising Sons Brewery—whether after work or on the weekends, it had become a bit of a regular spot for me. The bar staff have always been incredibly friendly and welcoming. I even gifted them a framed present once as a small thank-you for their hospitality, and I've always been polite and respectful in return.

On one of my recent visits, I was there with two friends to say goodbye to someone moving back to Spain. We were sitting outside enjoying the sun and I recorded a short video from outside to remember the moment. Everything seemed fine, and it was, at the time.

A few days later, I stopped by again after shopping to unwind with a pint and meet a friend. I had my first drink and was about to order a second when I was told—rather unexpectedly—that I was barred. I was quite taken aback, especially since no explanation was given. I was simply told that I’d need to speak to the manager, who would be in at 6pm.

What surprised me most is that there was no clear reason offered, and up until that moment, I’d never had a negative interaction with anyone there. The team has always been great, so I can only assume this decision came from management. If the video I took from outside was the issue, I find that a bit confusing, as there was nothing inappropriate or disruptive about it.

In the end, while it’s disappointing, there are plenty of other great places in Cork to relax and enjoy a drink. I still appreciate the good times I had at Rising Sons, but this experience has left me puzzled.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Dan Gogerly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Spent four days in cork and must of popped in here atleast three times, great selection of drinks/food with a great atmosphere! It's a must visit for anyone in the area, you won't be dissapointed.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sara Byrne Byrne", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "Edited 3 months ago", "review_text": "Pizza was alright, pints decent.
But the atmosphere felt… performative.
Maybe it was just my table, but it’s hard to enjoy a meal when the energy feels scripted.
Great if you’re into theatre with your pepperoni.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "MrBarker", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Wheat was stellar. Wish there was room outside on the patio for us. Very hospitable.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lukas E", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Fantastic (local!) beer, nice people, good pizza. What else do you want?", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Elk Hunter", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "Had a fabulous lunch here on a rainy Sunday. Good beer and drink choices. Beef nachos were excellent. Staff was very cool too", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Zócalo
address: Unit 3, Village Green, Church Rd, Douglas, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Sivabharathi Dhatchinamoorthi", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "This is a wonderful Mexican restaurant that truly exceeded my expectations. I had the best chicken I’ve tasted so far in Ireland, perfectly cooked and seasoned. I also tried the mango tacos, which were unique and bursting with flavor, along with a refreshing glass of guava juice. To end the meal, I enjoyed a warm cup of black tea. The restaurant's ambience was cozy, inviting, and pleasantly decorated, making the overall dining experience thoroughly enjoyable. Highly recommended for anyone craving authentic Mexican flavors...", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "D A", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Amazing hidden gem. Such a shame it’s not as busy as it deserves to be. Robin & Sunita make some delicious food. Best Mexican food I’ve had in Ireland… and second place isn’t even close.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Gary Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "A nice place and friendly staff but the food left a lot to be desired. The fish taco was drowning in a watery white sauce that left the  battered fish completely soggy. I couldn’t finish it.
The guacamole was dry, missing lime and salt. Just look at the picture. No relation to Mexican food.
In fairness to the staff, they were welcoming and are trying the best but clearly not familiar with Mexican cuisine.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sasha O’Keeffe", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Had some amazing food here, it’s a bit pricey but the big portions make it worth your money, staff were lovely and very accommodating. Food is so flavoursome and it’s easy to tell they use the proper ingredients. Good vegan options and loads of sauce and food options for picky eaters too and you can customise your foods too which is great.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "susie jones", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Ordered the "you got Mango" with chicken via deliveroo, Food was freezing when delivered and the meat was Brown, slimey.. and stale tasting. It wasn't coloured from the marinade it was more like the dark meat of the chicken, you should really rethink your prices if you're adding the scraps of a carcus into a taco.  Had to throw it out. Absolutely disgusting and very disappointing. Also ye wouldn't refund it on Deliveroo.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Mary Sheehan", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Had the Mexican bowl with added chicken, Carcass more like it.
A bowl of soggy rice, smothered in Sauce & dark carcass chicken,expecting breast meat.
Also a takeaway, after walking all the way back to my car ready to eat it ,realised they never gave me cutlery.
Never again, I feel nauseous thinking of it.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Billy Fajardo", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "I wanted tho try their nachos. I added the beef and at first they looked very promising. The bit of visible grease was ok, however as I got to the bottom it seems that I got a free helping of the frying grease. There’s really no reason for this. I couldn’t finish as what my shoulder be crisp nacho chips were nothing but a soggy cholesterol raising mess of oil and salt. I don’t think I will be trying them again . Not what I expect for 15€", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Rabin Bhandari", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "I recently visited Zocalo Restaurant and was thoroughly impressed by the experience. The Tacos are absolutely amazing—packed with fresh ingredients and bursting with flavor. I tried the Hard Shell Food Truck Taco and Burger and it was one of the best I’ve ever had. The portion sizes are generous and well worth the price.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Suzanne C", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Ordered this as a takeaway with deliveroo, first time ordering and have to say I was very pleased, we ordered the family feast everyone was happy, I got the jackfruit Dolores bowl and it was divine! Portions are huge! None of us could finish! So we will be eating the leftovers later tonight or for lunch tomorrow, the food we got was very fresh and well presented considering it was takeaway! I think it is great value for money and will def order again whether take away or sit down.
The only issue I would have is possibly too much rice in the orders but still it was very tasty and great value for money so 5stars", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "David Consonni", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "Been here 6 times already, I’ve tried most of the burrito bowls and they’re still not failing. Guacamole is fresh, so are the rest of the ingredients. Used to go to zambrero for any tex-mex needs but now this is my go-to.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

Loved the view as well 10/10", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Elisabeth O'Flaherty", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "The staff at Bell’s are so lovely, and the food and drinks are delicious. The prices are incredibly reasonable compared to most places in the city selling crepes (same goes for the coffee prices) and it tasted amazing, we'll be back again soon!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

reviews_data:
[{"username": "Ian Brennan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 days ago", "review_text": "What a lovely setup and really nice staff. Recommended", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Colum FT", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Excellent barista made coffees & tray bakes , with friendly banter from the guys .", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nadine Schaefer", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "We had a hot chocolate and a flat white which were lovely. Great recommendation so all around a great place to support 👍", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "H (H)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Really nice little spot next to the garden Centre. They have a good bit of seating outside. Really nice coffee and they have coconut milk (so many places only do oat milk).
Also love the GF vegan brownie and they have a few other gf vegan options", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "grace mcl", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Really lovely coffee hatch
Very nice coffee
Freshly baked pastries and treats
Friendly nice staff

Takeaway only
No seating", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "David Power", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I have been getting a coffee here every morning for the last 12 months. I am making the move back to Kerry today and my daily trip to Some Dose is going to be one of the things I miss the most about Cork.

The coffee is sensational of course. The treats and pastries are divine - Blondie is a personal favourite.

But most importantly you will always be met with friendly faces and a nice chat with the staff.

I couldn’t think of a better place to start your day in Cork City.

I’ll be popping by anytime I’m in Cork in the future.

Thanks for all the flat whites and chats Jarryd and team ❤️", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jade", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Some Dose is my favourite coffee shop in Cork and the world. The coffee is always 10/10, also the snacks are super yummy and the staff are so friendly and lovely. Rumour has it the owner is also a legend. Go there, you won’t regret it!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Steffen Machacek", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "The coffee is class, the pastries are plentiful and tasty. The lads are outstanding!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Brian Meaney", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "En route from Dublin to SW Kerry (Castlecove) and I stopped here, courtesy of Google Maps, for what turned out to be a perfect Latte and a scrumptious chocolate brownie. I was served by a lovely couple who were really friendly and courteous and it was such a pleasurable experience that I know I'll return for more of the same the next time I'm on that long drive. An unexpected pleasure on all fronts.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Bojan Nedeljkovic", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Surprisingly good coffee for a kiosk in the middle of nowhere.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: 115 Cafe & Wine Bar
address: 115 Oliver Plunkett St, Centre, Cork, T12 EV25, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Heloisa Marmiroli", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "I absolutely love this place! We are always treated so well, and ever since my son was born, he has been treated with the same care. He has been coming here since he was a new born, and now at 2 and a half years old, he already knows most of the staff.

I’m a big fan of the tortillas and the chicken with mushroom sauce my favourites! I haven’t dared to try the waffle yet, even though I’ve heard nothing but praise, but since we’re here so often, I’m sure the opportunity will come.

A special thanks to Lucas, who is so attentive that my son even remembers his name!

We always leave here happy and well taken care of. I wholeheartedly recommend this place!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eilidh Fraser", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Light, bright cafe with huge windows. Simple menu. I had a breakfast toasties, which was OK, but the flavour of the sausage and bacon were a bit lost due to relish.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sabrina Hianaene", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "The food is wonderful and the place has a great vibe. However, the service could be improved. During my visit, there were three staff members inside the café chatting, while the outdoor area was full and the staff member assigned outside seemed overwhelmed. I understand that there may be designated roles for indoor and outdoor service, but when the outside is busy, it would be helpful if the indoor staff could step in and assist. More attention and proactiveness from the team would really enhance the overall experience.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rocio Elortegui Pascual", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 days ago", "review_text": "Nice place. It is not expensive and the food is nice. When it is sunny the terrace outside it’s super nice.
The smoothies and milkshakes are amazing.
It is next to a pub so you can hear the bar, it is a nice atmosphere, but if you want a quiet place I won’t recommend it.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aryna Lesiak", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "I’m writing to express my absolute outrage and disgust after what was, without a doubt, the worst dining experience I’ve ever had — and I will never return to your establishment again.

I ordered a pizza and, for some completely ridiculous reason, was given chips. I assumed, generously, that they were included with the meal. Wrong. It turns out your staff mixed up my order with the table next to mine — and instead of taking responsibility for your mistake, I was still forced to pay for the wrong item. Why? Because I had eaten them before being told they weren’t part of my order. That is not just absurd, it’s borderline insulting.

Meanwhile, the table whose order mine was confused with? They were given a brand new portion of chips for free — simply because they “had to wait.” So let’s recap: I get the wrong order, I pay for it, and they get the right order plus a free one. If that doesn’t scream favoritism, negligence, or incompetence, I don’t know what does.

To make matters worse, your staff were shockingly rude, dismissive, and offered not a single word of apology. The way I was spoken to was completely unacceptable. And it doesn’t stop there — on a previous visit, I was nearly short-changed €20, which was brushed off with a casual “oops 🙃.” That alone should have been enough to never come back, but I gave you another chance. Clearly a mistake.

This experience was infuriating from start to finish. I left hungry, angry, and completely disrespected. The lack of professionalism, accountability, and basic courtesy from your staff is outrageous and unacceptable. I will be telling everyone I know to avoid your restaurant at all costs — you’ve lost a customer permanently.
😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😢", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "James G", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Very poor service. Long wait for food, even though it wasn't very busy. Served undercooked chips and fish in a soggy batter. It looked and tasted aweful. I tried to eat it but couldn't, was very disappointed after a 35-minute wait. It's a pity as the place looks great, but the staff dont seem to care. Major improvements needed. Save your money, and your time", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Andrea Begović", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 6 months ago", "review_text": "A truly delightful breakfast experience! The food was tasty and beautifully presented, and the cappuccino was rich and creamy—perfectly made. A cozy spot worth visiting for great food and coffee.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rachel C", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Went here for breakfast. The scrambled eggs were okay, not too bad. The hot chocolate was lovely, and the toastie too. The waitress was very friendly to the young child we had with us which was appreciated.

Only two issues is the menu for breakfast was so limited- only like 5 options, and only one toilet!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lukasz Marszalek", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Would be 5 stars but carbonara pasta small bit overcooked.  But tasty", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Vasilijus K.", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Realy nice and cosy place in Cork heart for breakfast and coffee. Food was great, staff very friendly and welcoming, really warm atmosphere. And price are excellent, most place you would pay double for what you order, and food quality is really good. Highly recommended place if you are in Oliver Plunket st.!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Lafayette’s
address: 76 S Mall, Centre, Cork, T12 A2YT, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Kwang Sujinno", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "A very nice café inside the Imperial Hotel. I felt very welcome and the staff were friendly. I didn’t get the chance to try other drinks or pastries as I arrived just before closing at 4:30, but the lady still took my order for a lovely tea. I’ll definitely come back next time to try more of their dishes.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Richard E", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely place to sit and have breakfast.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Felicity Roberts", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely lunch.  Food was fresh, vibrant and presented very well.  Pleasant and efficient staff.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rania", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "It was good but did not match my expectations. In addition, it cost me 20 euros 💶 which is a little pricy 🙂 …", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jillian Collins", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "I have loved the aesthetic of Lafayette's since I was young. I rarely leave bad reviews however the standard of food is not up to scratch of that of a 4star hotel. It is clear that the majority of staff are given no training and that there is no clear management system. The last few times I've visited (I keep going back cos I love the decor in there and am always rooting for it to be a good experience). Service is slow and poor. The woman sitting at a tablw near me with a child was left waiting ages to be served, then had to ask for culery, a portion of chips came along for her table. She then had to ask when the rest of the food was coming - she had orderd fish and chips. The one excellent and compentent server had to check on it for her. After the two had finished we had a quick chat. She said to me after that they didn't even bring the right sandwich for the child but she didn't have the energy to say anything.
My own order was a glazed ham and melted brie sandwich. At least that it what the menu said. What arrived was a plain slice of bread with relish and cold slice of brie, topped with a deli sized slice of ham. The portion of chips I ordered on the side came along first, with the server saying "Enjoy your meal," instead of saying "Is there anything else I can get you?" Having seen the experience of the lady near me, I too had to enquire if my sandwich was on the way.
This quality and service as mentioned above does not reflect the quality and standard expected from a 4 star hotel. If management of the hotel is reading this, please take time to train your staff properly i.e. getting an outside agency to train them rather than relying on more senior staff to do it and/or hire more staff.
I would recommend you take a look at how one of the city's other 4 star hotels trains and manages their staff i.e. The Metropole.
Thanks for reading,
I hope it is useful feedback to help you to improve your service. I want to reiterate that when a place is understaffed and undertrained that this is never the staff's fault but management's fault.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Dave Deasy", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "Poor selection of food just before lunch. Ended up having a dry brownie & melted ice-cream. Was looking for brunch or lunch. Waiter was excellent. Waitress not so much.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Kristian David Župan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "If you are looking for a special place where you will get an invaluable experience of enjoying amazing coffee and delicious desserts, then Lafayette’s is definitely the place to go. A truly magical oasis in the heart of the city. It is always a real pleasure to grab a coffee and some of the freshly prepared pastries. The ambiance is magical, it feels like you are in a castle full of rich history, surrounded by extraordinary decorations where everything is designed down to the last detail. With all that, the feeling of being there is also royal because the staff is more than friendly.

The most sincere recommendations for Lafayette’s, an outstanding cafe, a place where you can feel all the liveliness of this beautiful city.  Whether you’re a local or a tourist visiting the city, I’m sure you won’t regret it if you decide to relax with delicious coffee and one of the many tasty desserts.

In short, Lafayette’s is all you need if you want an authentic experience, a rich offer and wonderful and warm staff. You're great, just keep it up!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lillian Fitton.", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "Stopped by for a couple of glasses of wine,didn't get any food. We didn't realise it was table service so we went straight up to the bar & ordered it,then the staff told us to take a seat & they'd bring it over. Friendly staff & a cosy atmosphere", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mike O'Regan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "Lafayette's of The Imperial Hotel currently have a Burrito Window on the South Mall.
Full Irish Breakfast outdoors in a burrito ...", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Thomas Sallermann", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "I had Fish and Chips here today (outdoors). The monkfish was just perfect,  the usual sides quite innovative. A great place if you are into people watching.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Green Frog Café
address: 22A Western Rd, Mardyke, Cork, T12 CX94, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Nikitha Nair", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The tropical smoothie is really good – refreshing and full of flavour. It’s a great option just outside UCC, especially with the bustling crowd adding to the lively vibe. The brownie is absolutely fantastic – rich, indulgent, and worth trying!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lucía Tacaliti", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Tasty coffee and lovely location. The girls working there are so nice, shout out to Amy and Paola!! 💚 amazing experience, we will be back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Romeu Hayashi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Positively surprised with this coffee shop, I don’t usually come to this area in Cork and I was looking for some place to spend some good time with a good coffee.

Great coffee, with several other varieties of Frappuccinos, Iced Coffee, etc as well as several types of milk, etc

We priced their huuuge sausage roll, which was amazing, but I will definitely come back to try their sandwiches, which look delicious!

Well done guys!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Madison Day", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "I come here often since it's so close to UCC, and they have great coffee and snacks. Their spiced chai latte is delicious, and I love their red velvet muffins. My friends get other baked goods or sandwiches and I've yet to hear a bad thing about them yet. The service is always great too, and it's always clean inside.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mark McEntee", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "The location is really convenient for University College Cork, it’s just opposite the main entrance. I’ve been here a few times, and the food is usually good, today I had a toasted ham and cheese Panini and a smoothie. They’re two young staff member serving, obviously with no supervision, not only are they rude, but they don’t care about the reputation of the business. Making smart comments and giving attitude to customers. They Create a bad atmosphere, I’ll be back, but I hope that there are different staff.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Rachel O", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "I don’t often leave a negative review so this is actually really disappointing for me. I had high hopes from the photos but was let down by the experience.

Make staff at till in the morning were unfriendly. Not rude but no hello, no smile, no chat, no effort. Tables were not cleared or cleaned. The seating area was cluttered with things that should be in storage.

There was no table service or it seems option to have a sit down experience with reusable cutlery.

But my main gripe were the bathrooms. Broken taps in both. Unclean. It was just really not a nice experience. The eggs pot I got was just okay.

Take away looked much nicer to get a pastry or croissant or sweet treat. Also it was 9:10am so busy college rush time. But if you’re around campus and this is a daily occurrence they should have staffing to be able to handle that.

Would not recommend for a sit in.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "J Cronin", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Decent cafe, but serving a cappuccino in a paper cup is terrible when having it in the cafe. However, the staff were friendly and the cappuccino was quite good despite the awful paper cup. The atmosphere was really chill and there was the option to sit inside or outside. The seating was comfortable and it was overall fairly clean. They also have loyalty cards which is a nice touch.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Re Becca", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "First time ordering, Sunday morning a lovely girl recommended me Chicken & tomato panini (as for no pork eater)… I wasn’t sure I would like it but it turns out great ! And my flat white was lovely 🥰 5/5 overall but many times I passed around 5:30pm -5:45pm on Fridays and cafe was closed already so I advice changing times of opening as I was rushing and gasping for my cup of coffee when my daughter have training. It was disappointing each time. Especially when the cafe in park was closed. Prices are grand, service and food great too", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "John Heverin", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "Edited 4 months ago", "review_text": "My experience at the Green Frog Cafe was a mixed bag. The coffee was served promptly and was excellent. Unfortunately, our food order was completely overlooked. After a 30-minute wait, we had to remind the staff, and then received the wrong order. Got a regular sausage roll instead of the vegan sausage roll. This was frustrating, but to their credit, the staff were apologetic, and when the correct food finally arrived, it was delicious. The quality of the food itself was very high, but the service needs significant improvement.
