The music was a good volume and again, enjoyed the atmosphere.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Karan Samani", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "Edited 6 months ago", "review_text": "The food was decent. Got the blue cheese burger which felt quite fatty but considering the toppings it should have been expected.

The drinks however are really expensive, paid 7.20 for a pint of Heineken!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Dan Gogerly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Absolutely beautiful pub, great atmosphere with super friendly staff! Food was excellent, no complains at all!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rachel C", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "Atmosphere really nice and staff were lovely. Food came out super quick too, despite being busy. Got the platter for 2 (€40). The wings and chips were delicious. The mini burgers and sausages were nice too. Personally didn’t like the steak as I prefer it more well done but that’s personal preference. Unfortunately the stuffed spuds were stone cold which was disappointing. Cocktails 5/5, got a tropical dacquiri which was delicious

01/06/2024- went for bottomless brunch. Thought it was the list of drinks on the menu- mimosas, Bellini, Bloody Mary but it was only Prosecco which was disappointing…. The French toast was nice and pancakes nice but super filling", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Sean Power", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The staff were lovely. It’s in a nice area of the city, but can’t recommend this place. The food was very bad.

Older Irish people will remember Dunnes stores years ago did an unbranded cellophane wrapped pizza with slidey tomato and cheese fused together, so if you bit it too late you could pull it all off the pizza without touching the base. The pizza here was like that: had the same rubbery cheese and base texture. The pepperoni was tasteless and curled up, like from a pack at tescos. This pizza was €16.

My partner and her friend got stuff that was €9+ which was also pretty tasteless and not at all what was expected.

Again, the staff were really friendly - but there are so many places within five minutes or less walk which serve similar food at similar prices, and are way way better.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Rees", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The only place in Cork City I'm going to eat at from now on, food melts in your mouth. Staff are great the art is weird as hell and that great. Prices are worth it. Can't wait to go back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Adele Mcdonnell", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "4 days ago", "review_text": "Good bar .Live music good.was very busy but got served  quickly. Bar staff  very friendly.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Assunta D", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "Very good brunch!
The poached eggs were really good.
Nicely decorated, great atmosphere, nice terrace out front, friendly staff and great food selection (also gluten free option available).", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alex McCarthy", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "We were waiting a really long time on the cocktails, although the place was nearly empty. They were lovely, though, every single one. The atmosphere was great and cosy. Toilets were ckean, but all the toilet seats were falling apart. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: LovingSalads
address: 15 Academy St, Centre, Cork, T12 PW02, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Judith Holloway", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "A great lunch with the combination of so many different salads depending on what size of box you wanted. I had the large one & my partner had the protein sized box. It was difficult to choose the items to go in the box.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kwang Sujinno", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "This is a great spot for a healthy lunch! They have lots of options to choose from and everything is delicious. Great price. Perfect for a quick and tasty meal!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kurt Memmert", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "An excellent lunch option which is both healthy and does not break the bank. Helpful, friendly staff, little or no wait time, many choices, vegetarian and vegan options, you cannot go wrong with their food, space to sit down for your meal (or take-away, of course).
Today I had the Sri Lankan-style chicken curry, which was tasty without being overly spicy.
Much recommended.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ben Boland", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Outstanding selection of fresh salads. Everything is high quality and great value considering the amount you get.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rhea Deacon", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Staff were lovely, the salad was Devine and very well packed so you get a good meal for 7€ (I got a large salad bowl). Can't fault it really 👍", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "P PAC", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Loving Salads - Cork - Vegan Curry with Vegan Carrot Cake and Still water. €15. Curry ok but lots of rice! Carrot Cake dry. Manager agreed and replaced it with a very yummy Vegan Chocolate Caramel slice on sesame base. Should have gone for the salads ☹️ They looked very nice.
5 stars for Salad bowls and Chocolate Caramel Slice", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alannah", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Always 5 star quality; fresh, delicious and healthy food paired with personable staff and the perfect decor to match the earthy experience. I love it every time.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michael Roberts", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Absolutely amazing healthy fayre served by lovely staff in a chilled environment. If in Cork, you must visit!! Love from Manchester", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "yosbely hernandez", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Really good salad with good flavours and different styles!!! Price is good related to healthy food!!! the place is small.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alanna Curtin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Delicious salads with plenty of vegan options. I only wish they offered real plates and cutlery instead of disposable when sitting in.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Nosh 19
address: 19 Princes St, Centre, Cork, T12 W718, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Minh Trần", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "I dined in here several times before. The food is always impeccable, delicious and the portion is really good, with really decent price too! But what cool is that today I went in feeling sick, so the owner suggested me this shredded chicken noodle soup, and believe me, it sounded simple but it’s actually soo nice and I think it has cured my sickness.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Giovanna Carvalho", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "The best Asian food in Cork, friendly service, nice atmosphere and the food is unbelievable… the portions it’s large and it’s everything like the photos also the taste it is unreal, the pork belly and duck were crispy, the food arrived fast even though the restaurant was quite busy  .
Fast service too.
Fair prices for the food and portion!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Maria Jose Alfaro Vargas", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Absolutely amazing
The soup was really good 😍
The waitress was so kind to us, I loved the environment there", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Karan Samani", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Really good Chinese food that's a bit on the pricier side of things. There's also a second menu that you can ask for which supposedly contains more authentic dishes.

The food, like duck and chicken, might come with bone (do ask). The Hong Kong style roast duck is really tender, the crispy chilli chicken and the pepper beef are really good too.

The staff were really nice and helpful too, to give advise.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kim Morris", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Great place for really tasty Chinese food that is outside of the standard fare. The fish in the sea bass and pickled cabbage soup was remarkably fresh and the portion was generous. If you're not used to the type of heat from Sechuan peppers you might want to ask them to make your food mild for you.
I also tried the scallops there. Delicious!
Lovely friendly staff too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Elisa Day", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "My favourite Chinese restaurant in Cork! Friendly people, authentic food. Milk tea is good too", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Abin Francis", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "I was welcomed with the kindest and polite staff at the restaurant. Amazing food, just the right portion sizes. Good prices.
Words cannot describe how welcoming and kind the team is. It's  just the cherry on the top of the delicious meals they serve. Definitely recommend :-)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Reviewer-Elisabeth", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 days ago", "review_text": "The food was so good I went basic and had the chicken curry as it was my first time trying the food. It was so good. I went with friends and we agreed we have to go back as it was just so good. It was filling and the flavours where spot on", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eliza Tom", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "We were not disappointed in our search for authentic Chinese food!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Chris O'Brien", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Fantastic food and service, arrived with no reservation and they happily found us a table for 2. Really good atmosphere, food beautifully presented and absolutely delicious. Would highly recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: BarBarossa Oliver Plunkett Street
address: 72-73 Oliver Plunkett St, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Jack Coughlan", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "A very nice pub in the heart of Cork. It had a warm, welcoming atmosphere and was clearly popular, with lots of people enjoying meals when we visited. The food looked delicious—generous portions, beautifully presented, and clearly made with care. We didn’t eat this time, but it definitely tempted us, and we’ll be sure to try something next time we pass by.

The service was quick, friendly, and attentive without being intrusive. It’s the kind of place that makes you feel comfortable straight away. Looking forward to returning!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kassandra Wheeler", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Stopped in for a late lunch after visiting the English market. 10/10 on every bite. Absolutely wonderful food!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tim Quain", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "French bar maid was very short with me. Not a warm, friendly vibe at all. No music. Outdoor dining made me add an extra star. Wish they had more red ale options. I didn't eat because of the above mentioned.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michael O'Dwyer", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Best cup of tea I've had in years - lovely comfortable seating outside for a nice place to sit down midday", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sweetnessddd", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "I was down for the day. I went to the bar to ask for two toastie sandwiches a cheese and onion for myself and a ham cheese and onion for my partner,  I'm on a renal diet and there wasn't many options that I could eat on the menu. The girl behind the bar said it would be €28 for the two toasties. No chips no salad. I walked out still shocked and won't be rushing back. Ridiculous charging the same price as a club sandwich 🥪 with salad and chips for one cheese and onion toastie.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Keven Kottenhahn", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Unfortunately, the steak ciabatta was quite tough, so I wouldn’t order it again. My girlfriend’s burger, however, was excellent. Sadly, I couldn’t order dessert as I missed the kitchen closing time of 7:00 p.m. by just one minute.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Guilherme vieira", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Not sure what happens with the fish and chips  . It’s looks great but far away. Fish was so dry , hard to cut and lack of flavour.
The peas were very weird.
Fries were fine , however not my taste(not a critic here )

Maybe I got the things in a bad day.
All the best", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "zhanshiDE", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Extraordinary tasty food with very nice staff", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "R 25", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Avoid if you’re looking to enter. After a 30 minute walk after being recommended they told us 23’s only. Very random age. They clearly didn’t want us to enter. Avoid", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Michelle O Mahony", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "This is not a food review but  a review of the type of atmosphere and customer service in this bar. Both were absolutely terrible when I was there on Friday evening. The ‘manager’ working that evening had absolutely no customer service skills and was extremely rude and unprofessional.  Her colleague along side her working behind the bar had one of the worst attitudes in hospitality I have ever encountered. I did have a respectful a chat with the ‘manager’ about her lack of professionalism and while she did listen, she was unable to offer any reasonable explanation for her behaviour. It’s such a shame to have such unwelcoming and rude staff working in a bar at 7.30 on a Friday evening.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}]

name: Cork Coffee Roasters Cafe
address: Central Stores, 85 Ballyhooly Rd, Montenotte, Cork, T23 YD82, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Jiaan Cui", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I didn't have a class today, I was so bored, I sat in a coffee shop near my friend's house for an afternoon, and I remembered something about my ex. Very comfortable in the sun and the coffee price is probably the cheapest in all of Cork!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Yaran Liang", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Amazing coffee, popular among local, good vibe. Always full of people. Recommended!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "eL Foerstaldo", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Very nice coffee and cool little place. It's nice to sit outside when the weather is nice and watch life go by at St Luke's. They sell their beans as well if you prefer your coffee at home. The Rebel Espresso has been my go to bean for a while now.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jula Orzęcka", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Awesome vibes, friendly and proffesional staff. Taste of the coffee reminded me of my dad brewing it for us. Highly recommend for studying or working within delicious coffee, tea or hot chocolate and heavenly scent in the air. ☕📓", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ghafar Aimaq", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Using phone 🤳 & Wearing sunglasses on top of your head while working in a cafe shop is generally inappropriate and unprofessional .

While not serving coffee 😞☕", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Barbara Falke", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely staff, good coffee and great music.
Could sit here forever, always enjoyable!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Naga Tarun Vannela", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Great place to have a coffee and start your day. Their Hot Chocolate is very good.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ben Ashley-Faulkner", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Fantastic coffee and raspberry bakewell, perfect way to start a Sunday morning. Friendly, welcoming service.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Re Becca", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I was always a sucker for a americano but their flat white is so smooth and delicate just perfection. Also best cinnamon rolls. Lovely staff. Atmosphere is great. The only flaw is those metal high chairs if you have any plans sitting longer with a book or anything and back problems I recommend take the other chair :) but 5/5 for me still! Prices are great too !!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Deepak Pandey", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Awesome coffee with a great view...in sunny weather it's great to sit outside and have conversations", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: John Henchy & Sons
address: 40 Wellington Rd, St Luke's, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Karen Pertoldi", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "We visited Cork last weekend from Manchester and were delighted to stumble on this pub on our first night. We spent a few nights here, sat outside watching the world go by and in one of the many snug corners inside listening to some good music. It had a great vibe and atmosphere and seemed to cater for all ages, regulars and visitors.  The staff were very friendly and welcoming and helped point us in the right direction re our visit. The pub is really old and has some nice features, art and stained glass. We looked it up and saw a review where it was listed in the Telegraphs Top 100 pubs. We will definitely call in again next time we visit Cork. 💚", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Finbarr M. Burns", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Excellent gem of a pub just outside the City Centre.  Great options of indoor and outdoor seating.  Really high quality drinks, especially their Guinness.  The staff are fantastic and if you are hungry, they allow you to buy pizza or food from the other local businesses and bring it in.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Julie Jennings", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Wonderful bar. So comfortable and welcoming. Staff was fantastic. So happy we decided to stop in on our way back to our hotel after dinner in Cork.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Melief Koper", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "It was the best Beamish we had in Ireland! Lovely atmosphere with even better drinks.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "George Kyritsis", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Nice little pub at St. Luke’s Cross.  Has cozy little nooks for privacy and also your typical pub setup.  Nice outdoor area.  Nestled in a picturesque part of the city with colourful facades and nice views looking down Wellington street.  Friendly staff and a nice place to catch up with friends.  Perched high up in the city of Cork and in the distance if you look carefully,  you’ll see beautiful rolling hills with a patchwork of manicured fields.  Ample parking in the surrounding streets.  Easier to get to by taking the #208 bus which stops right in front of the pub.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ciaran McPhillips", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Magnificent Guinness. Best in Cork. Fabulous service and lively atmosphere too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Karl Brooks", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely pub, excellent Beamish and Murphy's stouts, and proper dog friendly, they allow dogs inside 😁 That's very unusual for Ireland.
And you can order food from adjacent restaurants and they deliver to you in the pub 😁", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "James Finn", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "On my last Friday night in Ireland, I arrived alone at JH & Sons to a large crowd both inside and out. I ordered a Guinness and found a spot to sit around back where there were three groups enjoying drinks and lively banter.

Feeling somewhat out of place, I relocated to a stool at the end of one of two bars, next to where patrons were ordering drinks. I ordered a Beamish and occasionally engaged in brief conversation with those waiting on their drinks.

The beers were exceptionally fresh and delicious.

The crowd was expectedly boisterous and loud and the bartenders were quite busy. Rising above the din of the crowd was the recurrent laughter of assumably drunken female clientel - earily remiscent of the Wicked Witch of the West leaving on her broom.

I was enjoying myself up until it was time for me to order my third pint. I had decided that I would have a Murphy's to complete my comparison of available Irish stouts.

I don't quite know why, but I found it impossible to get the attention of either of the female bartenders.

Patrons to my left and right were being served, but the bartenders chose to ignore me, and would not even make eye contact. I started to wonder what I had done to put them off. Was it my thick Brooklyn accent, or was it my NHL NY Rangers t-shirt?

After what seemed like an eternity (15-20 min), a third bartender came over from the other bar and took my order. I drank my Murphy's (my favorite of the three) and left with the feeling that I was unwelcome.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin Byrne", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "This pub typifies a local bar in a city centre that still manages to retain some of the old world charm that is synonymous with the Irish pub scene of yesteryear. The decor and the friendly banter between staff and customer is something that would keep you coming back over and over. The establishment boasts lively music several nights of the week from well-known cork musicians. It is the type of place you can add easily go for an afternoon cup of coffee as a lovely night out depending on your mood. The owner is also particularly welcoming.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Moriah Hilden", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "One Irish stout for the lady please! “We are a Beamish pub”, they say. Perfect, I’ll take a pint. Tasty, cozy vibes here. There was a game on in the other room and the fireplace was cranking. Nice and toasty with my Beamish. Thank you!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: 5 Points Kiosk
address: The Showgrounds, Monahan Rd, Ballintemple, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Mr Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Five Points outdoor takeaway Cafe at the Marina Park during storm Agnus the first storm of 2023 that caused a fair bit of destruction. The Marina Park is located in the now Docklands area of the Marina between Live at the Marquee and Páirc Uí Chaoimh at Five points Cafe and Central Hall.

It has a number of entrances all of which can be accessed from the Centre Park road Ballintemple area. The Atlantic pond nature reserve is also located here. It leads on to the Blackrock Railway Greenway with options that take you to Blackrock Village Mahon and further on to Passage West with parks pubs cafes and garages along the way heading south east.

The route is used on occasion for events such a Marathons charity walks and son on. It is fully pedestrianised and full of walkers and cyclists. With some parking available around the area it is well worth a visit with some of the most scenic views in Cork City.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "grace mcl", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "The staff this morning were lovely, the two girls were friendly and professional.

They open early so a lot of the bagel options were gone by 12.
The bagels are fresh, I had the salted bagel with herb cream cheese and bacon. It was delicious.

Also had a Portuguese custard tart with coffee was was so fresh and tasty

They have a nice seated area which is covered but not loads of seats", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ally O'R", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely cafe, staff are friendly and helpful. Food and coffee both great, and their chai latte is one of the best in Cork. Big fan of the café on MacCurtain street too. Highly recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Fiona O'Grady", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 8 months ago", "review_text": "Delicious coffee and treats.  Try the pastel de nata. Friendly staff, and convenient seating.  Toilets, including disabled toilet,  available. Seating is outdoor and sheltered from the rain,  but can be breezy - wear something warm on cooler days.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Terry Flynn", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "7.50 for three " loop d Loop" ice lollies for the kids
Absolute madness
The same products would be 1/3 of the price in a super market or cafe around the corner", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "H H", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "Edited 3 months ago", "review_text": "Would be zero stars if I could. Owners or staff illegally park and dangerously drive on the plaza every day. Nearly knocked down my kid the other day and could not care less.

Update: Still doing deliveries by driving over the grass.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Susan Power", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "The kiosk by 5 points down the marina is awful. The young girl who works there at the weekend is rude and not interested. Place is dirty and coffee isnt great.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Martyna Nowakowska", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "5 point Kiosk and 5 points café on MacCurtain street are absolutely best food/coffee spots in Cork City !!
All of the staff are so kind and lovely. Would definitely recommend to pay a visit.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Phoebe Nicholson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Staff are so friendly and great coffee. Lovely spot and dog and child friendly. Would definitely recommend to everyone.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Claudia Hernández", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely bagels, lovely staff. Some tables available.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Annie Mac's
address: 27 Bandon Rd, Denroches Cross, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Desmond Jordan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "Fantastic pub. The staff here are wonderful. Lovely warm stove and a huge beer garden. A pint for €4.00. Very popular with the students, working class and pensioners alike.
Well worth a visit
Highly recommended", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nate ON8 Productions", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Annie Mac's is a cute little pub in Bishop's Town. The atmosphere is cool. Great spot to meet up with friends and hang out.

There is wheelchair accessible parking nearby.

The entrance and space is wheelchair accessible.

They have a decent selection of beers on draught.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jack Keane", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely traditional pub but the true highlight is the big and spacious beer garden", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Stephen O Regan", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "A Proper Traditional Irish bar! Fine beer good very reasonable prices!  Can be busy with people from the Surrounding Colleges and Universities in the Area. Nice place I'd say to go watch Sport? Fine Beer Garden out the back! Not far from City centre! Nice Pint of Stout here. Old style pub which is Brilliant. Can be busy at times outdoors seating only good for Summer months and good weather mostly!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Valerie O’Leary", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "An old woman who I can only assume was the owner of the pub was nothing but rude and ignorant towards us. My friends and I were in between drinks and our empty glasses had been taken by the bartender. The owner came over and demanded that we leave. I tried to explain that we had just bought a drink but she would not listen and escorted us out of the pub in front of everyone. We only had one drink each and It was a Wednesday evening when the pub was almost empty.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Rowan Hart", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "My favourite pub in Cork. Perfect for Winter as can sit near the fire with a Beamish. In Summer can enjoy a cold cider in the massive beer garden. Great staff. Sound regulars aswell. I’m a student but always have great craic with the older patrons.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Feárgus ODonoghue", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Not sure if they serve food tbh , but I would class this as a real Cork inner City pub , lots of pleasant friendly characters… great staff and pint", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Raúl Jiménez", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Unbelievable pub. Best in the business", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Enda Leavy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "Cosy, great value, great atmosphere, lovely pint", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "DC reviews", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "A great pub for students around the ucc area. Perfect on sunny days with a massive beer garden. Pints are great and the staff are friendly. Also worth visiting when the weather is poor always a good fire on.", "sentiment": "Good"}]
