Both of the lads are real gents and that coupled with the convenient location and traditional design mean the place is consistently a good vibe and undeniably one of the best bars in Cork.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Teresa Sardà", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "El Fenix, good spot, good staff, good music, heritage ambiance, water’s nearby, one of the best sunny terraces in town! Hop!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Maura McCarthy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "El fenix is possibly the best bar in cork city. Every single member of staff makes sure to make you feel welcomed. Savage music, beautiful pints, best spot in the city", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Luciana CeFe", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "Edited 3 months ago", "review_text": "I had high hopes for this place, but after witnessing what goes on behind closed doors, I can’t recommend it.
The lack of professionalism and questionable after-hours behaviour were deeply disappointing.

What’s worse, after leaving my honest opinion, I received an intimidating message. That says more about the place than any review could.

I was a regular customer. I expected decency, not fear.

Not sure if management is aware, but if they are, that alone should be a red flag.
Think twice before supporting this place.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Reece Hui", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Local beers were great! Music is at a nice volume so you can still chat!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Robbie Armstrong", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Great location and great atmosphere. Nice for a few pints by the river.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Annika Barduson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "I told Hazel that she gave me the greatest cup of water I’ve ever had and she said I gotta leave a review so I am :)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Stuart Johnson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 6 months ago", "review_text": "My favourite bar in cork city. Great spot for a sunny day. Great team behind the bar, good atmosphere and great beer. Massive thumbs up from me", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Deez Nutz", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Had two of my friends come in here for their first pints. Not overly busy, lovely outdoor seating, inside has a lot of character and the fella at the bar's plenty friendly. Stouts are around €6 give or take a couple cent.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: NORTH at The Address Cork (formerly McGettigan's Cookhouse)
address: Military Hill, St Luke's, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "heather notarangelo", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "You will wait a long time for your food but I can only assume it's because the lit hen where they make delicious food is super small and everything is from scratch. The best toastie I had in Ireland came from here and it featured onions and red cheddar. Yum!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Isabella Salvia", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely place and amazing food.

The location itself is nice with all these books surrounding you that help create a cozy atmosphere.
The outdoor area is very nice with a bit of view of Cork.

In terms of food you MUST try the seafood chowder and the steak burger.

Absolutely recommended!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Noel McGrath", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Great tasting & quality food. Nice staff with quick service.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "John Ó Ríordáin", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "8 years ago", "review_text": "Nice food, nice staff and a lovely seated area out the front when it's sunny. Service isn't quick but it's grand for a leisurely lunch or dinner.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Geraldine Brown", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Stayed in hotel and foot injury meant I had to stay in to dine one night. Both courses had elements described on the menu missing with no explanation. Veg overcooked. Bland food. Wish I had paid for a taxi into town instead. Staff were good.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "John Riordan", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "We had a family group of 16 celebrating an 80th birthday here. The setting was lovely, and the service was solid, our single waiter handled the large group with care, was friendly, and got all the orders right, which we really appreciated. Unfortunately, the food didn’t quite live up to expectations. We all ordered from the main menu, and while the dishes varied, the general consensus was that the food was average at best. A particular letdown was the “seared lemon sole fillet” which turned out to be just deep-fried fish in batter, more like pub grub than the refined dish the menu description suggested. To her credit, the manager acknowledged our concerns and made adjustments to the bill, which we appreciated. Still, for a venue like this - a 4 start hotel, the kitchen needs to up their game. Nice atmosphere, good service , but the food fell short of the mark.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Kate Taylor", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Great spot to enjoy some food, especially if you're staying at the hotel. We came in fairly late and had a very reasonably priced tasty meal.
Highly recommend the Jacob's ladder - it was fantastic. Steak sandwich was alright as well - the peppercorn sauce was the best part.
Service was a bit slow but they didn't seem to have many folks working on a Wednesday night, so I can understand that.
Dinner and dessert for 2 was under €50 - very worth it.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Claire Organ", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "The food was grand, not amazing. Got garlic prawns, chicken fajitas and salmon. Presentation was nice but the food wasn’t flavoursome. The dessert (eton mess) was very disappointing. Good menu and good potential but overall very average.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Alan Sweeney", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "Food was good. Not great. Service was slow. Sign at the door saying to remain there to be seated but was ignored for 5minutes, staff even looked at me but didn't bother to come over. Eventually seated after I walked towards a waitress.
Forgot my drinks order, was finished my food by the time it came down. A bit of a shame some better trained staff and it could be great.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "rachel daly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "The food was great, the staff were attentive. Great value for money. A lovely place to meet a few friends and catch up", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: 107 Barrack Street
address: 107 Barrack St, The Lough, Cork, T12 T6H3, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Michela Lagorio", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "The place is amazing, you think it's just a cafe but when you go in you'll be surprised to see that they also sell things like clothes, books, vinyls and much more.
The staff was very nice and welcoming. The cappuccino I had with the chocolate brownies were delicious.
Overall thus place really made me feel as comfortable as I was just at home. I'll definitely be back again. Thank you!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "james scott sumter", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "What a warm, family friendly welcome by personnel and regulars on a first day, first coffee and pastry in Cork. Not fancy but overwhelmingly neighborhoody and nice; returned again for the coffee and camaraderie in a funky atmosphere; indoor and outdoor (front & back) near Ft. ELIZ., St. Finns Cathedral & Nano Nagles.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Patrick O'Leary", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "What an absolutely wonderful hidden gem, well, not so hidden!

Really wasn't sure what to expect when we entered, but, was blown away by the interior of the cafe when I noticed they don't just sell coffee - but much more!

The 'Coffee Garden' was stunning in the sunshine, and the coffee was also really good! I have a feeling it will become our regular spot I think!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Caoimhín", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Coffee was good and the owners were very friendly. A real credit to Barrack Street.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "f", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "a hidden gem with the nicest staff and even lovely customers! their home baked goods are delicious, they give attention and care to the drinks they make and you feel right at home there 🫶 was my first time here and they were so welcoming and chatty. very cool vibe and stuff for sale there too!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Cemal", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "A newly open, fantastic place. You can have your hot drink while enjoying the cosy atmosphere enriched with quite nice decoration.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Dee Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "This is an absolute gem of a coffee shop. Lovely outdoor area. Great coffee, cakes and toasties. You can pick up a bargain here with  2nd hand clothes on sale and other treasures. The people who own and run it are so wonderful. Well worth a visit.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eleanor Cook", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "My favourite coffee shop in Cork. The people who run it are friendly and welcoming. I moved here from England in 2020 and used to live above the shop. From day one they welcomed me in and I always felt like I had somewhere I could go if I fancied a little company. They always remember me when I come in and the vibes are always so nice. It feels very small-town even in the city", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Cathrine Jane", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Worth the walk up the hill on Barrack Street. Lovely scones and coffee. The owners are such wonderful local people. The cafe itself has its own personality. If you’re lucky you might even find a nice outfit inside.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Isa Heartfilia", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Just got my first takeaway coffee from 107 Barrack Street. Staff was very welcoming and the café decoration is personal and authentic. Coffee tastes good, and I'm pretty picky with flat whites.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: An Spailpín Fánach
address: 29 S Main St, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Damien Mc Sweeney", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "I always call to this rustic Irish Traditional bar when lm back in Ireland. The decor is rustic and beautiful, the staff friendly and efficient  and the atmosphere is great. Many nights during the week, musicans will drop by with their instruments, and you might even be treated to traditional music session", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Joanne Durann", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "What an amazing find for us!! Great music, cool vibe, and the 2 ladies behind the bar are terrific!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Dave English", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Such a good venue for comedy with a great lineup - really enjoyed the night, cozy setting and pints. Will definitely be back!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Vincent Byron", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "My wife and myself had a great evening in this pub.Great music.Drinks spot on and served by staff who took time to have a chat and all the time keeping everyone served.Mr Mc Cabe has great pubs with great staff.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "James McM", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Perfect spot for comedy and pints! Been here a few times now and the lineup has always been top class.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Trevor Forde", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "A great pub all through the years, heard its ur for sale which is a pity ,hopefully someone will take over and keep the same vibe and staff, they are great, very friendly", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin Byrne", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "This is an underrated bar in my opinion.  It's somewhat of an institutionz and when it comes to an authentic Irish bar with a welcoming and authentic Irish Music session, you couldn't go wrong with the Spailpín. Situated in the heart of Cork City, the place (I think) takes it's name from the infamous  Irish Poem \"An Spailpín Fánach\" (meaning the wandering labourer), a poem that describes the harshness of living as a roving labourer in 18th Century Ireland. There is a session that welcomes everyone once a week running in this bar downstairs and concerts (such as during the Cork Folk Festival) are held upstairs.  There is a small stage and a deceptively good sound system upstairs for festival gigs. I like the lighting in this pub, it's a mix of candles and really old lamp shades.  A regular haunt for sure and worth a visit if you haven't been.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sibeesh Venu", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "It was a good visit. Our gang liked it here. They also have live music inside with sitting area.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kev O'Connell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "A fantastic Thursday treat. Great comedians and a beautiful venue", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "micheal Roche", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "lovely club, great acts.\nWill definitely go back!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Edison
address: 11-12 Washington St, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Emmanuel", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Dave from Edison is one of the best bartenders you can ever meet. Super friendly, fantastic cocktails, super attentive and great vibes. Would highly recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aleš Krybus", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely place. Nice cocktails and happy hour. Get 3 for 2 price.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aom", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "I have been coming to this place for years and I absolutely love it. The cocktails are amazing and there’s a huge selection, they also have a great selection of pints. The staff are amazing, so friendly and kind. Great atmosphere and fun spot also!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Robert Hayes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Arrived on a Friday night on Happy Hour. Got 3 cocktails for the price of 2. €21 in total. Popcorn cocktail especially delicious and would recommend. Long island ice tea also great and very strong - (good alcohol content / €.). Friendly staff too. Would return next time we’re in Cork.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "M T", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "Not my kind of place....a bit dingy & dark with lots of very uncomfortable chairs.  On the upside, they were doing 3-for-2 cocktails when we called in & my margarita was quite good.  Also, they have boardgames & there were some comfy chairs...just not enough for us.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Jonathan", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Visited a couple of weeks ago with friends and had a generally positive experience. The staff were very friendly, and the venue was absolutely packed, which made for a lively atmosphere.

However, the music was a major letdown. PlayHouse were performing on the night, and unfortunately, the DJ came across as quite rude. His mixing skills left a lot to be desired, and according to my friend, he played an identical set just weeks earlier.

Cork has a rich history when it comes to house music — it deserves better. While the crowd and energy were great, the musical quality seriously missed the mark.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "John Browne", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "Absolutely delighted with my visit here. Staff were fantastic, friendly, helpful and brilliant overall. Quite a busy night with the local youth's celebrating their return to college. Great atmosphere.

At one point however there was a homeless man passing who was in a poor mental state. He was loitering close to the building and causing a bit of a scene.

The owner (I presume) was fantastic in dealing with this, and he showed great patience and compassion when dealing with the man, who was obviously fairly troubled. Great to see some bit of humanity in these times.
Kudos to you sir, proud to be a Corkonian last night.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Rachel Coughlan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Best cocktails in Cork city, the 'Gizzy' is a must try! Friendliest bar staff in Cork, amazing music & great crowd, loads of seating inside & out 😊 …", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Anton D.", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "One of the best places in Cork to get cocktails. The owner and people working there are friendly and supportive, doing great job too. Place doesn't have any food though, so generally advised after you had dinner already.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Carolyn", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "So many creative and fun cocktails. Moraig was such a great bartender, and she even made some off-the-menu cocktails for us based on our descriptions of what we liked! The happy hour deal is phenomenal -- 3 cocktails for the price of 2 (just make sure to order all 3 at the same time) and 3.50ish for a Guinness!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: SABOR BRAZIIL
address: 5 Washington St, Centre, Cork, T12 HY1X, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Roberta Mura", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 days ago", "review_text": "We went to Sabor for dinner for the first time, dinner for two. Sarah greeted us and she was so friendly and nice, service, food and timing was excellent. We order the meals on the pics. Great experience, Sarah also offered us a traditional dessert homemade", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Promi Das", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Sarah was really hospitable and provided friendly service. The food looked not only delicious but tasted great as well. The restaurant checked in and double confirmed to ensure that our group team dinner was smoothly organized. Thank you for the lovely hospitality!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paul Richard Bungay", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Another hidden jewel in the City of Cork! We wanted to try something different and we definitely chose the right spot! We tried their Brazilian bbq and it was awesome!!!!!!!! 2 steaks, bacon, halloumi cheese, chicken wrapped in bacon. What more can u ask for? I tried their Brazilian beer as well and it partnered well with the one that I ordered. Great experience and great customer service. They have seat on the first floor and second floor and they have toilets too. Shout out to our server Carol! She has been amazing :)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Idoia Domínguez Pérez", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Tucked away like a hidden gem, this Brazilian restaurant delivers far more than just good food—it’s a full-hearted experience.

Every dish arrived bursting with flavor, perfectly cooked and deeply comforting. From the juicy grilled meats to the sides of rice, beans, fries, and potato salad, the meal was a celebration on every plate.

The service? Impeccable. Attentive without being overbearing, and genuinely warm from start to finish.

A special shout-out to Bruno, whose kindness and care made the whole evening feel extra special. He made sure everything we ordered was just right, and it absolutely was.

Obrigada!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Liam O'Sullivan", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "Food is very good, for most of what they offer. Delicious authentic Brazilian food.

Service can be a little slow sometimes maybe because it is extremely busy. More staff is needed.

Very tight spaced restaurant, especially the bathrooms are very narrow and small. The chairs are quite small also and not comfortable.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Kevin M.", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Best açaí bowl I've had in Ireland. It was almost like eating in Brazil!

This was in February this year. I've had it a few times since then.

I love all the mains too. But this is the real reason I come here.

My partner was sad there was no flan to try last time we were there in July. We will phone ahead next time to check.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "camila marques", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "A great opportunity for anyone who hasn’t tried Brazilian cuisine yet to experience it. Pot-cooked beef and tilapia are my favorite dishes and here’s a tip for you, too: if you’re Brazilian, give them a try and enjoy a little taste of home.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paulina Piotrowska", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Cannot recommend this place enough! from the moment I walked in to the restaurant it felt so comfortable and welcoming, Sarah went above and beyond to make sure every person in the restaurant had everything they needed, her customer service and attention to detail is absolutely impeccable and she’s a huge credit to the restaurant! (And she makes an absolutely banging capirinha) The food came out without any delay and it was honestly everything I could have asked for and more, well seasoned rice and tender juicy steak, it was the very definition of comfort food!! I will be returning and bringing all of my friends here, it’s honestly one of the best dining experiences I’ve had in a long time! Good job guys, you really have something special it was a pleasure, start to finish !! Just wish I had more time so I could try some dessert…here’s to next time ! 😊", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "A Farmer", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Got this delivered for lunch today, first time trying the place, but was familiar with Brazilian food through an old college friend.
It was absolutely delicious, so comforting, I can’t get over the rice, it’s the perfect balance of flavour and I love how Brazilians make rice,
as an Irish person I know we can find new foods and cuisines intimidating but I honestly think this has amazing flavour, not to mention huge value, the portion sizes we got with the delivery were huge. Would definitely recommend and can’t wait to order again.
We recommend the pichana steak and rice both very delicious, the beans are good too, just not a favourite of mine🙂 a very well rounded meal. Thank you", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "4HEIST", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Absolutely lovely place! Very nice and cozy, with the soft Brazilian music on the background. I was with my Brazilian friend in here, the good man Bruno was serving us – very friendly, helpful and absolute professional of his work, felt like we knew him all of my life.

We ordered Brazilian barbecue, it was ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! Huge portion that make us so full🤩", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: 51 Cornmarket
address: 51 Cornmarket St, Centre, Cork, T12 VK88, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Will Gallie", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Stunning little place. Food delicious & classically plated. Wine tasty and I like how the drinks menus were displayed by the side of each table. Would recommend to anyone who likes tasty traditional food.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Denis Byrne", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Went there  yesterday evening with my partner. We received a warm welcome from Anne and the evening just got better. Delicious food, I had Monkfish, my partner had steak tartare. Wonderful wine. And the service was excellent and there’s a warm, inviting atmosphere in this fabulous restaurant. We highly recommend it and will definitely be back soon.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Darren Miller", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Everything was stunning from start to finish. Great, casual service, good recommendations. Good but simple wine selection. Every plate was absolutely delicious", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ellen O Donovan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Superb meal for my brothers 30th last night. Every dish was top class and the duck parfait is a must try. Cozy atmosphere and attentive, knowledgable staff. Thanks for such a memorable meal!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alan O'Brien", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Popped in with my wife on a Saturday evening and wow was it busy!!! A great sign for a place right?

First, the food. The menu is very interesting with an excellent selection. I had pickled muscles for start, and the rump for main. The pickled muscles were tasty, but somewhat lacking the actual flavour of being pickled. The Rump was a touch overdone and not served with a side which was surprising. My wife had fried oysters to start, and steak tartar for main.

I see in other comments that the owner has defended the cost while talking about challenging prices in the business. I would see this as fair, however, it would stand to reason that serving a steak in sauce and nothing else with it is a somewhat sad looking plate. If other business are managing a little something on the side, it may be worth taking a look at how the dish is presented here.

The atmosphere was busy, however downside of this was that it would be easier to hold a conversation next to a screaming toddler than here due to the mighty background noise. This is not really the fault of the restaurant as it is the size that it is, just be aware that you may need to perfect your lip reading before arriving.

The staff were lovely and very helpful so a big thanks to them!

Would I come back? No, too loud but that is just a me problem.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Caroline O Brien", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "We had a wonderful experience when dining for the first time last weekend for a birthday celebration.
We had the window table which was lovely.
The food was all delicious, starters, mains and dessert, really good quality and beautifully presented.
The staff were all so lovely, even though they were  constantly on the go the whole night as it was very busy.
We thought it was very good value for the high level of food.
The wine menu was very good too with lots of choice.
A gem of a restaurant, and we will definitely be back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Roger Spo", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Menu was interesting with a hint of French. The cured cod starter really didn’t taste of any of the named ingredients to me. But it was all good. Pork belly main course was the best. Friendly service, cozy atmosphere. Lighting was dark.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Riannon Adams", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely restaurant.  We went to celebrate our engagement and the staff was so welcoming and set the mood brilliantly. The food was well thought out and delicious. In time, I could see this restaurant at the very least being on the Michelin bib gourmand list.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jack Baylor", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Absolutely delightful experience... superb food, lovely wine selection & the staff are both super knowledgeable and very friendly.
Their brunch used to be superb but they've taken their menu to a whole new level with the dinner offerings.
Absolutely heading for a Michelin Plate in the *very* near future.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Robert Daly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Wonderful , high quality, beautifully presented & tasty dishes in a relaxed setting..
3 chose Duck leg - I had Rump steak.
Duck parfait starter & others had Otsters in hot sauce.
Delicious chips & veg.
Decadent flourless chocolate slice - YUM.
2 bottles of Wine.
€250 including Tip.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Alchemy Coffee and Bookstore
address: 123 Barrack St, The Lough, Cork, T12 A594, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "J Cronin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Like most places, the experience can depend on when you visit. The first time I visited, it was very busy and the music was loud. I was a little put off then, but there was a potential about the place that I felt I hadn't experienced as it had a clean yet rustic vibe that I loved. The second time I visited, the music was low, and it was quiet with a chilled ambience. The cappuccino was good, and there was water available as well. The seating was very comfortable too. The only question on both visits was the staff were be a little distant.
Overall, I'd definitely visit again.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sinead Cullinane", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Great spot, had a lovely sausage roll and then very nice coffee cake and Chai latte. Only thing is the place is popular so it's often full. I went around 11 on a Monday and by 12 it was full up", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Adelina Mart", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely staff! Excellent coffee and a full selection of pastries, sweet and savory. Very cozy inside and outside seating as well.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Марина Макарова", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "One of the most delicious coffees in the city, the desserts are perfect.
The barista is a true professional.
The hall is very cozy with a cool design, and there is also a terrace.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nick Dunlop", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Excellent coffee, their own branded roast,  and the food offering is good too. It's a very cool place to be . Lots of customers all the time . Nice atmosphere and decor. We stayed around the corner whilst in Cork for a few days and it was our first stop every morning. It was the best coffee we found in town. I'd be really delighted to have this place as my local coffee shop.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Andrej Gusev", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "It is my favourite coffee shop (and imo the best one) in Cork. The staff is the best. So lovely! The coffee is amazing. Always on point. They've got some bites if you're hungry (the chef/baker is amazing) and the sweets... 🤤 The sweets!!! That brownie is by far the best I've had around here. Some of the best coffee shop cakes in Cork for sure. Oh and the friendly atmosphere... Highly recommended! ❤️", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Master Bate", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "it's an adorable coffee shop, with great food options and a lovely atmosphere! It can be very busy, and sadly there's not many seating options. It's very nice and cozy, and they offer vegan options as well!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Fauboubou", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Perfect spot for a reading or chatting session. The food and the coffee is so good and the vibe immaculate", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Caroline Dunne", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Alchemy has become my new favourite coffee spot. Gorgeous coffee and matchas, plus amazing food such as sausage rolls and pecan brownies.

Staff always so friendly too!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Isabel Canning", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Such a lovely little hidden gem. And the salmon and cream cheese bagel was incredible! Definitely exceeded my expectations - it was so flavoursome. I also got the vegan snickers cake to take away which was yummy too!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Holy Smoke Kitchen
address: The, Mardyke Entertainment Complex, Sheares St, Centre, Cork, T12 CX7A, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Assunta D", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "Amazing burger, really filling!
Good service. The staff were nice and friendly.
The only thing I didn’t like is that they only serve craft beer.
Higly recommended.
Looking forward to returning:)", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "tiny lily", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "The food here is amazing... everything was really well cooked and tasted wonderful, I'd happily work my way through the menu over the course of several months. The service on my visit though was frankly appalling, slow and slightly shambolic. I was brought the wrong drink, sauces were taken away when we'd requested them to be left (and they then charged us for more later) and menu items were substituted without telling us. Service alone would be two stars, the really good food would be five and will get me coming back if I come to Cork again.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Diego Maria Ricigliano", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 6 years ago", "review_text": "Surely the best BBQ restaurant in Cork. The brisket is magical. The restaurant is a must go. It is famous for the best pulled pork you can have and it is. Remember to book tho, as you want to reserve your table. It has also a good variety of gf dishes. You will surely. Come back!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Neil Mateer", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Good food, Sega mega drive at our table 👌
No minors allowed after 7pm so keep this mind if taking kids", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sascha Giese", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "Quite a disappointing experience based on too high expectations. The ribs were tasteless, so were the chicken pieces. Sliders with pulled pork okay, some small sausages as a starter were actually not bad. Ambiente a bit boring and too dark, but the staff is attentive. Bowling and pool upstairs  but no parking close by.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Uge Ursua", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 5 years ago", "review_text": "They offer fresh Irish meat (beef, pork, free range chicken) which are char-grilled, pit-smoked low n slow, or bbq ed. We ordered pork baby back ribs which has a delicious mouthwatering wet rub, meat are all tender. Rib eye steak was char grilled over fire which has a legit smoky flavor. Serving sizes are huge. Ambiance is cozy, crowds are usually in group of young people. Staff are friendly and attentive. The prices are reasonable, might spend roughly €25-30 for main + dessert + pint.
However, parking is limited within the street.
Reservations might be needed during the weekends.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Laks Vanamurthy", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Tastes good. Price was fair. Service staff was  very friendly and made the dinner enjoyable.  Would have given them 5 stars if not for the dirty bathrooms.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "declan holohan", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Had our table booked and shown too it that was grand, was left sitting there for ages and eventually had to look for someone too actually serve us. Food came fast and was delicious, can not fault the food what so ever it was perfect 👌. But then strangely I'm the middle of eating our dinner the woman came back and asked would we like to pay cash or card and stood there until I paid? I did not appreciate that at all it was very rude. But what ever about the service I would go back for the food it was 100%", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Yasmin Leandersson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Food was lovely we had brisket burnt ends , a burger and Mac and cheese (the portions are big tho so half of it came home with us) atmosphere was great they have a bowling alley and pool table and immaculate music playlist would recommend. Make sure you bring ID !", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Matija Grcic", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "7 years ago", "review_text": "I've ordered The BBQ Blow Out which includes brisket burnt ends, dry-rubbed baby back ribs, pit-smoked BBQ chicken and pulled pork, plus two sides. The brisket was great but everything else was kinda tasteless. The ribs were dry and chewy, the chicken was clearly overcooked and pulled pork, well I've used brisket sauce to give it some taste.

Staff is friendly and helpful and only reason this isn't a two star review.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Park
address: The Park, 26 S Main St, Centre, Cork, T12 FXA4, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "oli", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Good music,had a good chat with the bar man Carey,he was nice good service and educated me on cork and the culture.Great bar man 👍", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Adam Mcilwaine", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Went in For a pint recently, great atmosphere, lovely bar staff very accomidating. Very well prices for the city. Would recommend", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eilidh Fraser", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Really friendly staff and great chat.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Andrew Williamson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Brilliant place to pop in for a nice cozy pint lovley staff the atmosphere was amazing and loved the music", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Emily Dunne", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Cosy bar with good music, however perhaps got unlucky with the bar staff who were on as it felt like I was a nuisance to them for ordering one drink. No person-ability at all, shame because the experience would stop me from going back again. Not that hard to say hello, please and thank you!", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Conor O'Leary", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Great service, great pints, great staff, great vibes. Highly recommend", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "David Griffin", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "\"Great little cosy pub to to have a few\" friendly Staff \"", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "neme", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Relaxed and cozy atmosphere. Staff is wonderful and always friendly. Seating indoors and outdoors. Trivia night on Tuesday evenings (best to check their instagram page). However, they don't serve food (I don't know if this changed since I've been there). Great location, so you can grab a pizza from nearby late at night, and there's a tesco express next to it.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "thisnightsrevels", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "Wonderful comfortable clean pub, music is pleasant but not too loud and it's in a great location", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Richard Ramsay", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Quality drinks, exceptional service, and an unmatched level of friendliness. I cannot recommend The Park enough. Jules and staff made our time in Cork one of the best parts of our visit. I would come back just to drink here.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: South County
address: W Douglas St, Douglas, Cork, T12 CKD6, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Natalie M", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Had a meal here just before heading back to the airport to fly home to England and it didn’t disappoint! Delicious food and authentic Irish atmosphere (even got to hear some live music). Loved it!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sinead M", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Had a meal here with my partner.
Portions were very big.
Food was absolutely beautiful 😍 lovely pub and restaurant. Staff were very friendly and came over a good few times checking was our food OK and more drink orders. Owners was lovely too.
Looking forward to going back again.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Pat O'Mahony", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Had breakfast here as part of a group - fast attentive service and tasty food - had not been in here for decades but it's a nice " nooky" bar with an outside covered area
Everything is well appointed ,staffed ,and managed
One of our very efficient servers was a young  guy with Downs Syndrome which I was delighted to see - Well Done South County", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "sandra kennedy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Have been here for breakfast & night out. The food was very tasty,i had a mini breakfast. I was meeting up with friends & there was no pressure to leave,we were there for 2hrs at least. Staff were really nice.
On a night out in here,it was really busy,the atmosphere was great,really enjoyed my night,no music blaring like a lot of pubs at weekends.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Connor Rea", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Honestly one of the worst experiences I've ever had in a pub, having worked in pubs for nearly 15 years I understand you can get busy but at least acknowledge the customer.

10 mins to even get served, paid for the pint and waited over 10 mins to watch a half poured pint sit there so I left.

I'm sure this establishment is fantastic but on this occasion this wasn't a good experience.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Adrian Bradley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "Booked in to the South County for the first time since re-opening. Online booking system made it simple to secure a table and we were sat outside of course. The beer garden is newly refurbished, it's bright and spacious. The weather was fantastic but they have temporary gazebos covering the area in case you're not so lucky on other days. The food was excellent as always and the pints were every bit as good (very welcome after nearly 6 months without them). My girlfriend had an aperol spritz which was their cocktail special for the day. We were well looked after by the staff who checked in regularly and were very attentive.
Still my favourite pub in Douglas! All the best to the owners and staff with the re-opening. Will definitely be back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Maria Needham", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Unexpectedly great food for a pub. We were very pleased. We ordered crab cakes, fish chowder and battered prawn and chips. Good quality ingredients, generous portions. Enjoyed a pint of Murphys. Would we return? Sure!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Anne Doran", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 years ago", "review_text": "We used to live in the place where they serve food and it was so lovely to get the opportunity to visit with family. The last 19 months have been hard on everyone, but it's great to be finally supporting local family business's. The O'Connors always make us feel at home and their food and atmosphere was amazing. Looking forward to the next visit already", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paddy O'Connell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 9 months ago", "review_text": "Great bar / restaurant in Douglas.
Friendly staff and excellent service.
Plenty of tvs showing sport.
Very much what a great Irish local should be.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "J. Abranches", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Nice food, friendly staff and amazing beer (Murphys and Guinness)", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Guji Coffee Bar
address: 8 Paul St, Centre, Cork, T12 AYP5, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "JOYCE", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "The first sit of coffee is absolutely amazing to me! but the size of the coffee is small and the price is high, but I don't think there is a big problem, because it really tastes good.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Fionn McGinley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Best coffee in Cork easily. Proper barista coffee every time. Choice of roasts and lattes to perfection. Worth the visit for the coffee lover.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Adryelle Montenegro", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Guji Coffee has quickly become one of my favorite spots in town. The coffee is always on point, and their sexy chocolate is absolutely delicious. Recently, they’ve added açaí to the menu, and it’s a delightful surprise! 🇧🇷💚

The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, perfect for a relaxed break. The staff is incredibly friendly and always makes you feel welcome. If you’re looking for a great place to enjoy quality drinks and treats, I highly recommend this place!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nolan Danvers", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "Really nice to have Guji in the city centre now! Quality coffee, really nice people, lots of interesting seasonal drinks and decent cakes. They also hold cool events every now and then, it’s worth signing up to their mailing list!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Klára Tůmová", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Had a cappuccino to go and free babyccino. In both the milch was just right. Not steaming hot(irish standart unfortunately), but the way it supposed to be. After too many bad coffees I had in Ireland this was just like being in heaven. Very kind server as well:)", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Conor Martin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "Guji offers great coffee and more importantly, they offer gluten free pastries and some vegan ones too which are hard to come by in Cork. I would 100% recommend to anyone looking for great coffee and a sweet treat. Staff are also really friendly. 10/10 from me!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ani Barry Lain", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "5,50€ for this capuchino with coconut milk. Is a small size. Not even a large size. If you guys are all millionaires good for you. But this is starting to be a joke like.

You can get a large amazing capuchino with all the syrup you want and coconut/almond milk in Circle K for 3,80€. I can’t get over the actual insanity of prices here.

Edit after reply: We read other comments when filtering with Price and they all complain about the same thing. Regarding of your investment in this business, it IS the highest price in the market. If people do like you all around that area for competition, soon there will come a day we’ll be paying 10€ for a coffee like that. So no, it’s not healthy for the market. Instead of dropping already inflated prices you are inflating even more. That shouldn’t be the norm in the under-paid society we are currently living in.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "grace mcl", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Cool new location for this coffee bar
Slightly expensive but nice coffee and they have lovely details like sugar syrups for your coffee and chocolate straws for your iced mocha

Nice service
Great to see places in local businesses opening and expanding into unused spaces

They offer a large range of milk alternatives
Have an extensive Macha menu
They have sweet treats and açai bowls available
Vegan and Gluten free food items available
High top seating available indoors
They also have coffee bags to purchase for home use", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "f", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "Edited 3 months ago", "review_text": "edit because of owner's reply: you do have €8 matchas actually, the flavoured ones. i paid €4.50 for the exact same in a very similar and close-by place who use FRESH FRUIT in theirs. you can’t compare your matcha to a “mocktail”, you aren’t a bar. also your portions are TINY.

over €8 for a matcha is absolutely extortionate, i’ve read the comments where they try to justify coffee price but there is no justifying the iced matcha price — and it’s not even as nice as the ones i get in similar places in town for way cheaper! the treats used to be nicer as well back when they had croissants, now they’re not as nice", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Caroline O Neill", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely coffee , but for the price plenty other coffee shops that serve good ethical coffee for a lower price .", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Joe's+Bros
address: 22 Gillabbey St, The Lough, Cork, T12 DW29, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Lauren Robinson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Seriously best cafe in cork!!! We only discovered this was around the corner from us and have been here every second day. The Açai bowls 🥰🥰🥰 are incredible. And the sweets so fresh and yum the cookies and cinnamon rolls. We love Neil and this cafe. 1000/10.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Barry Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "A lot of expensive places for breakfast around Cork city. The sausage roll deal here was good
value. More than enough to keep you going for a few hours and any coffee with that for €7.90 (I’m sure)

Claiming the best sausage roll in Cork was the main draw. Well, it was the best I’ve ever had and a fair size too. Not scabby with the sausage filling like many other places.

Highly recommended 👍🏼", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kiera O Sullivan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "100% recommend Joe’s & Bros! My favourites are the breakfast burrito and the Caesar wrap – both are 10/10. The staff are absolutely lovely too!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Thomas Kelly", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Staff are brilliant and friendly, food comes quickly but price nowhere near reflects what you get.

Stopped doing tater tots as a side with the sandwiches which is a big reason we used to come.

Definitely used to be better.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ella Edwards", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Got an acai bowl in joes and bros I was expecting a beautiful meal. The granola was smeared all over the acai u could barely see the acai underneath there was so much granola. The granola tastes like burn with nuts in it. I had strawberry’s on mine and there was only 2 strawberries. It cost 10.50 for it very very overpriced for a product with 2 toppings. Very disappointed wont be visiting again.staff were lovley over all", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "ciaran barry", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "This place used to be a 5 out of 5 for me but things have changed a lot. Not sure if it's a new owner,manager or chef but quality is gone down. Prices have gone up by about 30% but Tots no longer come with your order, the tots are not what they used to be either. What used to be the best steak sandwich in Cork was removed from the menu (who's bright idea was that) and it's basically 14 euro for a fancy ham and cheese toasty now and the other new sandwiches are basic are overpriced. Staff are still nice and coffee is good though. Disappointing to see it fall off so much though, used to go out of our way to call in when in Cork but will be avoiding it going forward. Much better value for Money around the place nowadays.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Amore Italiano - EATin'IT Ristorante Pizzeria", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Quick service, delicious treats!
Fast and friendly service. The brownie was excellent, and the Nutella and Oreo pancake was absolutely delicious. Highly recommended!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michelle Fernandes", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Stumbled upon this place while walking around the city looking for a place that served brunch. The menu is very comprehensive and loads of options to choose from. The staff are very pleasant and attentive. I walked in on a Saturday a little before brunch and it started getting very busy. I will definitely go back!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Bethany Sirmans", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Staff are lovely and welcoming. Highly recommend Joe's Cookie. As soon as i got it I received looks from other customers and enquiries about what it was and that it looks great😂", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Louise Langton", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "Fantastic service. Great vegan options. Gorgeous coffee. Had the salt of the earth toastie with tots, absolutely delicious. Set in a charming arcade with lots of seating. Highly recommend 😃 staff are sound.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: O'Sho
address: 13 Barrack St, Cork, T12 Y720, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Luke Ratterman", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Epic little spot. They had this Irish trad band playing that was made up of Irish, American from Kentucky (bluegrass upbringing which was from Irish settlers in America amyway), and Spanish Gaelic from the south of Spain that also has ties to Gaelic music origin. Great selection of beers and nice staff.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Daniel Davis", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "I first ordered food at Miyazaki across the road, and sat in O'Sho to wait and also eat it there.

Bar staff, cleanliness, and facilities provided were great. It's also a great place to have a few pints without eating also.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Robbie", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Never have I been to a pub whose owner was warmer to his patrons than here.

Had a couple pints and then see that he’s ordered a big spread of food from a local restaurant for everyone to snack on, no strings attached. So lovely.

The beamish is great here too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Martin Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Was great traditional music here on the Wednesday night that our crew turned up here, had not been in this premises since before Con 19.  Great pint here,  Cork house through and through,  not a drop of foreign beer or stout on tap here. More power to O'Sho.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Erin Griffin (Ahimsa Wellness)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Cute as button with the warmest welcome from publican Pat! Or was it Paddy  … either way so lovely to see him talk to all the passers-by by name, which gave a real sense of genuine hospitality which is often lacking at the bigger watering holes. Cosy and a bit quirky, this place is definitely worth a visit!", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Šimon Végh", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "GET FOOD FROM MYAZAKI. This bar was great - amazing live musi and great beer. You can get japanese food from the restaurant across the street.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Iyedr", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "What a pleasant surprise. Popped in one late afternoon catching some live music, had a few pints playing board games and then enjoyed an unexpectedly excellent ambient and soft techno dj set. Cool", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Thomas Thornton", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 3 years ago", "review_text": "O'Sho's Pub is a lovely quaint pub just at the start of Barrack Street. The interior is clean and spacious. The staff are friendly and ready to make you your favourite cocktail.
Ordering at the bar was no problem even when the crowd picked up for a bit.
There is good music playing playing in the background and they offer a variety of beers, stouts along with gins, wines and cocktails!
We tried a few of their cocktails on our second visit to O'Shoes and they were fantastic!
I will definitely be back for a few drinks with friends.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mads Nielsen", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Great vibe, music was a bit loud.

They have no food in there but you can buy great Japanese food from right around the corner and bring it in.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Doroteja Bogdanovic", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "It's a really funky place with lovely drinks and tea! We got food from Miyazaki across the way and brought it in with us while we had our drinks. It was great!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Nando's Cork - Mahon Point
address: Mahon Point Shopping Centre, R852, Mahon, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Jaee Sakhalkar", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Nandos never disappoints us!

We love the food quality and taste. It perfectly matches our tastebuds. I love their hot and medium sauce. The pita breads are always so soft and delicious. Their chicken wings are always to the point

Also, the new found addition to our order id the crispy corn.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Bee", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Needed a G converter so we stopped at the mall. We were not disappointed to see this place for lunch. I highly advise against ordering on line. Just a scam to get your email.  They will let you order at counter after they seat you with menus. We ordered chicken thighs stuffed pita,(medium ), slaw,fries and peri-mac& cheese. Every thing was delicious.  I normally don't order Mac n cheese but was not disappointed.  I think if they created a Mac n cheese with chicken thighs on top it would be amazing. The place was super clean . the staff kept busy and very helpful.  It was noon on a Thursday.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michelle Robbins", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "Went here for our daughters birthday lunch and it was lovely👌 very welcoming & friendly staff. The service was quick & fresh! Everything was true to it's taste and up to Nando's standards. Will surely go there again😊", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Indhira Mohan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Friendly staff, carefully explained us the menu. Drinks were dropped off right after we ordered. Food was ready in 5 minutes. Really happy with the taste.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "kieran Kenneally", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "First time here, just not for me.
Dining out should be an enjoyable experience with good service being part of that experience.
When you have to go the counter to order, get your own cutlery, get your own drinks... what's the point? I do all that at home!
Menu is very limited for me. Look, its essentially just chicken!
I also feel bad for the staff, customers ordering and paying online or when they go to the counter and order must have a terrible affect on tipping. I mean, how can you judge how much to tip your server when that server hasn't served you because of the systems the restaurant has in place (essentially self service).
On the actual food, my wife's was nice but then it was just loaded chips and it's hard to mess that up.
My food was just OK but my daughter had a quarter chicken dish with chips and rice and I can honestly say I've seen more chicken on a wing than what she got. She told me she was sorry she didn't order wings!
Never again for me, I need better choices, actual service and a better overall experience.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Praveeni Kaluarachchi", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "Edited 10 months ago", "review_text": "Update 1st December 2024
Thankfully they have improved their ordering method and if you would like you can order at the till to avoid their scan and order method.
Unfortunately I was disappointed with my order today. I ordered a spicy rice bowl with two chicken thighs and I was served spicy rice bowl with a flavourless chicken breast.

At very first day (somewhere in July) their food was nice, but later we felt that they are not as ,good as it was. Their online ordering system is a hassle. Nandos free WiFi is very slow and it takes more than 20mins to place an order or impossible to place an order via their online system.  We get to starve before we get our food everytime we visit there. So, we try to avoid this place now.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "主常莹", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Everything was overall great! Very tasty and well cooked. Most of the beverages were bottomless and you can choose among different sauces. You have to set up your table.
And here the only “bad” thing: I ordered a can of iced tea, which I didn’t like but it’s my personal taste, because I wanted still water but there wasn’t on the online menù. I discovered too late it was free and infinitely refillable.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Chloe Ogweng", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "I don't know what it is about this particular Nando's branch, but they literally attract the BEST staff? As in, compared to all the dining establishments I've been to EVER, the staff here are seriously some of the best. It's mind-blowing. And I would have visited here, four times over nearly two years? All different staff members, all of them ranging from very pleasant to 11/10. This time, Nadia was the standout. I can't really remember the last time I experienced such amazing customer service at a restaurant, so absolutely kudos to you, girl!

Staff aside (like they aren't reason enough to visit) this Nando's tends not to be that busy, AND they tend to be stocked with everything, which can be a real problem at some branches. Everything came out quickly, it was hot and it's Nando's so like, what's to complain about?

The location is fab too, perfect for grabbing a meal before or after a film, especially if it's one of the slightly later ones as most days, they're open until 10. The loos are always clean, and they've even gotten rid of the QR codes, which is great because they never worked for me. So now, you can just order off the menu directly at the till! It really is the little things.

5 stars!", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Hazel O'Neill", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely staff. Very welcoming. Went there last monday. Brilliant staff. Person wearing red has smiles for everyone coming in and out. Kids friendly place too. Good food as usual.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Binta Onifade", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Amazing staff and welcoming atmosphere. We went to celebrate my son’s birthday and the staff could not have done more for us. They were amazing and paid attention to our needs. Thank you all for your service. And of course the food we ordered was very delicious and tasty and it arrived to our table on time", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Cafe Gusto Lapps Quay
address: City Quarter, Lapp's Quay, Centre, Cork, T12 WY42, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "A Zahid", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Its a great place and wonderful coffee", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mr Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Great little spot to stop and have a snack and tea or coffee. Friendly staff great service and fabulous views. Our group enjoyed it immensely. Recommend this little cafe. Thanks guys.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jim Ryan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "It was a drizzly rainy day, therefore no outside seating. It's a tiny little place but there is seating for probably 6 or 8 people. We had. Our breakfast sandwich was scrambled eggs on toast and some cappuccino and tea. Very nice and cozy.\nThe staff was very friendly and took good care of us.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Laura Petrie", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Friendly service, with some great local recommendations. Food was delicious and a great view over the river. I would definitely recommend for breakfast and a coffee.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Wiveka O'Sullivan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "You can't fault Gusto and the 2 lads running it. There is always a Happy welcome going in there and a bit of a banter. Marco and Dave you are the most  friendly baristas that I ever come across over the last 6y in any country, this cafe is a hidden gem in Cork during business hours. Thank you both for being our friends ❤️", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tj Jones", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Had a cake and scones and they were tasty. Wanted something hot but they only had porridge despite advertising breakfast sandwiches. Asked for a plain croissant but they weren’t ready", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Syiffa Rosman", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "It is hard to find a perfect iced coffee in Cork but Cafe Gusto make a perfect iced coffee (Mocha)!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ching Wen Ning", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "One of the few high quality coffee places that opens at 7 am, good cup of flat white, a bit more on the nutty smokey darker flavoured coffee.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Grahame Durcan", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "Beautiful little coffee pod, great sandwiches and friendly service, but a little tight on space - could use a few more wet weather tables! Great when the weather is good though!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "bryan conlon", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Gorgeous location and lovely coffee . All seating now outdoors, but on a sunny day, couldn't be nicer. Staff very friendly and professional, Marco (I think is his name) is a credit to the cafe", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Coughlans Bar
address: 7 Douglas St, Ballintemple, Cork, T12 DX39, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Crystal B", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "I’ve been touring the country and we had an overnight stay in Cork. We found the tourist spots but wanted a more local experience. This pub didn’t disappoint! The bartenders were friendly and engaging, the locals were outgoing, interested in our story and provided insight to other areas for our travels. Padraig was funny and easy on the eyes! Wish we had planned more time in Cork. Will definitely be back, for the west side.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Adrian Cronin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "A traditional pub in Cork city that also has a large music venue showcasing some regional talent from Ireland. It is well worth a visit if you're in town. They have their own range of ales and lagers which are extremely tasty and add to the whole experience.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tanja MacMahon", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Amazing pub, great atmosphere for St. Patrick's day. 🍀. There was a girl at the small bar at the back room. She was amazing. Quick on her feet. Knew what everyone was drinking. It was packed and she sailed through like a breeze. ❤️🍻 …", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Holger Haase", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "The pubs in Douglas Street are often way more fun than a lot of the places just further down the road in the actual city centre and Coughlans is no different. Very chill place with a beer garden and a regular lineup of gigs on a stage in a separate room. So good to just come in and enjoy a few bevvies or to listen to a wide range of musical talent.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Milan G", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Very inspiring place, full of youth and good energy...live music, nice beer garden...", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paddy O'Connell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Great bar on the edge of the city centre.\nAlso has a live music venue and a beer garden in the back.\nGreat Guinness.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Valentina Rajkumari", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "The ambience of the place is amazing. Enjoyed the live music as well! Must visit place in Cork!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Helen mullane", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "A lovely quaint old style pub, lovely staff,we went to see our Sons band,Blind Poets,room where they played was packed when we went in but an intimate gig,as they say,so Warm though we had to open a door we sat near cos fan on ceiling mustn't have been working,cos  I asked for it to be put on!!!! But overall we had a great time, really enjoyed the music,will definitely go back, but make sure to get into venue room earlier to get a good seat 🎸🎤🎶🎵🎻💜", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sean O'Sullivan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "I was there with my son for an event and it was fantastically organised. Loads of space as well. Lovely staff.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Luca “TheAppleCruncher” Kavanagh", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Love the gaf but they didn't have bitters after I spent 7.50 on a ginger beer :(", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: KC & Son & Sons
address: E Douglas St, Douglas, Cork, T12 YP27, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Clodagh Walls", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Got the Transylvania Burger and it was lovely. Kind of like a garlic bread burger and quite oily from the garlic butter but I was fine with that since I ate it at home but have lots of napkins if not at home. I put some of the basil-parmesan mayo that I got with my Chip Butty on it and it worked very nicely as well. Chip Butty was lovely as well with the sauce and some salt. Battered sausage was pretty good as well. Queue was long but moved pretty fast.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "jay", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "I hate to love this place. There’s honestly no other takeaway that comes even close to the quality of food this place produces. The curry chips are without a doubt the best in Ireland. The cheeseburger is the best I’ve ever tasted with the most amazing grilled onions. The chicken burgers are out of this world. The milkshakes are unbelievable. I’m happy I live over 40 mins away because if not, I’d be 20 stone heavier 😂", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tom Boyle", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Visited this place today as have not been for ages and I was very disappointed. Had no fish to serve firstly which I was visible shocked. The chips were atrocious and the chicken was dry , tough and like leather .
Horrendous!!! Such a shame as this once amazing...
Definitely will not be back", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "PR7", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Very famous family run restaurant which was prevented from closing due to the crowd’s demand is a must try outlet. You need loads of patience to get your food, huge queue and there is waiting period almost every time I’ve visited here.
Chicken Bombay is fantastic and the KC special chicken burger is a delight.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Alan Morrissey", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "I've waited months to try KC's food and was really excited for it I finally tried it tonight and I was really disappointed i would nearly go as far as saying it was horrible the angry Spaniard Pitta it was really dry tasteless and the chicken was dry and rubbery. The chips Cheese and curry were tasteless I don't know what the hype was about it's definitely not worth it and I will definitely not be returning again.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Kasia Gasior", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Very Disappointed – Philly Steak Pita Quality Is Now Horrible

I’ve been ordering from Casey’s for around 10 years and always enjoyed the Philly Steak pita. I used to get it fairly often over the years, and it was always great.

I hadn’t ordered anything for about a year, but in the last two months I started visiting Casey’s again. I ordered the Philly Steak pita three times — and each time, the quality of the beef was really bad. Yesterday’s order was the worst.

The beef was cheap, full of fatty bits, no taste, tough to chew — just horrible. It’s definitely not the same as it used to be. I don’t know what happened, but the quality has gone way down, and I’m really disappointed. My son did get a pita recently, I think with curry sauce, and he really enjoyed it — so not everything is bad. But the Philly Steak pita definitely needs attention. I hope the quality improves, because it used to be one of the best.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "mese demet", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "4 weeks ago", "review_text": "The real address of a proper burger! A place where the traditional taste never changes. Once again, a wonderful meal.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "G Ryan", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "Great place and atmosphere, food is over hyped, got a new burger on the menu that had a mozzarella slab, chili jam and the normal LT, added a beef patty, turns out they had no chili jam so they laced what I think was mango chutney on it, also got no beef patty, other than that it was an average burger. Also got The squealer loaded fries, they were actually quite nice, very heavy portion of pulled pork which was unreal, nice size gherkins but half the tub was mayo which made all the chips soggy in like 15 mins it took to get all the food and back to the car but very big portions which was handy.
My fella got the chips cheese garlic, barely any cheese and loaded with mayo and a double burger thing but ended up giving me one of his patties cause they didnt give me one", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Karina Alves", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "It's a very affordable and quick option for a meal. I ordered a Smokin' Hot Cheesesteak, and it had a pleasant level of spice; it was delicious.  The restaurant doesn't offer seating, but it's convenient to eat at the nearby mall food court if you're exploring the area.
The biscoff milkshake is delicious, too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Thomas Thornton", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "KC & Son & Sons is a Cork staple! It is definitely worth the drive to Douglas to go stand in the queue down the street from their door way! Their pittas are really worth it!

Staff:
The staff are very friendly here. They are also very attentive and get the order right everytime no matter how big your order is.

Food:
They have so many choices to choose from here with their Pittas being the main items that they are known for!
Some of their best pittas in my own opinion are the King Creole (Chicken), the Philly Steak (Beef) and my personal favourites the Angry Spaniard (Chicken & Chorizo) and the Kansas City Pitta (Pork).
The Angry Spaniard is a hot Pitta filled Chips, Mayo, Lettuce and topped off with Chorizo, Chicken and hot sauce!
Then the Kansas City Pitta is a hot Pitta filled with Chips, Mayo, Lettuce, sliced gherkin and topped off with slow roasted pork belly that is rubbed with their own blend of spices and coated in a homemade BBQ sauce!
Whats not to love!
They also serve really tasty burgers and they have the world of side options. These range from chips to Pineapple Fritters to their famous Chicken Bombays.
They have these huge bags too if you order a lot of food or if you need to carry your option in one bag. Handy to bring it on a picnic.

Queue:
Don't be phased by the queue here as sometimes it could be 10 people long and just inside the premises or 30 people deep outsode of the premises!
It does move fast and you won't be waiting any longer than 30 minutes to get inside to make your order.

Layout:
The new layout is much more efficient and it goes as follows: You walk up one side of the queuing area inside the premesis and at the top of this side you place your order, then turn at the top and you walk back down the other side towards the doorway and they will have your order prepaired and ready for collection juat as you go out the door!

Overall Recommendation:
I highly recommend calling to KC & Son & Sons as its a Cork staple! I always find myself here every couple of weeks and I nearly always find myself going for something different to what I ordered last time!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Tequila Jack's Mexican Restaurant & Tequila Bar
address: City Quarter, Lapp's Quay, Centre, Cork, T12 KCW0, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Amy McCarthy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 days ago", "review_text": "Yesterday evening I had the pleasure of dining in the dome at Tequila Jack’s. From the minute I made contact to book the dome for dinner and drinks, I knew I would have an amazing experience. The food was delicious, there was a large array of cocktails to choose from.
