Each item that was put on front of me was presented with such care and attention to detail. The staff gave us lots of attention and made sure we had everything we needed. The dome itself provided privacy and comfort. The staff ensured that the lighting and heating was to our satisfaction also. The views of the city hall and surrounding area through the dome was beautiful. Seeing the colourful lights of the city hall, bridge and buildings added to the atmosphere created by Tequila Jack’s staff. I will most definitely be back! I’m only so sorry it took me so long to get there in the first place. Thank you for such a lovely experience.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Donna Heaphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Absolutely loved my birthday meal here. Staff were so accommodating and our food was with us in no time. The cocktails are second to none. The whole decor and everything about Tequila Jacks is so inviting. What a vibe", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Rachel Bretz", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Had a great experience. Walked in off the street on a Friday night around 7pm and they had a table available. Staff was super nice and attentive. Food was quick to arrive and was very flavorful. Had the crab tortilla appetizer, which was yummy.The meat in my quesadilla was tender, and my husband‘s chicken fajitas were very good too. Thanks from Arizona, USA tourists.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Emma Cotter", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "It was my first time at Tequila Jack's and certainly won't be the last. Great restaurant/ bar. From its beautiful interior & exterior design, lovely atmosphere, the selection of food and  drinks just amazing. Great spot for any social gathering. Look forward to visiting again soon 🙂", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "sanaz mousa", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Extremely disappointing experience.
We had booked a table in advance hoping for faster service, but despite arriving 10 minutes early, we waited over 40 minutes for our food.

I ordered a steak, which was absolutely terrible, easily the worst I’ve ever had. I asked for medium rare and got an overcooked, chewy, old piece of meat that was completely misdescribed. It wasn’t even the right cut to be called a steak. One bite and I genuinely felt like vomiting.

To top it off, we asked for two Coke Zeros during the meal. They never arrived until after we finished eating, only when a waiter came to check in, and we reminded him, he started writing so it seems the other waiter didn’t even take the order. No apology, no urgency, nothing.

On top of all, so overpriced, we paid 90€ for a fake steak (not) and a fajita chicken with guacamole starter. I’m so so angry 😤 I paid this much for the worst food and service.

I’m leaving this place hungry, frustrated, and disgusted. Not only would I never come back, I genuinely wish we never came at all.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Dave Wiebe", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "A little different take on Mexican food. Really enjoyed the pitcher of Margarita. Very refreshing after a long day of walking.  Would recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "siobhán Clancy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 days ago", "review_text": "As a member of Cork Dragons, I go to Tequila Jacks weekly because they very kindly allow our members to access their function room as a changing space. I've been longing to taste the delicious flavours I can smell on these nights and my visit in a group of 16 friends did not disappoint. Delicious and welcoming. They even offer a gorgeous cocktail on their menu, the proceeds of which go to our club. Good people. Great atmoaphere. Highly recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "A J (Lexi)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Beamish! Fun place. Lots of Latino music and dancing! It was right by our hotel and was nice to see. Very loud but they closed like 1am so it wasn't an issue.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Darach McEoin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Service was faultless, 2 staff members were dealt with some of the best I've come across in years. Wings are 10/10.

Fully recommended", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Seongkoo Lee", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Casual place to hang out. Plenty of rooms for big groups. The cocktails are fun. The food wasn’t something that stand out too much but the atmosphere and spacious place makes up for it.

Great spot to meet up and start the night.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Castle Blackrock - Neighbourhood Restaurant
address: Blackrock Castle, Castle Rd, Blackrock, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Sarah Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 days ago", "review_text": "Lovely spot. Food is excellent, really recommend the cauliflower bravas.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Han-Ying Hu Alexander", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "We had the Turkish plate, eggs Benedict, and a scone, all super delicious. I brought my fiancé here for her birthday. Honestly, the nicest food I’ve had all year. Both dinners and desserts were an experience.
Not only that but the staff were incredibly friendly and a really relaxed atmosphere, you can tell they put a lot of thought into the surroundings. 10/10, I can’t wait to come back for my birthday.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Natalie Wall", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Great staff, cute building, delicious food. 10/10 would go back. Also the ice was great", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eric Baker", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "A delightful evening. We booked, luckily (they levy a charge for late no shows). Easy parking and as we arrived my wife found two other diners who shared her birthday. The staff were lovely, the atmosphere buzzy and the food really interesting. We had lamb, hake and bacon collar.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paul TWOMEY", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Very happy with the place, food was great, really filling service was good. Nice atmosphere and located in a good spot if going for a walk afterwards", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "OFWpreneurs TV", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "One of the Best Cafe we have tried. The atmosphere is soo relaxing. There are outside tables available, an indoor area overlooking the castle and there is another indoor area which i think is suitable for an intimate date and group coffee date. Kidding aside, the food is delicious 5/5, the coffee is definitely one of the best and the staff is soo approachable and lovely. They really prioritize the satisfaction of there customers. Highly recommended Cafe in Cork. They also have coloring materials for kids so they will be entertain and not to get bored👍🏻", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Binta Onifade", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "The food wasn’t the best but like my friend said, it’s a meal with the view. The castle is beautiful", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Thomas Philpott", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "This restaurant is beautiful with exceptional staff. The whole customer experience from beginning to end was amazing. I initially rang up as my sister is coeliac and the man emailed the separate menu to me straight away. When I went inside I was waiting for 2 other people. The waiter noticed I had birthday presents for my sister and took note of her name to sing happy birthday. Food was very nice and very reasonably priced. I would highly recommend if you are looking for somewhere special or just casual lunch.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "ARIGA", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "The food was really good.
The staff very friendly.
The atmosphere is also nice.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

reviews_data:
[{"username": "Sarah O’Reilly", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Fantastic, quaint little pub in the city centre. Used to be a dockers early house.
€5.60 for Guinness.
Friendly place and you'll always strike up a conversation with someone.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Claudia Hernández", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Nice pub, friendly staff. The seats by the river are great during summer evenings", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "theresa doherty", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "The best staff I’ve ever encountered, we came here after Christy Moore’s gig and they were the most observant staff I have ever seen. We came into difficulty with three lads and the staff not only removed these guys but also made us feel safe enough to continue to sit outside and enjoy our drinks. They were so friendly and just the fact they had enough care to recognise our discomfort and make us feel so welcomed for the evening. I never got their name’s to give them their own personal shoutout but I hope they know how great they were !! I’ve managed a bar myself for four years and I have to say I’ve never experienced this much care and personal respect from other bar staff before ever. Amazing", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Alan Sommerville", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Quaint little Bar....nothing flash but very inviting
My first experience at a truly Irish pub", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Hater", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Came for a lads night, Charlie's bar was a vibe. It would keep me full when I was working", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Odhran Hunt", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Food is always top quality. Great variety of options and have never had a bad experience.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Tanya Dobbyn", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "My favourite burritos!! Great variety of ingredients. Good prices. Delivery is fast too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Emma Healy", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Got a takeaway burrito which was cold, even though I ate it 5 minutes later. Small portion and they upcharge for almost any extras like meat, guacamole,  pickled onions, etc. I guess if you ordered a veggie burrito with no add-ons it would be somewhat reasonable in price but it quickly goes up even to just get meat. Besides the poor value, small portion and cold temperature,  it was genuinely one of  the most flavourless meals I've ever had. Disappointing, as they used to be fairly ok.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Chloe", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Staff are nice but the food is absolutely shocking. Definitely the worst boojum I have ever been to. Freezing cold, inedible, I threw it away because I felt sick eating it. Expensive mistake going here. It also took absolutely ages and the staff were in a bit of a faff because they were working on deliveroo orders. Only issue is they seem to be always out of some ingredients and in some cases I was charged for items they did not include in the meal.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Miguel Martinez", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Good music, nice staff, decent food.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sowjanya B", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "I ordered 2 portion of bowl in uber eats. But the quantity is very less not even sufficient for one person. Had to make something else to eat after ordering food from them. Please don’t order online.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}]

name: Good for the Soul
address: 12, Tus Abhaile, Time Square, Ballincollig, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "BRINIS Ghassen", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "We thought we had found our new favorite spot. The coffee was amazing, the atmosphere was warm, and we were genuinely made to feel welcome. We were even guided to a table we loved.

That's why it was so jarring when, just 15 minutes after sitting down,with our drinks in hand for only 10,the manager informed us that our table is booked in 10 minutes😅. In Ireland, it's well understood that ordering grants you the right to your seat to enjoy your purchase. They knew this, yet they chose to ask us to leave indirectly.

We absolutely loved the place, but we won't be returning. The feeling of disrespect is just too strong.

A simple request: just be transparent. If a table has a time limit, tell us before we order and fall in love with the experience. Don't let customers get comfortable only to usher them out the door.

Honesty benefits everyone.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Patrick Olden", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Really nice cafe located in central Ballincollig, staff were super accommodating, as we had received a table outside but once a table was free inside they allowed us to move inside. Coffee was amazing and the food was just as good", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Karina Torres", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Lovely service and foods amazing 🥰  overall great vibes, hidden gem✨", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Edward O’ Hourihan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Where do I start with Body & Soul Ballincollig. Staff are very friendly and bubbly. The establishment gives off an almost hippy vibe which i absolutely adore! The food is very unique and packed full of flavour. The coffee is fantastic. To top it all off, if you are ever sitting down and realise you need to grab a card for your nephews communion, they are all within an arms reach. God bless body & Soul.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Blake Norton", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "The food is fantastic. Great intention, artistry, balance. Top class.

The staff is very nice, but they were increasingly stressed due to the influx of customers, which made the whole (small) restaurant feel stressed as our meal went on. I'm not blaming them, but it definitely impacted our experience. As we were eating, there was a queue forming by us of people coming in the front door. And we're on a small two-person table that genuinely feels like it's going to get knocked over by the throng of people. The location isn't built / designed for both people sitting down, at least how it's laid out, and a large queue.

We were looking around to pay for a few minutes near the end of the meal and all the staff seemed preoccupied, so I asked the gentleman who had served us if I should pay at the counter, and he said yes. So I queued behind people coming in for takeaway coffees for a few minutes after the service had been to the table up to that point. I found this kind of messy, to be queuing twice for the same meal.

The kicker as to why we're unfortunately not enthusiastic to go back, a lady came in with a dog under her arm whose butt was looming-cum-hovering over my wife's food. This seems to be okay with the management, as she was seated and all, but the mix of flying dog and artisan eggs is not a good breakfast vibe.

Amazing food, real nice staff, but too stressy and weirdly laid out to be a relaxing experience for us. My wife didn't finish the end of her food after the dog arrived, which makes the wonderful quality of the food more of a taunt than a benefit in that moment. Ha.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Steve O'Rourke", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "Edited a month ago", "review_text": "Disappointing Experience at “Good for the Soul”

I had high hopes for this place given the name, but sadly, the experience was anything but comforting. One of the most frustrating aspects was the complete lack of flexibility with the menu—when I asked to make a simple adjustment to a dish, I was told it wasn’t possible, without any real explanation or effort to accommodate.

Service was another major letdown. My coffee arrived 25 minutes before my food, which meant I had to drink it lukewarm or wait and enjoy it cold. Either way, not ideal. To make things worse, the general service attitude felt inattentive and inconsistent.

There was a young woman with red hair working behind the till who was noticeably friendly and loud with regulars, laughing and chatting openly. But when it came to new customers like myself, she made no effort to be welcoming or even polite—just a quick, impersonal transaction that felt borderline dismissive.

All in all, the vibe was cliquey and the service lacked basic hospitality. I won’t be returning, and I wouldn’t recommend it unless you’re already part of the inner circle.

This review is up over a week and still no reply or enquiry from the management team at good for the soul tells me all i need to know about the type of business you are conducting.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Tyrone Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "This is a hidden gem! Such a friendly and welcoming space. It’s great spot always busy and bustling with people. This place food is second to none. I would highly recommend the firy Benedict absolutely amazing.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Helen L", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "A rare gem where the food is packed with flavour, service is fast, staff are warm and friendly and the pricepoint is great value for money.

Definitely a lovely spot for some relaxed brunch or lunch.

Thank you, folks! 🙏", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Reviewer-Elisabeth", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "I had the French toast with maple and bacon, the bacon was extremely crispy which is each to their own I personally don't like extremely crispy bacon. It was fab. They were out of stock of the smoothies when I went which I wanted to try it was sold out so I presuming it most be good. The orange juice was nice.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nadia Jones", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Gorgeous cafe, gorgeous coffee, gorgeous food and the best carrot cake in Ireland ❤️", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Da Mirco Osteria Italian Restaurant
address: 4 Bridge St, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 H10E, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "shalu kumaravel", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Lovely italian restaurant in Cork city(michelin guide). I booked tasting experience(min 2 people required). It was scrumptious! Very different from what i ususally get. I had dietary restrictions- they were very good & accomodating. Seatings are quite close-only drawback. Do reserve as it’s booked out mostly. St Patrick’s quay car park(paid) is so close to this place", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Christopher Thwaites", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Best italian in Cork!
Always consistently great italian food and wine. Mirco and his Team deliver excellency every time I visit. The menu changes regularly which makes it a great place to visit often. So if you‘re looking for great italian food for a good price and amazing wine pairings - Da Mirco Osteria is the place to be!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Bill Connell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "We were in Italy for 5 weeks this spring and had very very good food.  But nothing compared to the taste of the food here!  I was Shocked how tasty it was.  Even the said we had was over the top.  It’s a very small place so get Reservations!  There isn’t an a la carte menu here.  So understand that.  You will not be disappointed with the food.  The only thing I missed was the main pasta dish didn’t come with bread to sop up the delicious sauce!  But bread did come with the salad and it was something special.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Silvia Canevelli", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Very nice italian service. Not a bright menu but they serve big protions.
Love the focaccia and the drinks.
It’s a tiny nice place!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Reviewer-Elisabeth", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 days ago", "review_text": "The food was fantastic. I had the wine and tasting menu it was delicious the pasta is to die for it was so good and after doing the wine tasting I realised I loved orange wine which is something I never tried. I tried new foods like duck liver and polenta and I was worried when I first tried it but it was so good. The pasta sauce  oh my god I want a jar of it.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "carolina martinelli gadotti", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Best TIRAMISU in Ireland! (Didn’t have time to take a picture hahah)
As Starter we got the charcuterie board and Halibut salad which was delicious and it is now my favourite salad in cork.
I got the pasta w/ zucchini and mint, and it was a great surprise. Success.
The other dessert, Pain Perdu, w a sorbet was delicious.
Can’t wait to be back.
Troppo bono.
Grazie.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sophie Buckley", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Loved Da Mirco, went for a special occasion and it was the perfect spot!
It was €39 p.p. for our starter and main, I got grilled squid to start, and couldn't resist trying the lasagne for my main course - both were outstanding!
Great ambience and very attentive staff, looking forward to a future visit already!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Isabel Bourke", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Me and my boyfriend booked into Da Mirco for his birthday and couldn’t have had a better experience!

We rang ahead to ask about vegan options and they said they would be able to make something vegan if we mentioned it in the notes of our online booking 🌱

The service was amazing, checking in just the right amount. They made me a vegan starter of foccaccia with pickled and roast veg on top - delicious! Vegan main they offered a few pasta dishes or risotto, I went for mint pesto pasta with crispy fried courgette on top. They also have vegan lemon sorbet for dessert. 🤩", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Craig Villamor", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "Edited a year ago", "review_text": "Great spot for authentic Italian cuisine. Service is exceptional. We had a couple specials - octopus starter and halibut main - both excellent. Also the lamb pasta was delicious. The real standout for us was the dessert, a flourless chocolate cake with almond and caramel. Has to be one of the best desserts I’ve ever had.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Hannah Willcox", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Stellar service. Spectacular little spot. Small, friendly, attentive. Delicious food. Very tasty. Seafood special yummy. Very small mussels and langoustines. but great fun if you like that. All round fabulous!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Crane Lane Theatre
address: Phoenix St, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Sara Byrne Byrne", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Cool venue, solid music.
But there’s something theatrical behind the bar, like everyone’s playing a part.
Great place if you enjoy performances with your pint.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "aaron cowming", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "The best venue in cork, cool vibe, plenty of live music, latino nights, cabaret the works. Great crowd, never any trouble or issues. Bar crew are the best. Food is sensational. The only place in cork i frequent every week.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Dee Forde", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "One of our friends, the only black member of our group, wasn't allowed in because she was 'too drunk'. She wasn't.. it was 9pm and we had just come from dinner. When I noticed she wasn't with us, I went to find her (she had been trying to call us but we didn't hear our phones) and she told me the bouncer wouldn't let her in to tell us. She was apparently too drunk to enter the pub but not to isolate from her friends. When I looked over at the bouncer, he had a smirk on his face.. and we knew he would have loved the opportunity to escalate it if we argued. All five of us (women in our 30s and 40s) have worked in pubs over the years and we know this type of dude... The type who enjoys his job because he gets to exercise power and discriminate. I got my friends and we left.
I'm from Cork and my friends were visiting with me. I'm so embarrassed they experienced this in my city, and my friend, so used to experiencing racism her whole life, was subjected to it in Cork.
I've read the other reviews and this appears to be an issue that no one is addressing at these venues.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Happy Penguin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Great spot, door staff friendly. Band comes on at 12 and they were REALLY GOOD.  ‘Two time Polka’ have a DJ in one section, live music out back. Really good experience after a gig in the marquee.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Deanna", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Was walking in but a bouncer who was smoking not even at the door called after me and my boyfriend. He then pointed to all of me and said I wasn’t dressed well enough. The establishment itself seemed pretty empty as well. Wouldn’t waste my time here!", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Alice Leonard", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "This was a nice enough place which has a big outdoor area if that is what you want. We didn’t as it was cold but they had enough chairs inside and it is one of the only places round that was open late enough after the pubs were closing you wanted a couple more drinks. We went here a couple of times once was really not busy at all but may have been earlier in the evening and then one was very busy and honestly bit nicer as you could enjoy the atmosphere. Overall if your looking for somewhere to carry on after the pubs have all closed at 11 then it’s grand", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Andy Daly", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Threw out for having a casual fag on my own in the smoking areas , told to step outside , I explained that my girlfriend was inside , caused no hassle, stepped outside and rang the girlfriend to tell her , she came and pleaded with them, I was told to remain outside ……. Was later told that they like to remove all men so they have all the women inside , no man is welcome to my woman, have manners and tell me this is the protocol in the club, she will remove herself then , we also had €30 of drink left in drank so I dunno, security letting this place down because they think they can women , it takes work, not just getting the. Drunk and vulnerable and", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Paul Wills", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Normally like this place, but received a drink that tasted off/suspicious and one of the barmen (bald, middle aged) refused to exchange it, and told me to go to a different bar. A different barman exchanged it immediately.

Gave the impression that patron safety wasn’t a priority.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Tanya Guerin", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "I live overseas and hadn’t been to The Crane in about 20 years. Out of nostalgia, I wanted to go back.

We got cocktails upstairs, each with a jaw-dropping price tag of €14! After wiping away my tears and having a lengthy discussion with the bartender about our preferences, we agreed on two drinks. Mine was delicious. My sister’s, however, wasn’t to her liking and didn’t match what she had described to the bartender.

Given the high price, we expected there might be an option to have the drink replaced. Absolutely not—we were told it’s the bar’s policy to never replace a drink. For prices that steep, this policy is ridiculous. If a venue is going to charge premium prices, there should be gold-standard guarantees that the final product aligns with the customer’s expectations. In this case, it didn’t—and unfortunately, the staff couldn’t do anything to help. In fact, I overheard the bartender say that replacing a drink could jeopardize their job, which is really sad.

If you're looking for a cool place to enjoy amazing cocktails, avoid this one. There are far nicer places in Cork that serve better drinks and actually appreciate their customers.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Karel Beyen", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Errrrr this was a theatre? Went here for later night drinks on a Tuesday, people at the bar were really chill, those I met were super cool, and one of the few places open late (after 12:30). Good times!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Pantry
address: Unit A, Merchants Quay Shopping Centre, 1-5 St Patrick's St, Centre, Cork, T12 X031, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Captain Figgy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Really nice food. Veggie breakfast was a big hit. Lovely iced coffee and the Caesar wrap was great. Apple crumble pancakes had no sauce so they were a tad dry but still good. Good soup and toastie.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Andrea Begović", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "I had an amazing meal! The sandwich was perfectly toasted with a cheesy, savory filling. The salad added a fresh crunch, and the crispy fries were a great touch. Loved the Frucci orange juice for a refreshing drink, and the milkshake was an indulgent treat. To top it off, the pancakes (or waffles) with powdered sugar and creamy topping were delightful. Overall, a super satisfying meal!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kathlyn O’ Callaghan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "Food is lovely and the staff are really friendly. I had lunch with my little nephew and they were very accommodating. Provided a high chair and a little cup for his water without having to ask. Highly recommend.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Derek allen Young", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "It is wonderful to hear that the drink has left such a positive impression on you. I am delighted that the milkshake has become a favorite of yours. Hopefully, you can continue to enjoy such a delightful treat. I am glad that you have had such a good experience.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Flying Irishman", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "9 months ago", "review_text": "Terrible terrible experience. Two TINY breakfasts made up of the cheapest of the cheap ingredients for €23.00 The table was sticky and visibly dirty, the coffee; watery and tepid and the worst of all, which we unfortunately only spotted when leaving, was actual rust on both the inside and outside of the milk jug. This place not only is disgusting but it's a genuine health hazard. Much better to use the Dunnes cafe which is literally back to back with this one and has a well priced breakfast with decent coffee.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Róisín", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I had the Caesar salad with a side of chips. It was awful. The chips were like the ones at at the end of the batch. The chicken was dry and there was a lot of fat on the bacon. The egg was stone cold (probably just out of the fridge). Staff weren’t too friendly. You have to get the cutlery yourself, the fork and knife had smear marks on them. I paid €20.20 for the Caesar salad, chips and a coke, a total rip off. Will not be returning.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "giorgio manzi", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "My father was not feeling well and almost blackingout .. we asked urgently for a water and a plain ham and cheese... we waited 15 minutes and paid 18€ for a complete breakfast we didn't even orderd.... and it was bad also..
There is a so much better place just next door.
Will never come here again.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "laura Healy", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "To put it simple, horrible! Couldn't enjoy my food as there was a hair in my wrap, flys near my seat and the first place I sat smelled like urine. I ended up moving seats but it really put me off the food when I got it. Prices are extortionate for what you get which is a shame because it looked like a decent place for a quick bite to eat. Would not be recommending to others.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Mairead Raymond", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Worse food ever I feel so sick after it all day stomach pain cramps bloated, two mini breakfast my mother had with me, the smell off food the oil it was made in must be putrid my mom asked what’s the smell. I got a bad tang of one bite sausage I left the whole lot there. Only ate the fried egg and toast, the worse food I ever ate I haven’t eaten in 7 hours after it in so much stomach pain. I had to take my mom to bathroom asap after it ripped her tummy apart..staff were pleasant nice restaurant but stay well away , waste of money and you suffer for it.. ROTTEN !", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Clare Sexton", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "On a wet Saturday morning my husband and I went into The Pantry Café in Merchant’s Quay for breakfast. We don’t eat meat, so I asked if we could just have eggs and toast. The girl said yes, but only scrambled was available. We ordered two portions with tea.

When it arrived, each plate was just one slice of toast with a small spoon of scrambled egg on top with some mini cherry tomatoes we did not ask for. The total came to €27.98 — I was shocked. I even asked if it was a mistake, but was told no, that was the correct price.

Nearly €28 for two teas, two slices of toast and a tiny bit of egg is outrageous. To make matters worse, we noticed the Dunnes café just outside offering a full breakfast with tea and toast for €5.50 each. If only we had seen that first.

It completely spoiled our morning. We won’t be back, and I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone who values fair prices and decent portions.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Puccino's Cafe
address: Unit 17, Douglas, Cork, T12 X8DF, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Mayara Mafra", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Definitely my favourite breakfast in Cork (or Ireland).
I'm not Irish, so this is definitely not something I grew up eating for breakfast/brunch, but my God, I love it now! 😅
It's amazing because the food is constant! I know exactly what I'm getting when I order! I love the "Build Your Own" option, cuz then I can choose my favorites! No leftovers 🤭🤭🤭", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Dahlia E. Akhaine", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I always have breakfast with my friend here whenever I’m in Cork. Very lovely staff and delicious food. We always go for the Eggs Benedict or Eggs Florentine and they have great vegetarian and vegan options too (my friend is vegetarian) I’ve tried the hot chocolate and coffee is good too. You’ll definitely want to try this place for breakfast or brunch. Worth it every time 💯", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kerry Butcher", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "A good place to get breakfast, with lots of options. I had a mini breakfast and it is served with coffee and toast.
There server's seat you and then you go to the counter to order. They have a surpriseing number of tables. I have been here twice, once on a Sunday morning and Saturday morning. I had no trouble getting a table for two. They also have tables for 4.
They also look like they have nice pastries, but I didn't try them.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Romeu Hayashi", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Great service, super clean, ok breakfast.

My wife and I went there for a breakfast, I had the eggs Florentine and she had the Scrambled eggs with toast and Bacon. The food was good but I think that, by needing to pay the coffee separately, it made the overall cost too expensive versus what we got €27.50 for two people (take a look at the pictures)

Definitely good place to try but I won’t come back for the breakfast at least, but would be willing to try lunch or brunch due to their very good customer service.

It would probably be excellent if", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eric Moore", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Got a full Irish it was fine some elements were nice others were okay, my main issue is not being able to swap out an egg for an extra sausage or even worse a second white pudding for a black pudding first time in my life I have come across this.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Dan Swan", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Shocking disgraceful quality for the price you pay half the breakfast cold but if you like deep fried dehydrated mushrooms on your breakfast this is the place for you", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Jefferson Bachtold", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Such a lovely experience at Puccinos! The food is delicious, always fresh and well prepared. The baristas and the whole team are super friendly and welcoming, and the management is very attentive too. Definitely a place you want to come back to. Highly recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Job Thomas", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Great place to sit and have good food. Friendly staff, ample seating is provided. Quick food delivery. Lots of options for breakfast", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Igor Araújo", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 2 years ago", "review_text": "If you're looking for a laid-back place to have lunch, this restaurant is worth checking out. Situated inside a shopping centre, it offers a convenient location for a quick bite. While the prices might be a little on the higher side, it's understandable considering the expenses that come with operating in such a prime location.

The menu at this restaurant is fantastic, boasting a wide selection of delicious dishes to satisfy diverse palates. However, one small suggestion would be to include pictures of the plates on the menu. This would be especially helpful for those who aren't familiar with the options or prefer a visual representation before making a decision. It can be a bit challenging to order quickly since you have to decide and place your order before finding a seat. The bustling queue behind you doesn't leave much time for contemplation or inquiries.

Despite these minor quirks, it's a great spot to enjoy a casual lunch. The food is of high quality, and the overall dining experience is enjoyable. So, go ahead and give it a try. Relax, indulge, and have a great time!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michelle Robbins", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "It's a nice cozy little place to grab a bite while you are in Douglas Mall, shopping. It's usually packed with people most of the time...specially during peak hours.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Amicus
address: Paul St, Centre, Cork, T12 WP97, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "A J (Lexi)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Went with the family on vacation. Parking deck just in front. Rather busy on a Saturday, not surprising! Good food, good gin tonic, nice decor. Had a lot of different options for the four of us with different tastes. Sept 7 2024.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ian Knight", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "We had the Sunday roast beef special. It came with Yorkshire Pudding stuffing and mashed potato. The meal was generous and well cooked however for the amount of food on the plate it needed more gravy than was served. This is a personal preference and when we spoke with one of the staff while payng he advised to air for more at no extra cost. We would definitely go back.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Gill Bann", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Nice menu, our initial waiter didn't tell us about the special boards, and was slightly abrupt, but the woman who seemed to take over from delivery to bill etc. was much more personable.
Food was ok, though there was an odd empty section on the plate.
Toilets are up two flights of stairs, so if you have some mobility issues, you might stick with the accessible loo on the ground floor.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Thomas Canacott", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Tasty food and lovely staff.
We went here whilst on a short break in Cork and it was so good we came back in the same week!
The staff were welcoming and very friendly from beginning to end, they were helpful with menu choices and recommendations.
The food was very tasty indeed, we had the chicken and mushroom pasta, lasagne and the fish and chips, all were amazing!
The staff (Maria B) recognised us on our second visit and was very welcoming. We then had Beppe on our second visit and he was also very friendly and both were great with the kids.
Prices were very reasonable out of the restaurants around, cheaper than Nandos and 100x better food!
Highly recommend on all levels. Thank you", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sotiris Giargavanis", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "The food was not too good not too bad
I get the celebration menu with 3 courses
Nachos was OK
The steak with county potatoes was very mediocre as food
And the dessert caramel pavlova was not too bad
I will rated with 2 stars but the waiter was really kind 🙏", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Niall Delaney", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "5 days ago", "review_text": "Got 2 pizzas and we had to wait 50 minutes for it. They came out hot but the dough was undercooked. Underside of pizza didn't look cooked, only warm. Visibly saw other people wait around for their food too.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Nikki Hanley", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "My kids ordered the pizza and pasta with tomato sauce. Probably the worst pizza I have eaten, it was like a cheap frozen pizza, we couldn't eat it. The kids pasta was also the worst, it was so dry and look like something from 2 days ago. It was a shame as my salad and sweet potato fries were nice. Really need to improve the quality of the kids food.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Noel Dillane", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Just had a super special - soup,1/2 BLT and scoop of ice cream for a tenner 😆 lovely food amazing price", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Diane’s Travel", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "Edited 5 months ago", "review_text": "Back to this lovely place,lovely salad.big portion.
When I’m in Cork city centre I always stop here especially for the breakfast options.
Today I chose hash breakfast.
Good option but the potatoes cubes felt like being fried the day before.maybe was just me.also a bit more spicing will be nice.
But I’ll always be back I like the place very much and also the stuff", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Glauco Vendrame", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Good place to enjoy a dinner or lunch with someone you love.

I went with my wife to celebrate our day and we were very well served, the waiters thought about the details, always leaving the table clean.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Sicilian Delights
address: Magazine Rd, The Lough, Cork, T12 VK61, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Mr Walsh", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "Stopped here for a coffee and the different smells of fresh foods were very tempting had I known that they sold not only Coffee but authentic Sicilian meals and sandwiches along with cakes and treats wines etc. I would off definitelytried some Focaccia. Small inside but has plenty of seatingb inside and outdoor seating. Nice interior nice staff and affordable prices, nice to see good prices in an area where there is a lot of students struggling as well as businesses. Next time I will have to try the food, enjoyed my large latte in comfort.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Chan Myae Khin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "I think i had my best coffee ever, the little pastry was so delicious that i can still remember how the first bite tasted. It made my whole day to be honest. The prices are also amazing and love to grab the coffee again!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "emma reynolds", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 days ago", "review_text": "AMAZING NAPOLI STYLE FOOD. Pretty good prices for this area and the service from Sonya was amazing. So accommodating and sweet! Also, the pizza chef Manuel did an amazing job. Pizza was delicious, satiating, fresh, and cooked very well, came out steaming hot!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "AJ Nagle", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "A nice few vegetarian options - would love to see something like chickpeas of meat replacements in some of the veggie dishes\nBut the tomato pomodoro dish is fantastic, super tasty\nIt gets incredibly busy around lunch time - lines out the door, that will show you how good the food is", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Meg Tarr", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "This little spot is an absolute treasure nestled into a neighborhood just south of UCC. It is truly authentic Sicilian coffee and cuisine, a delightful respite to sit in a peaceful ambiance and enjoy your coffee and snacks. From the baked goods to the coffee to the pastas and savory bites, I can’t say enough good about it. I love this place so much. Try it, you will not be disappointed. The owners are gracious and friendly. I love this spot!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Just a random weeb yay", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Amazing pastries, the best I've had in Ireland (that wasn't straight from a bakery). Great coffee too.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "yonghong chen", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "It's extremely delicious! The coffee is also good! The pistachio donut is highly recommended!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Danielle Manny", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Absolutely divine!!! Had the pleasure of trying their arancini at the Maitland Farmers Market today. We got there just before they closed. The gentleman told me to reheat it either air fryer or deep fry. As soon as we got home I couldn’t wait to make a marinara and pop those bad boys in the air fryer!!! They were sooooooo delicious!!! Thank you for sharing your amazing bites with us 😋♥️", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Aiden", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Best coffee I’ve had in cork during my 2 week visit and the best latte I’ve had ever. Lunch was great definitely be back if I’m in the area again.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Silvia Gil", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "We ordered for catering and it was an absolute success. Considering that I am Sicilian my standards are quite high but the service did not disappoint. All the guests loved the food. I would definitely recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Ryan's Bar
address: 43 N Main St, Centre, Cork, T12 CKP8, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Eugene Murphy", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Very nice pint of Coors enjoyed my evening there", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Nicholas Doyle", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "Great pub watched the football there ,nice and friendly  ,pints where great .", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Simon Jackson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "The best little family owned bar in town, well worth a visit 10/10", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Desmond Jordan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "A great place for a pint. Friendly staff", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Grace Tuomey", "user_id": null, "rating": 1, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Was treated like I was very drunk last night, felt very targeted and unreasonable considering I only had 2 drinks, wasn't acting the bollox, and I was socially aware. Lady came up to me to ask for ID although I was not ordering a drink, and told me she's not going to serve me, even though I am 21. She had no reason not to serve me or treat me like a drunk. Absolutely no reason.\n\nI will happily take my business elsewhere and proceeded to do so last night. Appalling treatment.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Anthony O sullivan", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "11 months ago", "review_text": "Unfortunately ryans do not do food but friendly staff and if you want a good pint it's the place to go to and the beamish is the best cork drink in a cork bar", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "John Roche", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Nice old fashioned pub near the heart of Cork City. Always warm and comfortable. No food, just great pints and a great atmosphere.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Stephen O Regan", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "It's an Irish Bar on North Main street Cork City! First time here fine big bar plenty space wide range of Alcoholic beverages served daily here! Small smoking area nice clean Bar nice staff! It doesn't look much from the front but a nice pleasant and welcoming atmosphere! Wide TVs for watching all kinds of Sports live here!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "John OConnell", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Lovely friendly bar and a great pint.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Sean Aherne", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "10 months ago", "review_text": "True cork pub no frills, great smooth pint. Great banter and a laugh with the locals, great service.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Mango Cafe & Shop
address: Brookfield, College Rd, University College, Cork, T12 DE0A, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "Arminator", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "This place was so tuff. I went in to get a mango cappuccino for only a a dollar and 67 cents. They gave me a quarter off which was sigma. Then I got their Mango Diddyblud cake with a side of 41 masons. Would come again for a haircut", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Eric Lucking", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Pop in to grab a coffee after a swim on most Tuesday mornings. Always have pleasant staff working there", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "eddie dullea", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Great service, nice staff, lovely grub..", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paul Dorney", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "Great food in an relaxing atmosphere,", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "PH", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "Their hours are so bad now", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Ruth M", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "Edited 7 months ago", "review_text": "I often pop in here for a coffee or tea or a soup to while away a half hour. My only issue is the condition of the toilet. It's clean enough but seat-less which isn't a good look.\nThey have facilitated ordering from your table which is convenient.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Wayne McConnell", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Good old style cafe.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Michael O Callaghan", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "6 years ago", "review_text": "Very nice very friendly and good service", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Paul Hackett", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Lovely place for grub ,coffee and a chat", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Conor Clarke", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Excellent food good value", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Thomond Bar
address: 2 Marlboro St, Centre, Cork, Ireland
reviews_data: [{"username": "A J (Lexi)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Amazing place. I heard the music walking down the street and was drawn in. The band was incredibly talented. They blended the music so well it was hard to tell when they switched songs. Great tracks from Abba, Elvis, Black Eyed Peas etc but in an acoustic version. I wish I had got the name of the band. We were there last Saturday. I had this bar on my list for Cork and had somehow crossed it off as if we had been there already. So glad fate had us walk by. In my top 5 favorites!! The music was the best in all Cork that night. Oh and cherry on top: they have Beamish!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "George W.", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "We stopped in for a brew and rested our feet from walking. Many beers and ciders are offered on tap. I enjoyed the Rockshore Lager. It was very refreshing. The staff were friendly and helpful. Sports aplenty showing in the TVs. I would love to visit again.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Ruth Kershaw", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Absolutely delicious Irish food, both of us would rate our meals 11/10, it was that good. Atmosphere was great and staff were lovely. I wish I could order the food to England! Highly recommend visiting.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Wayne Phair", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "A fantastic Irish bar full of character! Great selection of ales and plenty of food choices to suit everyone. The staff were really welcoming and up for a good laugh, which made the atmosphere even better. Perfect spot whether you’re after a proper meal, just a quick stop-off after some shopping, or even a cosy escape from the rain. Highly recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Heather Lynn Cournoyer", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "6 months ago", "review_text": "The atmosphere was fun! Very lively and busy on St. Patrick’s Day weekend! The staff was attentive and took our order right away, but unfortunately the food left much to desire. I ordered the bacon and cabbage and it was unusually tasteless and bland. I was very underwhelmed and didn’t even finish half of it. My husband ordered the fish and chips, which should’ve been a safe bet, you would think. The fish portion was huge, which was exciting at first, however, when we started eating the giant fish fillet, we found the batter was mushy inside and ruined the entire dish, sadly. We had a couple of Guinness beers and enjoyed the atmosphere, but less disappointed with the food.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "ben fairfield", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Best food I’ve had after 10 days in Ireland. Recommend cottage pie for sure.\nGood atmosphere and portions. Beer pricey but it is everywhere.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "LullahPie", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Really nice place ! We had a breakfast for dinner, we were just a bit sad that we weren't seated with the rest of the bar, but it was nice ! Cheap option, it was the small breakfast too but it was more than enough !", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Herwin", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Superb bar with a big terasse and a good atmosphere.\nI can definitively recommend the irish breakfast if you're starting your day or the afternoon.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Amanda Widick", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "We got the full Irish breakfast and the Irish beef & Guinness stew and oh my goddess I have never had a more flavorful and filling stew in my life! The food is incredible, the service is outstanding; and the vibes feel like you’re a local. Highly recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Mary Alice Miller", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "7 months ago", "review_text": "Great live music. Friendly service. Plenty of seating, TVs, etc.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: Costa
address: 6 Emmett Pl, Centre, Cork, T12 W923, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Jiaan Cui", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "Came to drink Costa with friends again, I still drink American, and she tried the cute new product! We talked for an afternoon, she wanted to be a flight attendant in the future, and I wanted to continue in the coffee industry. I hope we have a bright future ahead of us.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "omkar kale", "user_id": null, "rating": 3, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Coffee is not that hot from the machine.
Steaming just removed the flavour.
Ambience is good for a date. No variety of sweets like bean n leaf. Available sweets are okay but feel a bit pricy for the the taste/quantity/quality", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "aishat", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Love their iced whipped lattes but the place is always so loud with the music and coffee machines so you have to shout your order and hope that they get it right.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "仏陀笑う", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "I went Cork for the for time and always when I in the new city, I’m visiting some cafe for lovely cappuccino. Specifically this one is valuable for friendly staff and their quick work. What a nice guys, everybody smiling, putting you extra chocolate in your coffee and just making your time spending pleasurable.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Halit Karabina", "user_id": null, "rating": 2, "date": "2 weeks ago", "review_text": "I haven’t had coffee anywhere else but Costa for a long time, but I have to say this: your team is really very amateur. Maybe it’s not their fault, but they do everything wrong. I just wanted to let you know :) If you’d like, I can help you with this free of charge :) Because this is not normal.", "sentiment": "Bad"}, {"username": "Giorgio Berardi", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "a year ago", "review_text": "I was here twice before reading some of the recent very bad reviews, but I must admit I found the place pleasant overall. It is large enough to guarantee you'll always find seating space, except perhaps at peak times.
The coffee I had was good, and priced in line with the other coffee chains in town.", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Maurice Foley", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "I love Costa coffee, but the last time I went for a cappuccino, the milk was a bit flat and wattery, so a little disappointed", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Laura Alonso Vigo", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 years ago", "review_text": "Is it a bit pricey? Maybe. Do they have really nice chocolates that not only are really tasty but they even look good on photo? Definitely.
I love this place for a little guilty Sunday pleasure.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "김재이", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 years ago", "review_text": "You can enjoy delicious coffee with kind staff. We often go for coffee.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Lucija", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 years ago", "review_text": "Delicious coffee, really polite and fast staff and lovely ambient. I recommend you to try their vanilla coconut latte and lemon muffin.", "sentiment": "Good"}]

name: The Hi-B Bar
address: 108 Oliver Plunkett St, Centre, Cork, T12 E6CX, Ireland
reviews_data:
[{"username": "Sally laret", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "6 days ago", "review_text": "Absolutely loved this spot. The bartender, Juan, was not only incredibly skilled but also genuinely kind — made us feel right at home. The small, intimate atmosphere added to the charm, and the bar’s unique no phone and “please” policy was a refreshing touch. It encouraged real conversation and a bit of old-school courtesy you don’t often see anymore. Can’t recommend it enough for anyone looking for a more thoughtful, personal experience in the city.
(Juan let me break the phone policy to take a photo. Not only did he say yes, but he joined us in the photo)
Came alway from Alaska for this experience! Would recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Jeff Love (Jeff Love)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "2 months ago", "review_text": "Take some time to be encouraged to put your cell phone away, then meet and talk to people. Bartenders here are fantastic.  I prefer the spot by the window or sitting at the bar.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Anna Mykhailova", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "Amazing atmosphere, friendly staff and nice pints ! Good whisky and gin selection.", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "chefjj69", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a week ago", "review_text": "I absolutely loved this bar.  Small, cozy and zero cell phones!  Great service from a super friendly and knowledgeable bartender.  Turned me onto some new whiskey choices.  Highly recommend!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "A J (Lexi)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "a month ago", "review_text": "One of my favorites in Cork! We spent a day here and I tried to hit up as many places with Beamish that I could fit! We did Fri & Sat night. (Dont be a dork like me and take a pic inside...I had to get a pic though!) This very sweet older man was sitting next to me. He spoke about his younger years playing rugby and harvesting barley for Beamish. He was a pleasure to chat with. I came back the second night but was too late. He was leaving just as I arrived and the lone barwoman was overwhelmed.

Other favorites: The Raven was another quiet one, with nooks to disappear into. Thomond and Welcome Inn had the best music.

P.s. Chat with the older guys if you love Ireland. They'll tell you about a country you'll never get to witness. " I'll remember you forever "", "sentiment": "Mixed"}, {"username": "Dennis In Breda (deto69)", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 weeks ago", "review_text": "Such a lovely place. The "don't use your phone" works so well (as it should be). Everybody is happily chatting with each other", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Kevin Crowley", "user_id": null, "rating": 4, "date": "4 months ago", "review_text": "Cosy little bar with great old school rules. No phones was always the main rule pushed by the previous owner and it really works a treat. Lovely atmosphere in here and ended up talking to couples sat around us just having a laugh. As it should be", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Barry Garceau", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "5 months ago", "review_text": "Been there twice.  Only had two trips to Cork, and Hi-B was a must-see according to my hosts.  I was not disappointed.  I've been to several Hibernian clubs here in the U.S., and so I felt "at home" here.  If ever I'm in Cork again, I will be sure to indulge in a pint or two, and join along with the singing that seems to spring from nowhere.  Fun place!", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Chris Johnson", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "3 months ago", "review_text": "Great place to get away from the busy outside shopping and enjoy a classic stout", "sentiment": "Good"}, {"username": "Puntie P", "user_id": null, "rating": 5, "date": "8 months ago", "review_text": "Always a good spot when in cork. Pints are some of the best in cork city. Bar staff sound. No phones allowed. What more can ye ask for!", "sentiment": "Good"}]
